name: FollowMyHealth®
description: Take control of your health information. The new and improved mobile version of your personal health record, powered by FollowMyHealth®, is easy to use and easy to navigate.   From the home screen, you can view your current health summary, reminders and recent account activity—and quickly click to your medical profile and profiles of family members you’re authorized to view. You also get 24/7 access for:   • Communicating securely with your care team.  • Scheduling appointments. • Viewing test and lab results.  • Requesting prescription refills. • Managing your preferred pharmacy for prescription renewals. • Managing connections with healthcare organization to access your health information and interact with providers. • Paying outstanding bills and view your billing history. • Viewing and manage your demographics, contact information, and insurance policies.  (Please note: The availability of some features may be dependent on your connected organizations.)  Take full advantage of the modern iOS features such as:  • Passcodes and Touch ID: Create a Mobile Passcode or use Touch ID to quickly and easily sign in to FollowMyHealth® Mobile. Touch ID requires iOS 8 and up. Mobile Passcode will work on any iOS device.  • Apple Health: Automatically import upload blood pressure, weight and glucose readings from Apple Health into your FollowMyHealth® account.  • Push Notifications: In addition to receiving FollowMyHealth® notifications via text and/or email, notifications can now be pushed directly to your iOS device. App badges notify you at a glance of important new information within your FollowMyHealth® account.   • Apple Watch: Convenient access to FollowMyHealth® push notifications and Action Center items directly from your Apple Watch.  • Apple VoiceOver: Improves accessibility for visually impaired users.

helpful_reviews.title: Constantly crashes, worthless customer support
helpful_reviews.author: Bugaboo06
helpful_reviews.content: When I first got this app a couple of years ago, it worked great. Sometime last year, it suddenly started crashing as soon as I logged in. I could see my information momentarily, and then it would just close. I reinstalled it twice, I installed updates, nothing helped. So I contacted customer service. But instead of listening to me, they treated me like a moron, as though I must never have seen a piece of technology created in the last half-century. They insisted I reinstall it again. They insisted I didnâ€™t know how to properly install an app (I guess tapping a button that says install is confusing for some....). They refused to acknowledge that the problem might be a bug in their software. They told me to try it on a different device. (I did, by the way, and it didnâ€™t work any better on my iPad than it did on my phone.) They went back to the brilliant summation that I must be installing it wrong. Unfortunately, my doctorâ€™s office insists on using this platform for most communication. I guess I installed them wrong, too? Update: The developers continue to do nothing to fix the app, although they did offer the extraordinarily helpful suggestion that I contact my medical provider to resolve the problem with *their* software. This makes tons of sense. In fact, I always contact my GP when I have computer issues. Iâ€™m sure he can fix this, too!

helpful_reviews.title: Not very good
helpful_reviews.author: charisma1372
helpful_reviews.content: If this app worked consistently and the way it is supposed to work it would be amazing, but I have had many problems with this app. After having major heart surgery, I downloaded it only for the convenience of being able to â€œeasilyâ€� pay my bills. Immediately after downloading, I wasnâ€™t able to even view my bills, much less make payments, so I contacted customer service. Once they finally straightened everything out after a few weeks, I was able to make one monthâ€™s worth of payments. Now, each time I try to pay an invoice, I receive an error message that says the payment provider cannot be contacted ... whatever that means. Of course when I call the phone number to try to pay, I donâ€™t get an answer. Iâ€™m not sure if there is a disconnect between the app and the actual doctorsâ€™ offices or what, but this app has been pretty much nothing but aggravation for me. Also, I donâ€™t know if it is supposed to automatically update but my insurance changed 5 months ago and that still hasnâ€™t been reflected in my patient information. I understand that doctors are busy etc etc etc but this app has certainly not done much to make it easier for me to keep track of my records and bills.

helpful_reviews.title: Need further treatment/answer
helpful_reviews.author: tangosiggybootsie
helpful_reviews.content: Until I return to AZ in Dec, I will have to walk on this painful left foot in the meantime.  The Dr stated there could possibly be a tendon surgery at a later date that could help.  I was given a low dose steroid injection which helped enough to reduce the bursting pain while I slept.  The Dr thought I could try another low dose injection.  When I contacted the office I was prescribed a round of over the counter steroids.  He had already prescribed these for me the month before.  My primary care Dr had recently prescribed this same prescription for my foot.  Neither round of these prescriptions gave me any relief so I did not pick up the third Rx.  Iâ€™m wearing a brace on that leg that fits in a certain shoe several hours a day that is supposed to help.  However, it does make the bottom of my foot quite sore, even with padding.  I did not get an answer as to where or what I should do next or if he wants to still try another low dose injection or if there is just nothing else BUT possible surgery later and the risks and gains of that.  I leave for Ohio on May 16.        Please someone answer me.     J. Brucksieker

helpful_reviews.title: Intrusive, and doesnâ€™t work
helpful_reviews.author: Bykr Bayb
helpful_reviews.content: After I signed up, and entered all my personal information, I went about a month before needing to log in again. By then, I had forgotten my password. I toggled through all my usual passwords, and variations of them. Finally I clicked the â€œforgot passwordâ€� option. It sent me an email to reset my password. I followed the instructions and reset my password. When I tried to log in with my new password, I got an error message, stating there was a problem logging in. So I sent a message through the app to customer support. When I sent it, the app said they had sent me an email to confirm receipt of my message, and they would get back to me. I never got the email. I checked my junk folder. I checked the screenshot I took of the message I had sent, and confirmed that I gave them my correct email address. Today I sent them another message through the app. Again I got the message that they had sent me an email. Again, no email. They have all of my most personal health information, but I donâ€™t. I learned a costly lesson this time.

helpful_reviews.title: So far, so good!
helpful_reviews.author: Kedoublely
helpful_reviews.content: I've been using this app for over a year now and I haven't had any issue with it. I mainly use it to check on my test/lab results, to view messages from my doctor's office, and remind myself of upcoming scheduled appointments. My doctor's office must be pretty quick at uploading results and newly scheduled appointments into the app, because the app always seems to be updated with the latest info whenever I check. As for complaints, I haven't had any issues with long "loading" time of results like some of the reviewers have mentioned. And after having read someone else's review, now I know I can change my log-in settings to make it quicker for me to log in with 'touch verification' or a 4-digit passcode. That will save a little time in the long run ğŸ˜Œ

helpful_reviews.title: Health Records
helpful_reviews.author: Imoofu
helpful_reviews.content: The ease of access and navigation makes this a great app! The updated information is easily accessed and ready for your personal needs at any given time/place.  You can have multiple accounts on this app so if you have children and are constantly at the mercy of doctorâ€™s offices to get you your childrenâ€™s information, letâ€™s say for school records or anything of that nature, you now have the ease of accessing this information yourself and can easily print out selected information based on individual needs.  Only downside is select providers are available and if you have a different provider that isnâ€™t using this platform then obviously this app wonâ€™t be much use.

helpful_reviews.title: Needs some work
helpful_reviews.author: Maker of lists
helpful_reviews.content: Pros (+) & Cons (-). (+) I like the app better than the online site. (+) I love being able to access my lab results to view a few days after they are drawn (-) but you can only print one (1) result ie WBC, RBC, not a full CBC at a time and all of the labs may not be on your portal. I would like to be able to print all labs for a specific date for other doctors I see & my personal records. (-) Other test, CXR, US etc donâ€™t usually show up on the portal. (+)  I love â€œMessageâ€�. Being able to send a non-emergent message for answers to your questions or request a refill for meds with a message then receive a message back usually within 24hrs is great. (-) Reminders on the home page never go away & there seems to not go away so reminders over 1 - 1 1/2 years.

helpful_reviews.title: Rating of spine and wellness in Camilus Ny..
helpful_reviews.author: 1111mary
helpful_reviews.content: When my Dr told me she wanted me to go there I didnâ€™t want to!! I cried and said I donâ€™t want that Label, She said Mary Beth itâ€™s not like that and ya know itâ€™s not!!! They could not of been nicer to me.. yes I have to follow some rules.. but thatâ€™s ok I will be able to take my pain medicine with out any problems.. The NP and nurseâ€™s were really very nice. They donâ€™t treat you like a addict they treat you Like a patient that has to unfortunately take a Narcotic.. they really understand.. I had to put a call in to the NP that is taking care of me.. the pain med isnâ€™t working that good.. and the nurse was very patient with me and she said it would probably be morning before they got back to me.. they are so very busy. Thank you Mary Beth Huey...

helpful_reviews.title: No notifications, must re-enter credentials
helpful_reviews.author: JoeSurfage
helpful_reviews.content: This app could be great, but it's missing two :  1) It keeps forcing you to re-login - what a pain!  And not just the password, but both the email address and password.  It should save the credentials for you.  It's on a smart phone after all - even the browser saves your credentials.  If they truly believe they need another layer of login, they could at least implement touch-ID.  2) No notifications/badges - most apps will a) notify you when you receive a new message and b) add a badge to the app icon with the number of unread messages.  This app does not.  Instead, I get an email and have to know to go open this app and hunt around for the message - or, I can just click the link in the email and it'll open the web page where I can log in and see the message.

helpful_reviews.title: Very helpful to me.
helpful_reviews.author: SunflowerAngel's
helpful_reviews.content: Sure there's a few problems with the app but I can deal with it. However I have several medical issues and mental issues also and am on 17 medications and without this app I would lose my mind and not be able to keep up. I find it very helpful and when I need to communicate with the office it's so easy and their response time is fast and not like when you call them and have to wait and wait for a call back. I love being able to keep track of my vitals and getting reminders of test I need to do. SO try to overlook the small hic ups in the app and discover all the good in it. Sincerely a grateful patient.

helpful_reviews.title: Good way to keep up with your doctor visits and results.
helpful_reviews.author: kevannie
helpful_reviews.content: Other than being a little confusing on the start-up (hence the 4 stars), this is a pretty good app to follow along with your doctor visits and see the results.  What would make it a really terrific app would be if one could access their x-rays and MRIs via this app. Not that one would actually know what one was looking at, but being able to see the â€œpicturesâ€� could help one with understanding what was going on inside their body, what was bad, how to treat it and how the treatment would be done. Like the old saying goes, â€œA picture is worth 1,000 words.â€� Understanding what the picture shows the doctor is worth another 1,000, at least.

This app has really been helpful to me and I donâ€™t know what I would do without it! Excellent app!

helpful_reviews.title: I get more knowledge and dumb questions answered about my health
helpful_reviews.author: bg2958
helpful_reviews.content: If I could give it ten stars I would. I'm a normal Joe who hates impersonal technology. But this one works incredibly well. If I don't understand a test I just click on it and it goes into greater detail. If I'm worried about what else could be wrong it has a section for that.   I know my doc is really busy so this lets me do it myself. When this first came out I hated it because I wanted to talk to my doctor. When I finally spent a few minutes with it I realized it's easy to get my questions answers and  I'm now much better prepared to do the right things doesn't health.

helpful_reviews.title: First Patient Portal that works!
helpful_reviews.author: Islenya
helpful_reviews.content: Iâ€™ve [tried to] use two different patient portals from two different providers prior to this one: they were worthless!  My info was incomplete, incorrect, it was always a hassle to log in, and I had no way to input information or message the provider.  This app works beautifully in every way (so far).  I was able to view my extremely complete medical history; I noted two small incorrect items (negligible, really) that I messaged my provider about, using this app.  I actually got a pleasant answer (!!) and the items were corrected!  I hope it stays this good!  I am pleased.

helpful_reviews.title: Very Helpful App
helpful_reviews.author: Skycabbi
helpful_reviews.content: As I get older and need more medical attention than in the past, I'm finding this app very helpful. Each time I have a test done or a doctor visit, it is added to my account. Recently, I had an annual blood test and was able to review the results prior to discussing with my doctor, therefore I was better prepared to ask questions. The app also allows me to read clinical summaries from past office visits,  future scheduled appointments, keeps record of prescriptions, and has an easy link to email my doctors. I have had no technical issues with the app that others have reported.

helpful_reviews.title: No problems!
helpful_reviews.author: Grammikaren
helpful_reviews.content: It is nice to be able to access my records, notify the staff of corrections or changes in my information.  I especially like being able to send a quick note to ask a question when it's not urgent.  I think the app may be dependent on what features your physician's office activates, but everything appears to be active and usable in mine.  Annoying would be if your doc's staff doesn't keep tabs on prescription refills and messages, but that has. It been an issue for me.  The app itself works very well and is easy to navigate.

helpful_reviews.title: Update: no Longer Crashes Repeatedly and May Not Be Secure
helpful_reviews.author: JSC iTunes iPhone Guy
helpful_reviews.content: This is a follow-up to my poor review a number of weeks ago. I was able to create a FMH logon/PW and disconnect from signing in using my Google ID/PW. Once I did that, FMH worked correctly on my laptop and iPhone/iPad. The application hasn't crashed on any of my devices and I'm satisfied, for now, with the secure FMH login I created.   2nd Uodate: Now Great  Application has improved substantially since it was first introduced. The app provides convenient access to your health information which is  easy to find and easy to use. Five star rating.

helpful_reviews.title: Thank you
helpful_reviews.author: KotaRae02
helpful_reviews.content: I really love this! The medical world is unorganized as it is simply from the one offs within our diverse race. This app not only summarized my medical history so I can understand and reference it but it also allows me to connect 1:1 with my doctors. The fact I can communicate with my doctor by sending a message means so much more to me than I can explain. Itâ€™s scary and stressful when things arenâ€™t well and doctors are supposed to be there to help make it more comfortable and this allows them to do so. Makes clients feel like people and not numbers. Thank you!

helpful_reviews.title: Wonderful health app
helpful_reviews.author: Pat1010pat
helpful_reviews.content: Iâ€™m really enjoying being able to access health records and see upcoming appointments. I have also used the email when I forgot what the doctor had said, and she responded! The records are limited to diagnoses and medications mostly, but maybe that is because we have not had labs done through these providers yet. Also, there arenâ€™t many providers I can access through this platform yet. I would like to see what the health tools are also, but our provider does not use that feature. Overall Iâ€™m impressed and glad to have this access and communication.

helpful_reviews.title: My experience
helpful_reviews.author: hbHolly B.
helpful_reviews.content: From the time of entering the Doctors office I got a very warm easy going feeling. The receptionists were kind, smiling and knew just what they were doing. The young lady who came for me to take me back to the room to see Doctor Duros was very sweet kind and nice and talked to me like I mattered which I must say most people treat you like your a waste of their time. The meeting with Doctor Duros was very pleasant . He wanted to know how I was doing and help with the problems I was experiencing , which he did in a professional manner. My entire time was nice and most important I felt at ease.

helpful_reviews.title: Excellent!
helpful_reviews.author: jackahlq451
helpful_reviews.content: I use Follow My Health and love it!  The feature that I like the most is the ability to send and receive messages with my doctor or nurse practitioner, this is wonderful as I do not have to have the time to be on hold with their busy office, or play phone tag trying to receive my reply.  The app also allows me to provide information to other doctors if they have a question about test results from other doctors, reminds me when I need to schedule an appointment, when my last appointment was, and much much more.

helpful_reviews.title: Really Good With One Major Bug
helpful_reviews.author: Dave from Asheville
helpful_reviews.content: It does everything you want it to do so Iâ€™ll keep my review to itâ€™s one major flaw.  In three separate occasions Iâ€™ve messaged my doctor usually on a weekend and they havenâ€™t received the message when Iâ€™ve checked back in the app.  There is no automatic â€œyour message didnâ€™t go throughâ€� email sent to your logon email address.  So If you never checked back you might be waiting forever for a response from your doctor when In fact they never got it.  Who continually checks back to see if itâ€™s messages went through on an app?

helpful_reviews.title: A Great Way To Keep Track of Your Medical/Health Info
helpful_reviews.author: Gigantor The Space Age Robot
helpful_reviews.content: In addition to keeping track of my medical and other health information, I also use it to communicate with my Primary Care Physician, and to keep a personal medical journal. My PCP is pretty diligent about updating her findings after my yearly exams. And she ensures that the lab results are uploaded promptly with her comments or other explanations included.  Not all the specialists I have visited within my healthcare system use FollowMyHealth, but those who do are sending a signal to their patients that they care.

helpful_reviews.title: So convenient
helpful_reviews.author: coleventure
helpful_reviews.content: This app is so helpful to have. It keeps me from procrastinating on checking in on results or making appointments because I can literally do it anywhere. You have access to the details of your test results at all times and they include links to what each thing means. Writing my doctor/triage nurse is insanely helpful and they get back to me right away. Renewing prescriptions is a breeze. This app has really just brought medical services to a whole new level and really encourages education and awareness!

helpful_reviews.title: No problems so far. Amazingly convenient
helpful_reviews.author: spreidy856
helpful_reviews.content: This app has made communicating with my doctors offices very efficient and easy. I don't have to spend time in phone menu hell and being put on hold forever. It even tracks my appointments. I especially like the postings of lab results and other clinical data. This is very helpful for when I go into my next appointment, so the doctor and I are on the same page. Sure, the developers of the app should always strive to improve the utility and functionality of the app.

helpful_reviews.title: The Good/Bad of FMH App (from my perspective: a total I-Phone User-never at my Desk Computer!)
helpful_reviews.author: gradymonsterğŸ˜ˆ
helpful_reviews.content: ..note Iâ€™m a recent user of FMH, further 72 yrs young (thatâ€™s why Iâ€™m â€œon the goâ€� w the I-Phone...not playing video games on computerğŸ¤£)...not very â€œcomputer literateâ€�!..with that said, it IS CUMBERSOME to enter the App, wait-wait-wait for the lil 3/8 hp I-Phone to download all that history, and then finally see the â€œcurrent test resultsâ€� or â€œlatest communication from doctorâ€�...it is still a STEP-UP from Phone Calls/Employees in a bad mood, etc., etc. for whatever this is worth,  Grady W. Reed (a very appreciative patient of St. Joseph Healthcare Systems)

helpful_reviews.title: Great app
helpful_reviews.author: scottyo3921
helpful_reviews.content: I love this app, putting (almost) all my medical records together in one place, along with recommendations and my own personal observations. One minor issue: I recently received what looks like a four page scanned document, with an index to the pages. I have to read each page and then go back to the page index and tap the next one. It would be nice if I could have a next page and previous page button in each page. Otherwise, this app is wonderful

helpful_reviews.title: Great App!
helpful_reviews.author: lousluz
helpful_reviews.content: I'm grateful for such a wonderful app. I feel like I would be in the dark until my next appointment without the FMH app. The only reason I didn't give the FMH app five stars is sometimes it takes forever to load information. I'll click on something and the little progress wheel will spin for a full half of a minute sometimes. It might sound like a small inconvenience, but those seconds add up with each test result. I do have to say though that with each update there are improvements. Keep up the great work! Thank you!

helpful_reviews.title: Great if your doctor uses it
helpful_reviews.author: LAtrojan
helpful_reviews.content: The app itself has improved a lot, itâ€™s now easier for me to use it than going to the website. For me the best feature is messaging with your doctorâ€™s office, to ask questions, make appointments etc. Itâ€™s also nice to get lab results right away rather than having to listen to them read off on the phone. The only downside - not the appâ€™s fault - is that only some doctors use it, and sometimes offices put in inaccurate information.

helpful_reviews.title: Great for keeping up with healthcare
helpful_reviews.author: Katie Sioux
helpful_reviews.content: This app is used by the group of health professionals that I use for my healthcare needs. It gives me access to test results, current and past Rxâ€™s, appointments past and in the future, and a communication avenue directly to my physician via in-app email directly to the provider. I donâ€™t have to keep reminders everywhere, just check the app to see my appointment schedule. I highly recommend this app. It may take some getting used to but is worth it.

helpful_reviews.title: Makes it easy to connect to my providers
helpful_reviews.author: Angela_Nichole
helpful_reviews.content: I really enjoy this app because I can see results of any labs/tests that have been done. I enjoy that I can message my providers and receive a response without always needing to call the office. I feel the app is user friendly and I have no issues using it. Iâ€™ve never experienced a crash with it and enjoy the sense of privacy I have when opening/closing the app even with it being on my mobile device.

helpful_reviews.title: Health Journalist
helpful_reviews.author: Hollybajdmamph
helpful_reviews.content: This portal is beyond awesome. It is the most advanced in the industry. You can request a refill on a prescription, you get a reminder of your appointments, you get to communicate back and forth with your physicians. Moreover, it holds your health data, your test results, your weight, your blood pressure, your fasting blood sugar, cholesterol, both good and bad, and your inflammation. Thus, should you go to Medstar or Georgetown for care for some reason, you can bring your records with you by bringing up this portal.

helpful_reviews.title: Follow My Health is great!
helpful_reviews.author: DaniLace
helpful_reviews.content: I am very thankful for Follow My Health. Using this app has made communication between my Doctor and I flawless. I can see all of my visit information easily. And, my Doctor has been able to send me messages to notify me of test results and what I need to do next.  I was very apprehensive at first, but I loved the app immediately. It is very easy to navigate and update my information, such as my preferred pharmacy change.  Thank you Sharp Healthcare for offering this service!

helpful_reviews.title: Extremely convenient
helpful_reviews.author: Schlukler
helpful_reviews.content: Was referred by my mom to get this app since she's been using it for a while now. It's incredibly useful if you need to look at any allergies you may have been diagnosed with and couldn't remember the name of, or if listing names of current/past medications. I highly recommend this app for absolutely anyone who goes to a primary physician. Would be helpful if you could add multiple people to one account (if a parents wants their child's records).

helpful_reviews.title: Portal access
helpful_reviews.author: VW2009
helpful_reviews.content: I absolutely love the fact that I can go on the portal and look at test results, email the doctor, ask for refills, schedule appointments, etc.... I can do absolutely everything that I need and at any time of the day. I donâ€™t have to wait until the office opens, nor do I have to wait online for ever until somebody picks up. This makes it such a more relaxing and positive experience. I have yet to find anything negative about this at all.

helpful_reviews.title: Somewhat convenient
helpful_reviews.author: fuzzydana
helpful_reviews.content: It's nice to have the app to manage incoming messages and appointment changes. Two things are a bit of a hassle:  1. Although I paid a bill, it is still showing an unpaid balance months later. The office is on their side everything looks paid. So I'm not sure if it's something buggy with the app that is not updating the payment. 2. I wish we could do fingerprint sign in or used stored credentials, because it's a pain to manually login every time I need to check something.

helpful_reviews.title: One of the best medical apps I've come across
helpful_reviews.author: Puzzled Up
helpful_reviews.content: This app helps me stay sane. When I run out of my meds, I can send a quick refill request knowing the staff will respond quickly.  When I need to schedule and appointment but the phone is ringing off the hook at work and I can't get catch a break, I request an appointment date and time and boom, it's done.  My chart is always up to date and I can sync the app with apple health which is helpful.  Overall, this app is the best!

helpful_reviews.title: Great app!
helpful_reviews.author: E-T-C
helpful_reviews.content: Works perfect with my organization!  I find it amusing that my phone alerts me that my health information has been updated while Iâ€™m sitting in the doctors office or standing at the counter making an appointment. :) And I love having access to all my information when I need it. If you have issues, check with your organization to make sure they fully support app integration into their electronic health system.

helpful_reviews.title: Easy access
helpful_reviews.author: Lee O Moore
helpful_reviews.content: At first I wasnâ€™t crazy about signing up for another Patient Portal as the last one I participated in was confusing, complicated and too many passwords for different providers. When I was invited to participate again I thought it would be nice to have access to my medical records. At first, like anything, I had to learn about it and then with some trial and error found this app is really easy and has all my providers in one!! Iâ€™m glad I accepted the invitation and tried it out.

helpful_reviews.title: It's very well thought out, minor tweaking
helpful_reviews.author: C Holdz, Heights-to-YO
helpful_reviews.content: Great app, allows you to view your profile and even mail Dr directly, not anything NEW but the other features are useful (and you can edit)...only issue may be administrative or bureaucratic as my place is an all inclusive group (read BIG, I'm in NYC), so everyone is in my group but sometimes one doesn't update and/or the program doesn't alert of overlap and I had to reschedule a few times because of it .... otherwise 5/5, sure

helpful_reviews.title: My connection
helpful_reviews.author: FauxarealHair
helpful_reviews.content: I love the ability to email my physician and his nurses.  Not having to sit on a phone waiting for an answer.  I love being able to see ALL my charts, my lab works and suggestions.  They are quick to answer any of my needs or concerns.  Dr Allas and his team are my health and wellness home!  The only thing that needs to change would be the ability to cancel or request an appointment.  Thank you for this service!

helpful_reviews.title: Great Great Great!
helpful_reviews.author: Ilandloper
helpful_reviews.content: I can not stress enough how this app has changed my life. I have alot of health issues. I can open this and get test results even before my Dr. Instead of being on hold I can jot off a message to a provider. All of my medications and appointments in one place. This has streamlined my health care. I chose to give my family access so if I have a problem they can look it up and  be aware of what is going on.

helpful_reviews.title: Needs improvement on updates
helpful_reviews.author: CHToledoGradTrk
helpful_reviews.content: My wife and I have found that when we receive a phone message that mission Hurtes group has approved a request that the provider or the actual approval and print does not appear on our portal until much later than the phone call. Usually we are called by the provider staff that they have received the approval before we do. In general the information updated by our care providers is usually two or three weeks after the visit or lab results.

helpful_reviews.title: Love It!
helpful_reviews.author: bcwyattrnbsn
helpful_reviews.content: I think being an RN helps with accessing the  "Follow My Health" Mobile app. I know what to look for and where inside, so I know how to maneuver from one section to another. I love being able to add a med I may have forgotten to list at my physicians office, or add an allergy...which is very important! I also like sending my physician an email on this venue, he can respond and I can view his answer. I can't do this with any other physician. Five Stars!!!

helpful_reviews.title: Easy access to doctor
helpful_reviews.author: Blondegrl26
helpful_reviews.content: If I have a question about a non emergency issues, instead of calling and leaving a message I can type it out. They get the message and can call or write back. My doctor left me a quick message through this app and I had it to easily reference later. All my apts are available at the click of a button. I can schedule and cancel on this app. Love it!!!

helpful_reviews.title: Must have for health updates.
helpful_reviews.author: MHersman
helpful_reviews.content: I love the FollowMyHealth app.  Itâ€™s been a great way for me to communicate with my doctors, keep track of appointments, refill prescriptions, get test results and so much more. I contact my doctors often and they always reply back.  I donâ€™t know if this is true of every group thatâ€™s uses this app, but when used properly you are able to make more informed decisions about your healthcare.

helpful_reviews.title: Great way to keep connected with my caregiver
helpful_reviews.author: Caponemom
helpful_reviews.content: I love this app! I have numerous doctors at TCO-this is the BEST way to keep connected with all of them & to keep my appointments straight! I especially love that it connects with my calendar and keeps me on top of when and WHERE my appointments are, because I am flexible enough to see them at different locations. Thatâ€™s a privilege of living in a central location.  Great app-I give it 5 stars all day long!

helpful_reviews.title: Excellent app
helpful_reviews.author: Ally55555
helpful_reviews.content: Follow my health give patients so much access to information and to health care providers. You can click on any of your diagnoses to get information on the condition, you can make sure that there arenâ€™t diagnoses incorrectly put in your chart, and you can easily send messages to your provider to get medication refills or ask a quick question. Very useful, helpful, and easy to navigate.

helpful_reviews.title: Painful, disorganized, an aggravation
helpful_reviews.author: YTzam
helpful_reviews.content: The idea behind it is good: why not have all your medical records in one place? Unfortunately, the realization is poor: - one of many such apps; it applies only to a small set of providers - immature software is replete of annoyances  - logs you off often and about half the time it requires you to log in by typing rather than always accepting your fingerprint.  - a single doctor's visit creates a multitude of pings, messages, emails, etc over the next couple of days. Not only you get an item for blood tests but you get one for vitamin D... and another for vitamin K.... and so on. And then a separate listing for your weight... - worse than all, items are not cleared when listed. So let's say you once worried about your heart and it was subsequently listed as an active item. Even if your cardiologist were to find no evidence of issue, the problem continues to be listed for a long time (for ever??)  I wonder if this could eventually become an insurance issue...

helpful_reviews.title: Preparedness saves lives and money
helpful_reviews.author: dc'd
helpful_reviews.content: My health is one of the few things that I have choices in. Being up to date on the stuff that I can control is important to me. I like to go to review my tests and if it is something that the office needs to contact me over, I then can ask questions that may not have been addressed during the call. This sometimes saves me the price of a visit and now days that money can pay another bill.

helpful_reviews.title: FMH app.
helpful_reviews.author: Mrs.Wood!
helpful_reviews.content: I love this app. All of my health information is there and easy to read.  All you medications and results are there as well. Easy to use. Itâ€™s pretty much all around the perfect app for your health care information. I do wonder if the security of the app is up to date. My health care had a hacker situation a year or so back so I hope this app doesnâ€™t make it easy for them or anyone else to steal information.

helpful_reviews.title: Great app!
helpful_reviews.author: nebigjohn
helpful_reviews.content: I love having my prescription drug list, medical conditions, and test results so handy. I get notifications on any changes, prescription renewals and upcoming appointments right away and it's so easy to check on the status of everything. I do wish that all providers in the Mercy group where tied in to this as well, I also use Iowa heart and others and wish I could see my appointments here as well.

helpful_reviews.title: Great app to communicate with providers and pharmacy
helpful_reviews.author: Coreyean
helpful_reviews.content: Follow my health is fantastic when it comes to being able to contact your providers and connected pharmacies. This expedites refill processes and direct communication with physicians. I would absolutely recommend this app to anyone who is provider participates and for those who don't I would definitely urge them to do so to assist in their contact with their patient load.

helpful_reviews.title: Things I love about this application
helpful_reviews.author: NanaJo
helpful_reviews.content: I love that I can look up all the information that I need without having to spend time on the phone. I also love that somebody is actually in there responding and sending me messages and thatâ€™s exciting. Itâ€™s quick to check if I need to give information to somebody else about appointments or prescriptions or something like that I really like it.

helpful_reviews.title: Mostly Helpful
helpful_reviews.author: paigetheraged
helpful_reviews.content: Keeps me in touch with my therapists and psychologists, educates me on the health conditions that they diagnose me with, gives the user the ability to add things to their own charts for the providers to see (i.e. medication, allergies, and a few others). The only downside is that when messaging your providers you cannot attach files or pictures, and so i had trouble scanning and sending over release of information to my psychiatrist.

helpful_reviews.title: Follow My Health (FMH)
helpful_reviews.author: Cloud Seer
helpful_reviews.content: Fantastic App for anyone who wants to keep up with their Doctors and the results of the tests they perform on you. (Ex:blood tests and what they mean)  I receive the results of my blood tests before I see my Dr and know what is going on beforehand.  This helps me to stay aware of my own health and to determine what questions to ask my Dr.  The app also helps to educate me on what each test means so that Iâ€™m knowledgeable when discussing my health with my Dr.

helpful_reviews.title: Powerful!
helpful_reviews.author: Joyful Aloha
helpful_reviews.content: Excellent app that allows me to become an active participant in my own healthcare. I can read results immediately when they are updated. An educational component with links to valid medical sources explaining active conditions or results. My vitals are all in one place allowing me a record to track my weight, blood pressure etc. Interface is clean and easy to navigate. Thank you so much!

helpful_reviews.title: Amazing APP!
helpful_reviews.author: rhondaheart
helpful_reviews.content: I can go on this app at my fingertips, I can contact my doctor and get a message to her, I can renew my medications, I can look up appointments, I can find out results quicker than waiting for a phone call, I can even go on here and find out what I wait a year ago on my weight loss journey-If I need to notify anybody of any conditions Iâ€™ve been diagnosed with ever I can go on this APP and look it upğŸ�†

helpful_reviews.title: Amazing platform for doctor-patient communication
helpful_reviews.author: Bsktbllgoddess
helpful_reviews.content: So easy to use and track everything I need from my care team. I'm able to review all test results and even send a note to my doctor if something is going on. It's much easier than calling and when I get confused about instructions or appointments, I can always just check here to see everything!

helpful_reviews.title: Peace of mind
helpful_reviews.author: al4terry
helpful_reviews.content: I love being able to look at my chart anytime and know my healthcare concerns are being taken care of for me. It's great if I have a question that I need answered that I forgot to ask my doctor. It also keeps track of my appointments and my current test results from any medical test I may have taken. It is one of my most favorite apps for information on my health and peace of mind.

helpful_reviews.title: Just got better
helpful_reviews.author: gcrone1311
helpful_reviews.content: Not sure when it was added but logging in was manual but now offers fingerprint. Records are uploaded to the app nearly real time. Itâ€™s great to have access to history, future appts, get notified when records added and have a place to store contact info for specialists. Have had no buggy issues at all in several years of using the app.

helpful_reviews.title: Very useful and efficient
helpful_reviews.author: MSN, RN
helpful_reviews.content: I am extremely impressed with this app and how simple it is to access your healthcare provider. For the ease of convenience in our busy lives today, if I were to ever have to choose another provider for some reason: I would ensure that they participated in this FMH program. I am beyond satisfied with the services and accessible medical health records that this provides.

helpful_reviews.title: THANK YOU FOR NEW PASSCODE!!
helpful_reviews.author: 2TimeSurvivor
helpful_reviews.content: Thank you, thank you for simplifying sign in with the mobile passcode option!!! When you are under treatment, you get multiple messages about new info in your record, and the previous sign in process was a time consuming pain, with no option to save any part of your sign in info. Signing in with 4 digits on my phone is an AWESOME improvement and time saver!!

helpful_reviews.title: Essential for Managing Your Health
helpful_reviews.author: No Weather in San diego
helpful_reviews.content: I love being able to see my entire health history in one easy to navigate app. It definitely helps you to manage your own health care better by showing when the last you had a certain procedure done, what progress you might be making on your blood tests, etc. Great step forward in providing patient awareness.

helpful_reviews.title: ğŸ™� Sharp Rees-Stealy for this App!
helpful_reviews.author: Dr. Eyes
helpful_reviews.content: Have been a patient a long time at Sharp Rees Stealy Group in San Diego.  This app has come a long way.   Sometimes I just donâ€™t remember what was told to me at the docâ€™s office.  Itâ€™s not their fault. I was just nervous about my condition.  I can open up this app and read all the notes and the plans that were discussed at the visit. Thank you Sharp for using this app and putting patients first!!!!

helpful_reviews.title: Good but faulty
helpful_reviews.author: BarryOToole
helpful_reviews.content: Very slow to open and move to other screens. Tapping on â€˜Resultsâ€™, eg, makes the whole screen unresponsive, and thereâ€™s no action. Also, thereâ€™s no indication that it is processing my tap. This is repeated on subsequent screens, and often it takes so long that I wonder if the app has quit working or is just too slow, and I have to restart the app.   This has not changed ever since Iâ€™ve started using this app, over an year ago. My wife uses Epic app for another hospital and itâ€™s so user friendly, fast and fun to use; a five starrer.   Iâ€™ve begged my doctor to change but he says heâ€™s stuck with AllScripts. Sad.

helpful_reviews.title: Thumbs up for FMH
helpful_reviews.author: #realCliffHaston
helpful_reviews.content: It is very good to be close to information on your health and this application allows you to do that. There are some bugs such as you canâ€™t delete certain items and the only way that those errors can be corrected is to go to the medical establishment and have them corrected. For example I cannot correct my employment status. But this is a very good app and I have been using it quite a bit.

helpful_reviews.title: Mankato clinic patient portal
helpful_reviews.author: Ponky Peabody
helpful_reviews.content: This app is awesome. It helps you keep up with appointments by sending you a notification (make sure you allow notifications) it also gives you a patient summary of what was done the day you went and instruction. Any documents that they need to send out to you, the app notify you when it goes into their system. This app is awesome

helpful_reviews.title: FMHğŸ‘�
helpful_reviews.author: Sancian59

helpful_reviews.title: I love this great app
helpful_reviews.author: mflores55

helpful_reviews.title: Easy access

helpful_reviews.content: This app is easy to use and provides instant access to medical records and information from the medical office. Instead of trying to remember what was discussed, you can review and research at your own pace from your phone or computer.

helpful_reviews.title: Good start but needs a lot of improvements

Info needs to be input and available for access on a more timely basis. Also you should add feature of notification when information is added or updated.

helpful_reviews.title: Helpful App

helpful_reviews.content: This is a great method for communicating with medical staff & my doctor. I can ask questions & state concerns any time of day, seven days a week. helpful_reviews.title: Love this app

helpful_reviews.title: Convenient and easy to use!

helpful_reviews.title: Convenient and comprehensive access

helpful_reviews.content: I appreciate the app and using it to quickly and conveniently communicate with my doctors, get prescriptions refilled, and schedule appointments.  I have a very busy schedule and the app has simplified my life.  I also appreciate being able to access and download results, etc.

I mean, I know he could go look them up, etc, but if I could send immediately that would be great! Also, I had to request him as a provider and now it says "pending"! Very frustrating but I see why that security feature is in place!

helpful_reviews.title: The best app ever
helpful_reviews.author: raman4
helpful_reviews.content: Can't put into words how much this helps. To be able to connect and talk to your doctor at any time is the best. The option to not have to call and wait to schedule an appointment when I can schedule one on the app. Best app and recommend it

helpful_reviews.title: FMH great app!

(Sent, Received by Nurse, Dr. Approved, Sent to Pharmacy, Ready for Pick-Up) Other than that it’s a great app and eliminates a phone call that can be a burden at times.

helpful_reviews.title: Records at my fingertips

helpful_reviews.title: Early Knowledge, Early Cure!

helpful_reviews.title: Very helpful

name: healow
description: healow™ lets you communicate with your doctor’s office and access up to date medical records. You will be able to access your appointments, lab results, vitals, manage medications and other personal data all within one app. From the healow™ app you can manage multiple accounts and access your and your family’s medical information.  Find a doctor and book your appointment - fast, free & easy, at your convenience – morning, noon or late at night! No more waiting on the phone with your doctor's office for an appointment. Find an appointment that works for you and book instantly – on the go! Set your goals and track them easily using trackers. Use our weight management & activity trackers to reach your fitness goals. Track your numbers regularly to watch the trends change and share your progress with your doctor. Stay motivated to make healthy choices.

recent_reviews.title: Not reliable
recent_reviews.author: Josiah Sprague
recent_reviews.content: I'd expect an app that people rely on for their health to have a higher standard of quality control and usability. I'd suggest that the team building this app invest time in increasing automated testing coverage, relax deadlines and pressure to release new features, and focus on paying off technical debt and refining usability and reliability of existing features for the next six months to a year. People use this app because their doctors ask them too, not because of shiny new features. To market this app to doctors, focus on the ease of use for patients to communicate with their doctors. At this point, I'd rather call my doctor than use this app. And I'm a tech savvy user. I doubt most of the older folks whose doctors use this app have the patience to make this app work for them.

In reality, you have to shut *everything* in Keyboard off if you want your message to your provider to go through; if any of the keyboard options are turned on, you get an error that states that â€œspecial characters such as â€˜ are not accepted.â€� Now who TH writes an app like that? Seriously? Also, the messaging section will not allow you to attach a file, such as a blood glucose report, in a .csv or .pdf file! How the H am I supposed to get my blood sugar report to my doctor without driving 20 miles to her office and using AirDrop directly to her phone? Really? Test results frequently do not appear. recent_reviews.title: Horrible App
recent_reviews.author: mcspaul
recent_reviews.content: Everything within the app is horribly slow.  It frequently locks up while trying to load up the data from the section selected in the interface.  Their website seems to also suffer from this problem.  It is slow and pages lock up while loading data.  Messages from the doctor show up in small text at the bottom of the screen.  That is fine for short 1 sentence responses from the doctor but any longer message would be difficult to read.  Messages should be opened in a separate window, screen, or in some way separated from the rest of messages and also from the rest of the app.  What is the point of using an app instead of just a website/web portal if it does not take advantage of any of the hardware platform it is running on.  An example of this is the use of PIN codes for access.  Why not use the fingerprint reader (Touch ID on iOS) or facial recognition if the hardware supports it?  Scheduling an appointment is also much more difficult than it needs to be if your doctor is part of a large group.  When requesting an appointment it shows every doctor in the group not just your doctor.  That might not be so bad except that it only shows a small number of doctors at a time.  You then have to scroll down and let it load a small list of more doctors.  Having to constantly keep scrolling to the bottom, wait for it to load a small amount of doctors, and keep repeating this process until you find you doctor is slow and frankly irritating.  Also why are the doctors sorted alphabetically by first name.  Some doctors are referred to by their first name by patients but most are referred to by their last name.

The one other review posted (with 5 stars no less) has nothing do do with evaluating the app. It should be taken down. recent_reviews.title: One of THE Sorriest Apps Iâ€™ve Ever Used
recent_reviews.author: gclunsf
recent_reviews.content: Iâ€™m retired with about 40 years of computing experience and about 6-7 years of iPhone & iPad app user experience. I can tell you, up-front, this is one frustrating, poorly designed, sorriest excuse for an app Iâ€™ve had the misfortune to use to-date. Hereâ€™s the problems:  1) Constructing a new strong account password the app will accept should not be the â€œrocket scienceâ€� it seems to be. The password guidelines, some of which they supply on their web portal, are shown nowhere on the app screen where the new password has to be supplied. Showing ALL the guidelines is a common practice among most apps that handle input of of new passwords. Attempting to set a password for a new additional account under Healow seems next to impossible. It rejects them with a â€œNew Password is very weakâ€� message no matter how strong the password really is.  2) Once the user has started the process of adding a new account to Healow, ANY action by the user in navigating to another app before finishing the new account add  will result in the Healow app discarding ALL the information the user has input and take them back to a screen requesting their PIN code when going into settings. Why would a user navigate to another app while doing the new account add? I did it to refer to information needed for the new app addition process, such as the medical practiceâ€™s code and the userid and temporary password supplied by the medical organization, for example. I cannot say how absolutely frustrating and ridiculous this is and would be, especially, to inexperienced users. On this problem, alone, I give the app a â€œ1-starâ€� rating out of 5 stars. It shows exceedingly poor design and even poorer testing practices.  3) When adding an account by hitting the â€œ+â€� in the upper right corner of the My Accounts screen, a screen is brought up in which the user should be able to search by the provider name, practice name, or practice code. However, when that screen is brought up, the app often proceeds beyond it to a list of provider names & addresses as might be useful if the user wants to search by provider name. However, no provider name has been supplied. Getting the screen to stop and allow the user to instead provide a practice name or practice code, as is my case, depends on the user trying to tap the screen in several places across several iterations. Again, this is the result of exceedingly poor design and poorer testing practices.  4) Customer Support is nearly non-existent for this app. Iâ€™ve gone back and forth with these folks about 3 times to try to resolve the password problem. They finally said to just contact the medical provider whose account Iâ€™m trying to add, and theyâ€™ll work it with them. That medical provider isnâ€™t having the problem. I am. This demonstrates their unwillingness to work with their customers to fix problems.  Whatever you do, if you can, avoid this app like the plague!

I only use the PC version for most of my needs.

recent_reviews.title: Another so-so "one stop" portal solution
recent_reviews.author: LucasHolt
recent_reviews.content: The interface/UX is *fine*, nothing more. Healow gets the job done (for the most part) but leaves a lot to be desired, especially given every doctor/hospital/practice/insurance provider pushes a different "all-in-one" portal destination app and even makes it more difficult for those who don't opt in. Some are better, some are much worse but none are great or offer solutions that would inspire me to refer friends to use it. It seems these apps are just rushed to market in order to check a "product" box vs. solve problems/streamline patients' care.   Biggest issues so far:  â€¢ All the alerts informing me of my appointment a week ago. Thanks, but I remember because I was physically there. No need to send an 'alert' 5 days after the appointment, especially if there are no necessary next steps/key details recapped in the summary. Alerts are for new info, not  rehashing memories.  â€¢ Medical Docs: no feature to attach documents to messages within the portal... It's 2017, let's not reinvent the wheel in terms of basic communication needs. What's the point of if users have to use the portal only to then have to request email addresses from docs in order to (insecurely) transfer medical documents? This only adds extra steps and does nothing to expedite.  â€¢ Security: TouchID exists, please include it in your next update. Get up to speed or PLEASE just get out of the App Store. Why download a clunky app if it offers the same experience as a low budget web-site? â€¢ Messaging: the mobile app does not have a way to see sent messages or conversations in thread format. Instead you can only see messages you receive. As most users are not fluent in medical details, referencing back to earlier interactions/context from back and forth with medical staff is important.   PS: how does this app have 3.5 stars...?

That's just annoying.

recent_reviews.title: still bad app
recent_reviews.author: rswc90
recent_reviews.content: This app does not allow for "continuity of care" in any logical way. You  may write to your physician and they may respond. Period. There is no way to send attachments of any kind and because there cannot be "on-going" conversations, it becomes a challenge to remember what you wrote and to what, exactly, your physician is responding. Does not make any logical sense to me.

recent_reviews.title: Easy to use

recent_reviews.content: For appointments & messaging to the doctors office the app works well but for reports ( blood work) or medication lists the app lacks the ability to print, which would be a big plus to the app.

helpful_reviews.title: Absolute garbage
helpful_reviews.author: collisionbend
helpful_reviews.content: First off, rating this app 5 stars just because you love your doctorâ€™s staff is the epitome of stupidity. Their staff has absolutely nothing to do with this app. This app actually has some potential - if the people who wrote it knew what they were doing: fâ€™rinstance, if youâ€™re on iOS 11, you have to go into Settings > General > Keyboard and shut off Smart Punctuation (this is what Healow Customer Support told me). In reality, you have to shut *everything* in Keyboard off if you want your message to your provider to go through; if any of the keyboard options are turned on, you get an error that states that â€œspecial characters such as â€˜ are not accepted.â€� Now who TH writes an app like that? Seriously? Also, the messaging section will not allow you to attach a file, such as a blood glucose report, in a .csv or .pdf file! How the H am I supposed to get my blood sugar report to my doctor without driving 20 miles to her office and using AirDrop directly to her phone? Really? Test results frequently do not appear. Two stars for its potential, and zero stars on execution and intentionally deleted functions equals One Star. I wish I could give it less.

helpful_reviews.content: Maybe itâ€™s my providerâ€™s IT person, but my test results rarely show up, itâ€™s crashed several times, and now when messaging Iâ€™m no longer allowed to use contractions.  THAT, in and of itself, is a major annoyance.  I have to spell out CANNOT instead of CANâ€™T, etc., or it flags me and makes me go back for things such as Iâ€™m and make me spell I AM.  I really DO NOT have time for such stupidity.  Itâ€™s frustrating time and again when other annoyances pop up, but again, not sure if itâ€™s my providerâ€™s office or the app.  I imagine the contraction thing is purely the app, though.  PLEASE FIX THIS.  I donâ€™t have time for this niggling little eccentricity of your designerâ€™s.  Or, since I am not allowed to use apostrophes in the app, that would be phrased â€œthe eccentricity belonging to your designerâ€�.  Way too many words when so few would do... a wonderful thing, a contraction... what harm does the lowly apostrophe do, anyway?!?

helpful_reviews.title: The best app, for the very best Doctor.

helpful_reviews.title: Shocked how helpful it is!!

I have a TON of scripts due to nerve damage, high blood pressure and now liver issues because of the long term medications that I need. helpful_reviews.title: Great app
helpful_reviews.author: aflette
helpful_reviews.content: I love Healow, I really do. It's a great app, but my only complaint is that when you're sending a message to your doctor/nurse or whoever, it doesn't allow you to use apostrophes. It says "special characters like ' are not allowed." Is there any way to fix this?? Because I type contractions more often than not without thinking and autocorrect fixes it too if you don't put it in, and separating out all the words or taking the apostrophes out is really annoying and takes more time than necessary. I know this is a minor thing but it's SUPER annoying.   But regardless of that it's still a great app that I would recommend to others.

helpful_reviews.title: Excellent portability if you have more than one physician
helpful_reviews.author: KS Flatlander
helpful_reviews.content: I like having all my lab values available so I can just hand my phone to a new doctor to view any needed lab data directly.  Text messaging directly with doctorâ€™s nurse has given me fast direct access you would never match with phone calls.  Appointments are easily verified by dates & times if you forget. In addition, appointment reminders can be sent to you as well.  Medication records are continuously available for your convenience and easy to update by you and your physician.  This is a concise, easy to use medical program everyone will appreciate.

helpful_reviews.title: Not user friendly
helpful_reviews.author: The Mrs. Suttle
helpful_reviews.content: For me the biggest and most frustrating issue in this app is itâ€™s messaging feature. Besides the fact that you cannot use simple punctuation, like apostrophes, you also cannot reply to your doctors messages. You have to start a whole new message, there is no threading of conversation ability. With a special needs child we sometimes need to go back and forth about things. This helps avoid bringing him into the office where there are sick kids that could pass him germs. A simple cold has almost cost him his life in the past, as he cannot manage the mucus/congestion that comes with one.  Seeing records is difficult at best. Tests results come in, eventually. But not always in a timely manner.  Good luck with the app! I hope they make it better as it COULD be an invaluable resource. As of now, itâ€™s just a pain.

helpful_reviews.title: App Review

They should really look into making sure that the company that created this kind of app always keeps up to date with the ways that the medical field in general works, so that therefore, no matter if anything at all changes within the industry itself, then all doctors, regardless of the part of the medical field that theyâ€™re in will always be able to be up to date with everything as far in advance as possible.

helpful_reviews.title: New Version Erased my Login Info
helpful_reviews.author: prcrlc
helpful_reviews.content: I like the program but it's only as good as its implementation by the medical practice. They determine what gets posted and the amount of detail.   I'm using different apps for different hospitals and doctors. It's frustrating that I can't share information between them. I often find that specialists forget to send results to my primary care doctor.   I'm not crazy about how email is implemented. I'd like to be able to send a message to my MDs assistant without having to type in a long subject line to made sure it's routed to the right person. I'd also like folders for messages.

helpful_reviews.title: Useless Fecal Matter
helpful_reviews.author: YourNameHereX_________
helpful_reviews.content: Last week blood was drawn at Tidelands Waccamaw Family Medicine (Pawleys Island, SC) per Dr Schwartz. No Trace of this test is in the app.  Also, no matter what search I do within the app, the answer comes back with "No results", no matter how mundane the question (and believe me, I dumbed down the questions to the point that it was impossible not to return an answer). I find this app to be useless, and a complete waste of my time, as well as a HUGE waste of money for Tidelands Health. How about Tidelands not buying into crappy, useless apps, and lowering the price of healthcare? Also, I can't believe someone gave this app 5-stars because they were happy with the office staff at a particular location. How can anyone leave a review for a piece of software that has ZERO to do with the app itself.

helpful_reviews.title: Not reliable
helpful_reviews.author: Josiah Sprague
helpful_reviews.content: I'd expect an app that people rely on for their health to have a higher standard of quality control and usability. I'd suggest that the team building this app invest time in increasing automated testing coverage, relax deadlines and pressure to release new features, and focus on paying off technical debt and refining usability and reliability of existing features for the next six months to a year. People use this app because their doctors ask them too, not because of shiny new features. To market this app to doctors, focus on the ease of use for patients to communicate with their doctors. At this point, I'd rather call my doctor than use this app. And I'm a tech savvy user. I doubt most of the older folks whose doctors use this app have the patience to make this app work for them.

helpful_reviews.title: APP fails short
helpful_reviews.author: SteveRPh
helpful_reviews.content: Using the portal on a PC has most of the items needed, However, the APP only allows send and receive mail but cannot show status that it was sent (no sent screen on the app)  Mail on the APP is General but does not designate physician in a multi practice setting.   IOS version on the iPhone and iPad does not allow rotation.     Both the APP and the portal shows all previous and current Rxs  but does not differential between historical or current.     One of my physician change clinical service even though I can unlink the office I cannot delete from the APP.   This might be confusing to a third party using my device at time of illness as the information on the unlinked physician is old and outdated and might result in a medical error.  Have contacted the developers in the past with suggestion of improvements and problems but they are not interested in improving the app based on end user only from the Medical staff prospective.    I only use the PC version for most of my needs.

helpful_reviews.title: Great App!!

I always know when and where my appointments are and who theyâ€™re with. This is a must have app. Thank you Healow, what a fantastic idea!!

helpful_reviews.title: Horrible App
helpful_reviews.author: mcspaul
helpful_reviews.content: Everything within the app is horribly slow.  It frequently locks up while trying to load up the data from the section selected in the interface.  Their website seems to also suffer from this problem.  It is slow and pages lock up while loading data.  Messages from the doctor show up in small text at the bottom of the screen.  That is fine for short 1 sentence responses from the doctor but any longer message would be difficult to read.  Messages should be opened in a separate window, screen, or in some way separated from the rest of messages and also from the rest of the app.  What is the point of using an app instead of just a website/web portal if it does not take advantage of any of the hardware platform it is running on.  An example of this is the use of PIN codes for access.  Why not use the fingerprint reader (Touch ID on iOS) or facial recognition if the hardware supports it?  Scheduling an appointment is also much more difficult than it needs to be if your doctor is part of a large group.  When requesting an appointment it shows every doctor in the group not just your doctor.  That might not be so bad except that it only shows a small number of doctors at a time.  You then have to scroll down and let it load a small list of more doctors.  Having to constantly keep scrolling to the bottom, wait for it to load a small amount of doctors, and keep repeating this process until you find you doctor is slow and frankly irritating.  Also why are the doctors sorted alphabetically by first name.  Some doctors are referred to by their first name by patients but most are referred to by their last name.

helpful_reviews.title: Another so-so "one stop" portal solution
helpful_reviews.author: LucasHolt
helpful_reviews.content: The interface/UX is *fine*, nothing more. Healow gets the job done (for the most part) but leaves a lot to be desired, especially given every doctor/hospital/practice/insurance provider pushes a different "all-in-one" portal destination app and even makes it more difficult for those who don't opt in. Some are better, some are much worse but none are great or offer solutions that would inspire me to refer friends to use it. It seems these apps are just rushed to market in order to check a "product" box vs. solve problems/streamline patients' care.   Biggest issues so far:  â€¢ All the alerts informing me of my appointment a week ago. Thanks, but I remember because I was physically there. No need to send an 'alert' 5 days after the appointment, especially if there are no necessary next steps/key details recapped in the summary. Alerts are for new info, not  rehashing memories.  â€¢ Medical Docs: no feature to attach documents to messages within the portal... It's 2017, let's not reinvent the wheel in terms of basic communication needs. What's the point of if users have to use the portal only to then have to request email addresses from docs in order to (insecurely) transfer medical documents? This only adds extra steps and does nothing to expedite.  â€¢ Security: TouchID exists, please include it in your next update. Get up to speed or PLEASE just get out of the App Store. Why download a clunky app if it offers the same experience as a low budget web-site? â€¢ Messaging: the mobile app does not have a way to see sent messages or conversations in thread format. Instead you can only see messages you receive. As most users are not fluent in medical details, referencing back to earlier interactions/context from back and forth with medical staff is important.   PS: how does this app have 3.5 stars...?
