helpful_reviews.title: Waste of Time
helpful_reviews.author: PrincessPunzee
helpful_reviews.content: This app has yet to work in several months. Somehow I was signed out of my account, but it still has certain pieces of information from that provider. When I try doing a search to locate my provider and sign back in, it gives me a field to type in a name, but that field will then disappear and switch to a different field! Once I get past that madness, I have to login. Of course, I didn't remember my login or password. First I asked the app to send me my password via text, and it's been 20 minutes and I still haven't received a text. I then requested it by email and received it immediately. Then I tried logging in. Let me go back a bit to explain that with each password attempt, the screen performed the classic "loading please wait" gesture and quickly ended with me still looking at the login screen. I thought it was because my password attempts were wrong, but the screen didn't say that either. After resetting the password and successfully entering it, the system STILL did not recognize I was trying to login. Until now, I am still unable to access my account through this app. I would like them to take another look at what's going on with this app because it's completely useless to me except for to look up the 2 One-time doses of medication I received two years ago from what looks like an unknown source (since I still can't login to my providers account and it doesn't give that information with what I currently can't see).

helpful_reviews.title: Horrible Software and Support
helpful_reviews.author: SMTIPS
helpful_reviews.content: My doctor uses the software from Healow, that has gross mis-formatting in their appointment reminder emails. It seems that it's more important for the software maker to have a big banner ad for themselves at the bottom of the emails than the appointment reminder text to be correctly formatted (the entire line that the address, location, and time is on has no spaces at all, it looks sorely stupid). I emailed Healow to tell them I'm concerned that the emails sent look so unprofessional as to be laughable. The response was a curt, rude answer that they only make the software and that they don't control how people use it and I should call my doctor's office...yet half the email is an ad from them! And yes, it sends a callback to the software company via the graphic load in the email. Obviously theyâ€™re more interested in advertising than in providing a decent software or training the staff on how to properly use the tool. I bet they are soaking doctors for a bundle, and the sad part is, that most (probly 99%) recipients won't ever let anyone know how unprofessional it makes the doctor look.

helpful_reviews.title: Password disaster u-turn
helpful_reviews.author: umitislo
helpful_reviews.content: I have had an issue with the password retrieval for almost 3 weeks, the link kept saying 'expired' and when I tried to update it online, I wasn't able to save it. The reason to retrieve my password was because my doctors group screwed up my account by messing up the doctor, they changed it to referral stating that I shouldn't be using this app to get in touch with my doctor. But in reality up until they changed it, I would ask a question and it would be emailed to my child's doctor, and she would respond to it within 2-3 hours. It was working perfectly. Watch out Children's Medical Group, I hope you learned your lesson not to screw up patients accounts! Thank you Healow, your experts solved my problem. I'm back on! My notes are gone but I can see the doctors notes. Thank you for your PATIENCE! And for taking care of the password problem.

helpful_reviews.title: The entire cast of E.R. could not save this app
helpful_reviews.author: Mort2001
helpful_reviews.content: The bummer is that I canâ€™t give it less than a 1 star rating. Dear developer, please take note and hire the following asap: a UI usability engineer, a graphic designer with more than 10 minutes worth of experience, an IOS app team that has done more than written to a spec. This app is simply terrible. It is a confusing cluster I#&(@$ of web views and terrible design choices. It will ask you to log in in multiple areas of the app for no apparent reason. Hand this steaming pile to a person whoâ€™s already having difficulties with technology to begin with and you just purchased yourself a ticket on the pain train. Their search functionality for providers is a joke (thatâ€™s being kind). This is supposed to make medical care simply what it really make you want to do is rip your eye how of their sockets. On the plus side using this app will probably see one of my loves ones miss an appointment or some other critical piece of medical information which will kill them so I will not have to use this pile any more.

helpful_reviews.title: Wonderful & Easy to use!
helpful_reviews.author: Tanner063011
helpful_reviews.content: I have been using this user friendly app for over a year and love it. I don't need to spend time calling my doctor's office when I need to request lab work or refills for my medications. Then I receive the results, right away on my phone. Also, I can also see my next scheduled appointment or schedule a new time as needed.  When I was away this last summer I had a medical problem. Through this app I was able to let my physician know what was happening via the email portion. I was given directions for my care very quickly. So much better than playing the telephone tag game! The app provides faster access to my medical caregiver.  In the event I need to go to the ER or another physician not on the same system, I have a list of my medications, lab work and diagnosis from my primary physician.   I will continue to show this app to my friends (it's very impressive!) and other medical professionals I visit.  I would like to recognize a job well done to the good people of eClinical Works who designed such an easy to use product. Thank you for making my life just a little easier to manage. H. Tanner

helpful_reviews.title: Overall a good overview app for medical
helpful_reviews.author: Fjsheppard1971
helpful_reviews.content: What I would like to see changed is the character field for messages from my physician.  Right now I cannot see the entire message without logging into the portal on my computer.  I would like to be able to either scroll the entire message or you add a unlimited characters to the message field so the entire message can be viewed. Over all it is a decent app.  It needs a few tweaks here and there.  I also cannot edit personal info like phone numbers from the app like I can when i log onto my computer.  I do like the pin creation to be prompted doe a pin.  It would be nice if the Pin was more more than four characters to make it more complex, but I am happy about the added security layer.

helpful_reviews.title: Piece of Junk
helpful_reviews.author: phs123444426725617384
helpful_reviews.content: Just look at the first screen shot.  Light blue on white lettering.  Impossible to read.  I had tried it on a Nokia 635 running Windows 8.1.  I figured the app was junk on Windows Phone because nobody pays any attention to it, so I tried it on my iPhone 4s.  When a company supposedly interested in people's health can't figure out the importance of contrast in a user interface, they aren't going to last long.  I hope my doctor figures this out soon.  Usually I root for the underdog, but if this is the best eClinicalWorks can do then I can't wait until one of the portal behemoths swallows them.  I sure wish the consolidation of health portal technology would accelerate, either through mergers or use of standards.  I hate having to manage separate portals for every doctor.   Especially since none of them share information or use single sign on.  They have made patient service worse than it was before there were lame attempts at online health patient services.  At least, in the old days,  I could spend half an hour holding on the phone, ask my two sentence question, and wait seven days to get what I asked for in the mail.  Total time wasted, 35 minutes.  Now I get to bounce between portals trying to figure out where those pesky lab results ended up, then manually consolidate them because there is no interoperabity.  Sigh.

helpful_reviews.title: Very happy
helpful_reviews.author: fomobae
helpful_reviews.content: Saw a healow flyer in my doctor's office and decided to give this app a try. All I can say is wow! The appointment booking feature has made my life so much easier. I have to see my doctor a few times a year for my condition and I usually have so much trouble getting an appt booked (especially with an uncooperative front office staff). Now I never have to wait in line after my appointment to book the next one and can do it on my phone in a few seconds. I was a little skeptical at first with some of the reviews, but it does exactly what it says it does. Sure, a few improvements could be made, but many were addressed in the latest update and for that reason: 5 stars

helpful_reviews.title: Has Potential But Disappointing
helpful_reviews.author: K-HAWKER
helpful_reviews.content: I tried this app because my cardiologist uses the software.  It's a great idea and the description makes one think it is just what you want.  Apparently there is no support staff for the app.    I can't sync with my Fitbit Charge HR.  It does not connect with the Microsoft Health Vault or the MS band.  It does not connect to MyFitnesPal, GARMIN Connect or Apple Health.  Connectivity is everything for an app that is supposed to save you time by avoiding entering data by hand.  Signing up the medical professionals is great but that is only half of the picture.  The patients need to be addressed also. People are not going to drag a laptop to the doctors office when they have a $600 smartphone in their pocket and they are not going to key fitness data when they have Bluetooth fitness trackers.  Hopefully the owners of this system will get with the program, make a lot of improvements and this will become a "go to" app.

helpful_reviews.title: Good tool, needs work
helpful_reviews.author: dlm3 in TX
helpful_reviews.content: Overall I like Healow as a way to communicate with my doctor securely, seek an results, etc.   That said, it leaves much to be desired.   Four things stand out:  1) When editing a message, the insertion point can drop below the keyboard pane making it necessary to add return characters to get the last line of text in view. The editing window needs to be limited to the active area, not including the keyboard space.   2) a new "feature" limits the number of characters of a message that can be viewed on the app, with no option to open the full message, forcing me to go to the online portal. This is unhelpful and needs to be addressed ASAP.   3) there is no way to see the messages I send to my doctor. I should be able to see and reply to an entire message thread.   4) TouchID. The current verification method is ok but TouchID is more secure. With this becoming more commonplace, it should be an obvious enhancement in the near future.   Oh. And a full featured iPad App that isn't a rehash of the portal would be valuable. The phone app is convenient but an iPad app is less confined and gives opportunities for better communication and viewing data.

helpful_reviews.title: Pathetic Application
helpful_reviews.author: WalkTester
helpful_reviews.content: This goes from bad to worse.  After 5 days back and forth on email the app finally asked me to set a PIN.  I entered a 4 digit PIN and that was all I could do.  It did not accept it or open up any other avenue of choice.  I could backspace or type over the entered digits.  I tried scrolling down, up left, right - nothing hidden out of sight just stuck there.  I closed it.  Now a day later I tapped the app and I get the same screen but with the addition of Forgot pin, and Incorrect PIN once I had entered the PIN,  had tried so hard to register the previous day.  The screen wobbled and said I had an incorrect PIN.  I tried several times but always incorrect!  Next I tried the "Forgot pin"   option.  It suggested I go to my patient portal and retrieve the PIN there.  As I've never entered or been asked for a PIN in my patient portal, not surprisingly it has no record of one. Hopeless!

helpful_reviews.title: Works well enough for me
helpful_reviews.author: Pjcthoth
helpful_reviews.content: I haven't had the password issues other users have brought up.  I popped up once and I just sat on hold with Dr office provider for 20 minutes to get it fixed.  Overall, I get a much faster response from my Dr and/or his nurse than I do from calling. I do have to be VERY clear on my questions or I sometimes get weird responses but that is true of all written communication.  The app does collect what meds I take well in additional to collecting all lab results.  I had to go to the ER 4 weeks ago (I was in terrible pain from chronic Pancreatitis) and I simply logged in this app and gave it to the nurse and Doctor and they got my meds, my history and any recent labs - boom - done! Then they can get to treating you!!!!

helpful_reviews.title: Decent app!
helpful_reviews.author: TobeyNator
helpful_reviews.content: The app is a great companion to our pediatrician's patient portal- however, its usefulness depends on what information the pediatrician makes available. For example, for one of our children we can see stats like weight and height and for the other child we can't.  There's some room for improvement- navigation is awkward in the My Records section- a summary/consolidated information section would be nice in order to reduce the number of taps it takes to get to certain information.  The switching between multiple children should be possible from anywhere in the app without having to return to the home screen.

helpful_reviews.title: This tool is exactly what I needed!
helpful_reviews.author: Rick Hankins
helpful_reviews.content: I was shocked to see so much  dissatisfaction in a great app.  E-clinical is a PC software that houses your records for you to peruse whenever.  Healow takes the data from E-clinical and organizes it into their streamlined interface.  For example, when I had a physical this week, I told the nurse that I was now taking a new non-prescription 'drug'. I gave her the name and when she put it in her system, it appeared in Healow within minutes.  There are so many other advantages, but the best for me is that I always carry around MY medical record just  I'm case there is an emergency.

helpful_reviews.title: No Problem
helpful_reviews.author: PJMtLemmon
helpful_reviews.content: Not sure why there would be any complaining about this app. It took me 94 seconds to download the app. It took about 110 seconds to sign in and confirm my appointment time for tomorrow! I have used the web based portal and did know my user login.... This app will be perfect for my needs, checking test results (having them available for future comparative reference) and looking up future appointments, I always make the appointments 3 to 6 months in advance and can never remember when that future date is.

helpful_reviews.title: Adding a Tracker - Fitbit Blaze not supported
helpful_reviews.author: Mack10161964
helpful_reviews.content: I wanted to add my Fitbit Blaze to the app. However when I logged into the Fitbit app, I got an error message: The app your trying to connect did not provie valid informaton to Fitbit. Please report this issue to them.  I would like to add this this health app but cannot connect it. Also, I noticed that you do not have any devices that are included in the Activity section. Since the Blaze and Surge definately have the capability to track specific activities, I am surprised that you have nothing in that category. I don't like the fact that there is an error in setting up my Fitbit Blaze (not an option in your list of devices). The app is not keeping up with the newer trackers availabe from Fitbit.

helpful_reviews.title: What a disaster
helpful_reviews.author: VanillaShake
helpful_reviews.content: If all you need is to read secure messages from your doctor, then sure -- the app will be useful for you. But for the remaining 90% of the advertised features, it's a joke. Activity tracking is completely non-functional. I have several Withings devices plus an Apple Watch and a Misfit. The app doesn't use HealthKit so it doesn't track the vast amount of activity information available from the iPhone M7, or the Apple Watch. And although I linked it to my Withings account, this app has yet to register any activity from those Withings devices.   It would seem that most of the app is web-based, not native iOS. It's very slow to navigate and looks clunky. In all its not a good user experience and its issues are too annoying for me.

helpful_reviews.title: Extremely clunky .. Broken password validation
helpful_reviews.author: Firepoet
helpful_reviews.content: When first setting up an account the app asks for your original password and dob or phone number. Using a password database this process is literally impossible. I need to go back and forth between apps to generate an extremely secure password using LastPass. At the end of the three screen process the app says my randomly generated 18 character password with letters numbers and special characters is too weak. So I go try and figure out what its pattern is. Trouble is.. Each time I try I have to go back to the beginning. I still haven't figured out the pattern it wants.  So I gave up trying to use the app. What a terrible experience!

helpful_reviews.title: Wonky not dependable
helpful_reviews.author: Mljohnson1123
helpful_reviews.content: This app overall performance is horrible.  I like the concept of being able to track my records, appointments, and medications. When I try to add my physicians I get error messages telling me my information is incorrect.  It takes me multiple steps to actually log into the app. I'm waiting for resolution on some trouble tickets I have submitted. I do not recommend this app. Given that I only see a few reviews I would guess not many access the app. I've been using the app since the instituted it in the NHRS, it has never worked great. Kept thinking they would update the app work out the flaws but two/three years later seems not.

helpful_reviews.title: So near, yet so far
helpful_reviews.author: MAC353535
helpful_reviews.content: Certainly the app is better than the previous method of contact the doctor's office; however, there are still some major items missing.  First, there is no history of emails sent.  Second, there is no way to get notification that emails are waiting to be read (I do not look at this app on a regular basis, so getting a notification sent to my personal email address that a "message is waiting" would be a terrific feature!).  Finally, if there was a way to store medical history and doctor's notes, the site would be much more useful.

helpful_reviews.title: Rx List
helpful_reviews.author: HCProxy1
helpful_reviews.content: I have been using the healow app for some time now but I recently linked my mother's Ecw patient portal to my account. My mother is older and I did this to keep an eye on her healthcare and to communicate with her provider. I absolutely love that I can upload her Rxs here. I took pictures of each medication, added the dosage and frequency, and even set up cell phone reminders for when she needs to take her medication. This has kept her medications straight for over a month now and has greatly reduced confusion. Thank you ECW and keep making cool features for this app!

helpful_reviews.title: Works Great!
helpful_reviews.author: Texas Liz
helpful_reviews.content: Not sure why others have problems with this app. In regard to developing a PIN, you type in your 4 numbers; the system has you retype to confirm; you're good to go. You don't have to press enter or anything; the system recognizes you've input 4 numbers. I did cross reference my personal/medical info between the website and the app; it was accurate. If I ever change doctors, it's good to have this app as a quick reference of office visits, meds, immunizations, etc. For me, this is a great app!

helpful_reviews.title: Helpful & Enlightening!
helpful_reviews.author: KatNewby
helpful_reviews.content: I really like this app! Most importantly it keeps a record of my future doctor appointment dates, as well as past appointment dates. I also enjoy that when I have labs taken (personally, blood lab & x-ray) it keeps a record of the clinical results. I feel that in the future there may be ways to make the app even more beneficial to health conscious patients. It currently keeps a history of medications & dosages taken. With some creative thinking & ingenuity to broaden & enhance this app, it could become a mainstay app in most patients phones!

helpful_reviews.title: Absolute garbage
helpful_reviews.author: Tru24m
helpful_reviews.content: So, the only reason I'm giving this crap one star is because I can't give it zero. At this point I'm starting to think that someone is just screwing with me. No professionally supported app could be THIS bad.   Basically, if you review every other low-rated review for this app, that pretty much sums up my experience with this garbage.  I got in once and was very underwhelmed with what I saw and what I was actually able to do with the app.  I went back again another day and couldn't log in.    I tried to retrieve my password, and when they sent the email to reset my password, I clicked the link, only for it to say "link expired."  This has happened about 30 times since, but every once in a while I'll get an email with no content.  That's fun too.   Can't sign in, can't reset my password, can't do anything. The app is completely walking me I circles now. This is pathetic. Someone should be thoroughly embarrassed if this is their best attempt at an app.  I'm pretty sure this is just something to scam doctor's offices with.

name: Healthspek - Personal Health Record & Family Health Record - Complete Medical Record for iPhone
description: Own Your Chart!  Healthspek is your own personal health record. Your record resides on your iPhone and is stored securely on Healthspek’s cloud-based servers.  So if your lose your iPhone, you'll never lose your chart!  Forget about complicated backups and syncs.  Healthspek's cloud takes care of it automatically.  And your family too! Add each family member to Healthspek for a complete family record.  With Healthspek, you get our ChartNow service for free.  Tell any doctor to go to www.chartnow.com and type in your 8-digit Access Code.  Instantly your chart appears. Anywhere around the world, at any time.  With a tap you can change your Access Code at any time if you feel your privacy has been compromised.  With Healthspek you start with 'myDashboard'.  You choose and customize your 'Speks' (think of them as widgets).  You even choose what order they appear. Speks such as Quick Refill, Urgent Care locator, and Vitals tracker are available.  Look to the future for many more Speks to be added - in fact make suggestions through the Feedback Spek.  Personalized Healthspek Carry Cards are available for $4.99.  Carry it around for instant or emergency access of your most important medical information. Your ChartNow Access Code is also displayed.  Track your conditions, refill your meds, track your lab results and more.  Record immunizations, allergies, supplements, procedures, and family history.  myInbox grants account holders a unique Healthspek email address and allows users to receive and save communications, documents, and medical records sent from their healthcare providers directly to a secure inbox for review.  With Healthspek you have a future.  Expect great new features and a library of Speks coming in future releases.  *** if you are an ACO, hospital system, or large employer, contact us regarding partnering: info@Healthspek.com

recent_reviews.title: Not good and a piece of garbage!!!!!
recent_reviews.author: Tfrog5489
recent_reviews.content: This is not good and this app is a piece of garbage and it's a total waste of money and time.... it's very clumsy and if you want the genentic profile you have to spend an arm and a leg on it and thank god I looked at the price before that. Dynotag is cheaper than this piece of garbage and thank stinking god I changed my email account so I wouldn't be bombarded by their stupid pathetic reps... STAY AWAY FROM THIS APP BECAUSE IT'S GARBAGE!!!!!!

recent_reviews.title: Not ready for prime time
recent_reviews.author: Pwem
recent_reviews.content: This app is unsatisfactory and clumsy to use.

recent_reviews.title: Fabulous!
recent_reviews.author: Hikbob
recent_reviews.content: It connects me to all my personal health information. Now I have instant access to my records anytime I have my phone, plus I can add info if needed. Very nice to use my PC or iPad for info input then have access on my phone.

recent_reviews.title: Crashing
recent_reviews.author: medschoolchic
recent_reviews.content: App keeps crashing for some reason. I reset my password, when I enter it in the login page and press "Sign in", the app just crashes...?

recent_reviews.title: Personal info will not update
recent_reviews.author: Jeremyalb4
recent_reviews.content: It was good at the start not anymore I can never update anything on here anymore gonna be switching apps don't bother with this one

recent_reviews.title: Garbage app
recent_reviews.author: Khan Hannan

name: DrChrono OnPatient Portal
description: Your personal health record is now on your iPhone and Apple Watch. Easily message and share health information data with your doctors.  Now you can check upcoming appointments and messages on your Apple Watch.  Also, integrated with Apple's Health, you can share your Health App data with your doctor, sending a 30-day wellness summary directly to your medical doctor.  Fumbling with and trying to find paper medical records is now a thing of the past. onpatient lets you schedule appointments, message with your doctor, access your medical records, see all of your medications and allergies, and import/share records from Health with your doctor.

Additionally, it appears that if your doctor, pharmacy, et cetera, is not on their list of providers (and it seems a rather limited list) YOU CAN'T MANUALLY ENTER THE INFORMATION. What?? Are you kidding? This is supposed to be where I can store my personal health/medical information and I can only list a doctor if they have subscribed to the DrChrono service???? Who designed this app and what were they thinking???

helpful_reviews.title: Great potential, needs improving
helpful_reviews.author: sdruest
helpful_reviews.content: We love having onpatient access to our provider. It helps when at specialists and saves me time waiting for phone calls back. I love being able to send photos and updates directly to the office!   We do not love that you can't synchronize more than one patient per account, making it impossible as a family of 5.  We also don't like how limiting the app is vs the web.  Dr. Chrono seems like a great tool, they just need to be more user friendly.  Please allow synchronized patients for parents!

helpful_reviews.title: Great when it works.
helpful_reviews.author: SatelliteTor
helpful_reviews.content: Super handy when it works, but it crashes frequently and has to be uninstalled then reinstalled. I hope they fix it because I’d like to keep using it.

helpful_reviews.title: Doesn’t work
helpful_reviews.author: SadThisAppDoesntWork
helpful_reviews.content: This doesn’t connect to my online account. A completely useless app. My account through the app looks blank (no doctor associated). However, all my bills, appointments and doctors do show up when using the web interface. So I know my account works, just this app doesn’t.

helpful_reviews.title: Not Created for Multiple Patients
helpful_reviews.author: SexySandy:)
helpful_reviews.content: As you’ve read in other reviews, you can not schedule appointments for multiple family members using app. Big downside for me attempting to manage my 2 children’s chiropractic appointments.

helpful_reviews.title: Glitch
helpful_reviews.author: Tenacious 15785433
helpful_reviews.content: I’m unable to send my dr an email. The app crashes!

helpful_reviews.title: Used to be 5 Stars - Now…...
helpful_reviews.author: Rev.WJFM
helpful_reviews.content: This app used to be my one stop shop for content updates to my child’s doctor by sending secure emails from my iPhone and receiving messages and scheduling appointments within the app - the newest update of the app has revoked these features and now is basically useless on my iPhone. I have to log in from my home computer to use the OnPatient website to correspond with my child’s Dr and Schedule appointments. This app in a information only app that allows for collection of data from your phone, but as I am contacting a doctor for my child and not myself, the integration of the biometric info is totally useless to me. So disappointed in this newest version of the app.  - the “support” link on the app store only takes you to the inpatient site that has not way of contacting tech support. Totally useless Needs Attention.

helpful_reviews.title: Description lies, or company doesn't know their own product
helpful_reviews.author: LDMartin1959
helpful_reviews.content: Company has either lied in their description of this app or their support people know nothing about their app: If you read the description of the app it is VERY CLEAR they claim it is for patients, not specifically (or exclusively) for doctors and medical staff. Yet, when you contact their support they will tell you that it is *NOT* designed for anyone to use except doctors and medical staff.  Additionally, it appears that if your doctor, pharmacy, et cetera, is not on their list of providers (and it seems a rather limited list) YOU CAN'T MANUALLY ENTER THE INFORMATION. What?? Are you kidding? This is supposed to be where I can store my personal health/medical information and I can only list a doctor if they have subscribed to the DrChrono service???? Who designed this app and what were they thinking???

helpful_reviews.title: Quick and Easy
helpful_reviews.author: owner1989
helpful_reviews.content: This is such a great way to allow patients to upload all of their information from the comfort of their own home. Instead of having to fill out all these forms in the doctors office, you can do it at home. So when you get into the doctor office you can be seen by the doctor sooner because you don't have to fill out and paperwork! Great Application.

helpful_reviews.title: Disappointed
helpful_reviews.author: SoCal Patient
helpful_reviews.content: First, there is no obvious way to log out once logged in so anyone has access to my health info unless I delete the app. Second, once the initial profile is completed by the patient, there is no way to edit it. Third, I tried to "read" the HIPAA statement but could not close it. When I tried to back out, I was sent to different screens and basically locked out. Much of the information I entered now does not appear in any field. I'm giving an extra star because the email function works nicely.

helpful_reviews.title: Why isn’t this a standard!?
helpful_reviews.author: theSquashSH
helpful_reviews.content: This should be a standard across the US, it would be incredible if all doctors made their records accessible through an app as easy as this one.  Also, according to their tech support, they are adding back in the message your doctor feature soon (which is pretty essential).

helpful_reviews.title: Hope I can use it in the future
helpful_reviews.author: Sacred Way
helpful_reviews.content: I have a critical illness that makes traveling difficult. This looked like a good app for me especially after reading all the reviews. Unfortunately, my doctors will not share and the hospitals do not want to be bothered. This might be something that can be legislated in the future to make health care more accessible, affordable, and allow the patients to be knowledgeable of their issues.

name: Teladoc
description: A DOCTOR’S CARE. ANYTIME. ANYWHERE. Teladoc® connects you with a board-certified doctor 24/7/365 through the convenience of phone or video visits. Within minutes, a doctor will contact you ready to listen, and resolve your issue. If medically necessary a prescription will be sent to your pharmacy of choice.   * It’s healthcare when and wherever you want it!  Teladoc doctors can diagnose, recommend treatment and prescribe medication, if medically necessary, for many medical issues, including: - Sore throat and stuffy nose  - Allergies  - Cold and flu symptoms  - Bronchitis  - Poison ivy  - Pink eye  - Respiratory infection  - Sinus problems  - Ear infection  And more…  HOW DOES IT WORK? Request a visit – Open the Teladoc App and request a visit, provide medical history and pay for the visit. Your Teladoc account is also available online at Teladoc.com or toll-free at 1-800-Teladoc.  Talk to a doctor – Within minutes, a state-licensed doctor reviews your medical history and contacts you via phone or video. Teladoc visits have no time limit; you can speak to the doctor for as long as you’d like.   Pick up prescription – The doctor discusses the issue with you, answers questions and recommends next steps.  If medically necessary, a prescription can be submitted to a local pharmacy of your choice.  HOW DO I GET TELADOC?  Teladoc is a service provided to you as a benefit through your employer, health insurance, or other organization.  Visit Teladoc.com to learn more.   This app allows Teladoc members to: - Authenticate your Teladoc account. - Talk to a doctor, anytime, anywhere. - Create and update your medical history. - Update personal, contact, login and billing information.  This app also utilizes Apple HealthKit integration to enhance your experience - Our seamless integration with HealthKit enables your provider to form a better diagnosis - We import your most recent historical medical details on blood pressure, temperature and heart rate right into the app - Your doctor will have access to these details before and during your visit - Our comprehensive view of your health will enhance your interaction with Teladoc

I asked the Pharmacist for a suggestion to reduce the discomfort. She replied that I likely had Thrush and that there was no over-the-counter remedy. It was now after 8:00 pm. What to do. I submitted a request per the steps outlined in the App and in a few minutes received a call from a Doctor who also agreed to the Thrush diagnosis. A short time later I was picking up not one but there scrips at the Walmart Pharmacy. The only cost to me being the usual co-pays for the meds. For those of us who travel far from home and Family Practitioner this is a real blessing. Thank you Dr. CarrğŸ’� -Bill W.

recent_reviews.title: Great past experience
recent_reviews.author: mankasboo
recent_reviews.content: I used Teladoc back in 2012 or 2013 several times and they was great! I was signing up for some service I canâ€™t remember what it was exactly (it wasnâ€™t Teladoc but they was doing some kind of promotional work for Teladoc) but they offered Teladoc services as a additional opportunity to try out. (I believe this may have been when they was possibly still introducing Teladoc) I canâ€™t recall the specific reasoning for all the calls I placed to Teladoc but I do know one of them was for bronchitis that I typically get like clockwork twice a year. It took only minutes to get a call back once requested and the doctor was awesome, he listened to my symptoms and without me stating that I pretty much knew it was bronchitis he determined that it was most likely bronchitis and then proceeded to place me on antibiotics that I picked up within the hour at my pharmacy. It was such a relief for me considering I didnâ€™t have insurance and just waiting out my illness was total misery and my only other option at the time. I recall my other experiences being similar with no complications. I havenâ€™t used Teladoc for a few years now but because of lack of insurance again I decided that it would be my best route considering it would soon be the time of year that I do have one of my battles with bronchitis. I havenâ€™t like I said, used them in several years so I canâ€™t give a to date review and will have to give a follow up review when I do but I see a lot of reviews of unhappy customers complaining of paying fees just to be told to go to their primary physician to receive treatment for issues that the customers are sure what they are and that the Teladoc program claims they treat. I seriously hope that this isnâ€™t a issue because it would definitely be a deal breaker for me. The greatness of this service is being able to get prescription antibiotics the couple of times a year I may possibly need them without paying the high ER bill for a doctor to unnecessarily examine me for a illness I am already positive I have.  Only time will tell but I will definitely be doing a updated review once I have experienced how their service is now.

recent_reviews.title: A
recent_reviews.author: hkayyford
recent_reviews.content: I'd personally rate just the app itself as a solid 4 star creation. However, the medical expertise and care was highly lacking. It would be a shame to be charged $45 for information that, as a non-professional, I or anyone else could have provided, and which I did already employ. (As inadequate the medical information online can be, I can say Google more assistance than my "visit" today.   The doctor was somewhat congenial, and I think probably sincerely, but perhaps was also rushed. It wasn't evident to me he had any desire to stop to listen to what I had to say. I'd try to interject to address what the doctor was saying, but he continued to talk over me. He didn't use the video call option requested/that is supposed to be one of the main benefits of this technology.   Further, I worked in a pharmacy for quite some while, and an orthopaedic surgeon's practice after that, and know a good deal about doctors' needing to weigh the risks of their prescribing privileges, as well as how their advise affects themselves, their employer, and patient physiologically, ethically, and legally. The doctor wouldn't know any of this experience, nor that as someone who likes to be outdoors often, I stay updated on hazardous fauna and flora.    Considering the lack of discussion and regard or aid that the physicians bore, my evaluation of this medical means is resultantly lowered. And, with the knowledge of drug contraindications, but what appeared to be a lack of examining my medical history, the doctor might have seen my request wasn't out of line. "Ice it," soak it, keep it clean...not even basic first aid that most people are aware of were his repeated lines, and go to your local doctor if no improvement...suggests apathy from the doctor and, by association, the company. Perhaps it would be wise of Teledoc to re-examine it's processes or check its his busyness or limited time to talk.  I'll likely discuss these unfortunately unfavorable results with my husband about the possibility of refuting charges because this, sadly once more, required about/at least as much time as waiting in a care clinic would have and provider less benefit.  I'm not one who wants to take medications; I've got enough to deal with already. However, when I make a doctor's visit or, in this case, call, though not an emergency, it's typically because I have serious and substantiated reason to be concerned. Now, I'm more concerned to have been duped for my money, which should be a concern for Teladoc. Thank you doe you're time, Hannah

recent_reviews.title: All but worthless.
recent_reviews.author: Ddsadfjyyffg
recent_reviews.content: As another review states,  it seems good on the surface, but I don’t generally need help diagnosing my illness. The doctors generally don’t listen and want to argue with me about what’s happening when I already know and just need a prescription.  If you have absolutely no idea of you have the flu and need someone to tell you to go see your doctor or an urgent care, then Teledoc is for you. I know what is going on with my body and I need an appropriate prescription and here in lies the problem.  For example, I get bronchitis-like symptoms and have for years.  Years ago a primary care doc I had before he moved started me on an albuterol inhaler, mucinex and Z-pack when the symptoms reared up.  This has helped me get better every time and avoid bronchitis.  I get this a couple times a year and I have tried waiting it out on several occasions, but without the meds it has lasted 2 months, progressively getting worse until it turns into pneumonia.  So the way to fix it is with these three meds and it gets headed off before it gets real bad.   Getting the Z-pack is impossible because the docs tell me it won’t work.  Well I am 53 years old and heave been dealing with this for over 20 years and it DOES work.  What is the point of Teledoc if they refuse the simple prescription that will solve problem  in a couple days? I’m not looking for narcotics/pain meds, just an antibiotic....that works!  Now I get to go spend $160 at Urgent care.  Thanks for nothing Teledoc!

Don’t waste your time or money these losers and robbers.

recent_reviews.content: I’ve used Teladoc three times now and I’ve always had a great experience with the doctors. I had to call customer service today because I couldn’t remember my password. Carrie went above and beyond to help me out. She was patient, polite, and knew exactly what to do to fix my problem. She even updated my health information for me so that I didn’t have to do it. I take a lot of medications and it’s hard to remember all of them. I kept forgetting the names of the meds I was taking, but Carrie was super sweet and didn’t make me feel bad about the situation. She made me feel appreciated, which was very nice considering a lot of customer service these days in general is subpar. Once I got off of the phone with Carrie, I literally got a call 30 seconds later from the doctor who took my case, Dr. Javvaji. She was also very kind and like-able. She gave me some extra tips to help me with my sinus infection, tips that I never would’ve even thought of on my own. She spoke to me like one of her own patients, which I really appreciated. She also knew exactly what to do to solve my health problems. Great service all around. Il definitely continue using Teladoc.

recent_reviews.title: Beware in Georgia
recent_reviews.author: SuperSlouch
recent_reviews.content: What could have been. Beware using this service in Georgia.   I first contacted Teladoc last Thursday as I had been fighting some allergy and sinus issues for the three weeks prior.  Within 30 minutes of setting up an account I had a video visit with a doctor, a diagnosis of a sinus infection, and a 7-10 day cycle of antibiotics prescribed by the physician. I was told Georgia law only allowed the physician to prescribe three days worth of medication and I would need to call back for another refill.   So I finished my three day prescription on Monday and call Teladoc back to get a refill to keep my antibiotic cycle going. I was told by a rep that because I did not call within 72 hours that I would need another visit to get a refill. She made it clear I needed to call back the next time within the 72-hour window for refills. So, she schedules me a phone visit with another doctor who prescribes another three day supply and makes it clear to me I need to call within 72 hours to have my prescription refilled again to complete the cycle.   Thursday morning, within the 72 hour time window, I message Teladoc about a refill and am told I need to see a primary care physician. I call the number and speak with a representative and she tells me I did the right thing and someone from the Rx team would contact me to get the prescription refilled.   I get the call from a nurse, who transfers me to the Operations Manager, who then tells me that everyone I spoke to previously was wrong and that Teladoc can not refill the medication their doctors prescribed to me. After two visits, three people telling me to call within the 72 hour window, and two hours back and forth with representatives I am denied further care with the reason being everyone I had spoken to previously was incorrect. I explained again that I was given a 7 to 10 day treatment plan by Teladoc doctors but no help.   Needless to say, I cant schedule a visit with my PCP for over a month due to their backlog. I am feeling somewhat better but not 100% and Teladoc did not show they care about making sure I am well. The Operations Manager even agreed with me that I am on my own and out of luck.   In summary, avoid using this service in the state of Georgia. Teladoc staff do not know the rules and no matter how many times someone tells you to do something, there is a caveat to that; they will deny service and really act like they donâ€™t care about your health at all due to the laws regarding their practices in Georgia. It would be nice if they told me upfront and honest about what kind of service they can provide rather than keeping me on the hook only to dump me to the side when I was nearing conclusion of their prescribed diagnosis and treatment. Donâ€™t make the same mistake I did.

recent_reviews.author: Choppas80
recent_reviews.content: Overall, the app is ok but it does have a few drawbacks. For one, you can schedule an appointment but you cannot reschedule or cancel an appointment via the app. When you want to reschedule or cancel, you have to call in to the Teledoc company. Even then, you either have to wait on the phone for a representative, that ends up having you call somewhere else to get the help you need. In the end, you have to leave a message for someone. Teledoc advertises that it is available 24/7-365, so I can’t understand why you would have to leave a voicemail?! The only positive is that it can occasionally be quicker than getting in to see a doctor. Although, you personal doctor knows you better and is more apt to treat you and your symptoms better.

recent_reviews.title: I’m pregnant
recent_reviews.author: crazy prego lady
recent_reviews.content: I’m pregnant I would like to go see someone in person rather then over my phone and I can’t find a list of places to go because I can only contact someone on my phone and I have to pay 10$ just to find if there’s a Obgyn around me to help with me and the baby

recent_reviews.title: Keeps crashing
recent_reviews.author: w.w.e.
recent_reviews.content: Every time I open the app it crashes after a few seconds. Deleted and downloaded again but it keeps happening.

recent_reviews.title: Visit
recent_reviews.author: bnorii
recent_reviews.content: Doctor would not give me a prescription. He said I needed to see a dermatologist for more testing. Said the nurse would give me a referral. When I did not get the referral I asked and was told it’s against their policy to give referrals. What is the point of wasting time and money if they are going to do ZERO to help you. I will be deleting this crap app.

recent_reviews.title: Incredibly helpful
recent_reviews.author: Emmmmmily❤❤❤
recent_reviews.content: Every time I have used this app it has helped me SO MUCH. I get migraines quite often and they have prescribed me the same meds I would receive at the ER. So easy, and much quicker then the ER and Urgent Care. Thank you, Teladoc!

recent_reviews.title: Crashing
recent_reviews.author: Vikingqb7
recent_reviews.content: App keeps crashing

recent_reviews.title: App keeps crashing
recent_reviews.author: Bwall4735
recent_reviews.content: App keeps crashing, tried uninstalling and reinstalling without improvement.  Have an iPhone C running iOS 11.4.1.

recent_reviews.title: Right place.  Right time.
recent_reviews.author: A Sarge
recent_reviews.content: I love this service.

recent_reviews.title: Time zone issues
recent_reviews.author: Brf7
recent_reviews.content: The app has time zone issues. I live in Arizona which floats between Pacific and mountain standard time. The app scheduled an appointment in Mountain standard time when Arizona is currently in Pacific time which screwed everyone up. The app needs to be fixed to correctly recognize where a person is located and what time zone they are currently in.

recent_reviews.title: Login troubles
recent_reviews.author: Just*B
recent_reviews.content: I can’t login successfully. I have my username and password written down and everytime it suggests I’m wrong and instructs me to call. I spend 20 minutes going over my address and security questions, I’ve changed my password so many times?! Drives me insane.

recent_reviews.title: $45 for nothing
recent_reviews.author: August "Spud" West
recent_reviews.content: This was a waste of time and money.   Doctor hardly asked any differential questions at all. Recommended the most basic interventions possible.   Cordial, but worthless.

recent_reviews.title: Waste of time
recent_reviews.author: Milo 541
recent_reviews.content: Doctors don’t call at schedules times.  One doc simply did not call call for 30 minutes - no explanation or message was offered.  Customer support is horrible - they don’t answer the phone.  Unnecessary limits on what Teledoc DRs are allowed to treat and prescribe.  The app itself is clunky with overly heavy handed security.   I tried Teledoc because my local doctors office is a bureaucratic mess, unfortunately Teledoc has many of the same problems.

recent_reviews.title: Very Valuable Service !  :-)
recent_reviews.author: Frank - Tennessee USA
recent_reviews.content: Thank you TELADOC for being here, available to me and others. Your service is great, easy, quality. I don’t need medical care often st all, but always TELADOC makes it possible for me to get the care I need, when, and where I need it, rather than go without for days or weeks without. I travel often, so medical care is difficult to access since a “new patient” wherever I go when away from home, but with TELADOC, I am always going to a familiar medical provider of mine. Thanks TELADOC!

recent_reviews.title: Great!
recent_reviews.author: NeenaMary
recent_reviews.content: I have used Teladoc several times and have  always had great service from them with  very understanding doctors.

recent_reviews.title: Takes too little by to set up
recent_reviews.author: aa7246
recent_reviews.content: I tried to be prepared to use this app by entering all information as soon as I registered but I wasn’t prompted to enter medical history until my child was actually sick and I needed to use the service. It was beyond stressful to track down all of his medications and dosages and doctor visits while we were dealing with a sick child. This should have been part of the initial setup or we should have the option to skip. I nearly gave up and went to a clinic rather than try to get past the medical history pages. Very frustrating

recent_reviews.title: So helpful
recent_reviews.author: pedserrn123
recent_reviews.content: Wonderful way to get fast speeding care.

recent_reviews.title: Unresponsive
recent_reviews.author: goose0673
recent_reviews.content: If you like automated messages this apps for you.  If you want to talk to a doc, not so much.  Didn’t need BP treatment before but since dealing with this I might.

recent_reviews.title: Great
recent_reviews.author: mlcorrales
recent_reviews.content: Fast, easy & painless right in the privacy of my bedroom!

recent_reviews.title: Not worth the trouble
recent_reviews.author: bbbmom5
recent_reviews.content: I setup my account 2 days ago and was able to speak with a doctor very quickly. This part worked great!  I had side effects from the prescription the doctor prescribed so I went back into the Teledoc app to speak to another doctor and I was not able to continue because the app could not verify my medical records. They verified them 2 days ago!  I don’t understand why it worked 2 days ago but not today.  I called customer service and they said I needed to setup a temp account and start my medical history all over again!  This took 30 minutes to set up last time. I decided it would be faster to go to urgent care. I do not recommend this service.  It’s not as easy as it sounds.

recent_reviews.title: Need the app to communicate with mobile
recent_reviews.author: Unkle Monky
recent_reviews.content: I tried using the browser first and the video was not supported on my iPad. Once I set up my acct and got signed into the app I was already in the que from trying in the browser.   I saw a Family Medicine Doctor Cole. I shared a photo of a rash. He sent an RX to my pharmacy to treat symptoms. He advised me if it returns then I’ll need to see my pcp to discuss managing it as a chronic condition.   So very easy, inexpensive and as good as face to face visit.

recent_reviews.title: Worthlesss company
recent_reviews.author: The Web King 11
recent_reviews.content: Worse than the rest of the healthcare system which is saying a lot.  Don’t waste your time. It takes forever to set up and they almost always need you to call someone. You can’t just do anything through the app.  Then, you wait 45 minutes and no docs answer. Just ignore this company and you’ll be in better health.

recent_reviews.title: Very simple
recent_reviews.author: mark elCapitan
recent_reviews.content: It’s very user friendly. Thanks for making this simple.

recent_reviews.title: Initial experience
recent_reviews.author: Eat2Enjoy
recent_reviews.content: My first experience with a doctor using this app was terrible. At this time, I would not recommend using this service.

recent_reviews.title: Very Satisfied aside from one “Bad-Egg” Doc
recent_reviews.author: rkdr4
recent_reviews.content: This service has been such a convenience for my family. With a young baby, it has been so nice to be able to use Teledoc as opposed to packing a baby with us to our own doctor’s appointments. We have also used Teledoc on weekends when our doctor’s office was not open and while on vacation in another state- each time free of charge, amazing!! Our only issue was getting a doctor once whose lack of listening and problem-identification skills meant we had to advocate strongly for ourselves in order to get appropriate care. This seems to have been a fluke, however, and without this encounter, we would have given Teledoc 5 stars.

recent_reviews.title: Easy to navigate but...
recent_reviews.author: gemd65
recent_reviews.content: Was unable to upload my photo or take a photo. I would get a white screen every single time. I have an iPhone 6plus?

recent_reviews.title: Do Not Use
recent_reviews.author: Ozstl
recent_reviews.content: Do not use this service unless you aren’t sick.  My insurance provider was pushing it so we signed up.   We were traveling and my son had a clear sinus infection struggling with it for sever days. After taking our payment (they have that part down) the Dr or whatever she was told him to see if it get’s better in a few days and if not see a Dr.    They ask almost no questions and wanted to get off the phone fast.  Seriously they charged us for this.    Worst part is when we called to complain they said.  Oh, well have to call you back.   Horrible service.

recent_reviews.title: Amazed!
recent_reviews.author: Hollisua
recent_reviews.content: I just used Teladoc for the first time and I am truly amazed! The sign up process was seamless and the app is super easy to navigate. A doctor called me less than a minute after I filled out my appointment request and he was very nice and understanding. I would highly recommend this service to a friend or colleague but I am sorry to hear other people had bad experiences.

recent_reviews.title: Great Call
recent_reviews.author: ljfzlutsljgzljfzjfz
recent_reviews.content: The doc was wonderful - great advice on mental health issues

recent_reviews.title: So so
recent_reviews.author: mom2*3
recent_reviews.content: I love convenience… I just wished I could understand what the doctor says! I’m not sure how many doctors there are, but these last 3 to 4 times I’ve called I have gotten a doctor with a very strong accent that I can’t understand.

recent_reviews.title: 1st Time user
recent_reviews.author: Goobly doobly
recent_reviews.content: Things went real smooth with setting up a request

recent_reviews.title: Saves me time, stress, & money
recent_reviews.author: ladcraig
recent_reviews.content: Today, I spoke to a dr about my allergies. I saw an allergist last year, know what helps me, and was able to video chat with the dr and have my prescriptions filled in the time it would have taken me drive to my primary care dr. Love the convenience and security of knowing I have a dr on call if/when needed.

recent_reviews.title: Quick and easy
recent_reviews.author: Donkey1818
recent_reviews.content: The title says it all

recent_reviews.title: Amazing!
recent_reviews.author: Toomeykids
recent_reviews.content: We have used TelADoc for a few months and we love it!!

recent_reviews.title: GREAT!!!
recent_reviews.author: OMINIKKI
recent_reviews.content: My family has used Teledoc five times and we love the service. Saves us time waiting at urgent care or making an appointment, gas, and energy you don’t have when you’re sick.

recent_reviews.title: First Visit Was a Pleasant Experience
recent_reviews.author: OCTraveller
recent_reviews.content: The Doctor assigned to me was professional and helpful. I knew I had an UTI because I had many times before. Told the Dr my symptoms and results of an in home test and prescription was on its way. Pharmacy called 10 min later to say it was ready.  My alternative was the urgent care at twice the cost and 10 times the wait. It was a Sunday.  I would not hesitate to use again.

recent_reviews.title: Professional and convenient
recent_reviews.author: Psalms 100
recent_reviews.content: Thank you for prompt and friendly service.

recent_reviews.title: A fabulous app
recent_reviews.author: Amazing Grace Interiors
recent_reviews.content: This is a phenomenal service.  Especially on weekends when your primary care physicians office is closed.  Urgent Care and emergency room visits are costly.

recent_reviews.title: Best in the world
recent_reviews.author: Michellelo67
recent_reviews.content: I love Teladoc it saves me money and time in emergency’s!!!

recent_reviews.title: Easy registration and appointment setting
recent_reviews.author: $moki
recent_reviews.content: Before treatment, this completely blows away the experience of waiting in urgent care!

recent_reviews.title: I love teledoc
recent_reviews.author: Dacon
recent_reviews.content: Many a time it was there when I just couldn’t get to dr. There always there ... love love love it

recent_reviews.title: Convenient
recent_reviews.author: ScootahGee
recent_reviews.content: This is the best for sinus infections and slight discomforts!

recent_reviews.title: Love this app
recent_reviews.author: meoooooowz
recent_reviews.content: So convenient and from my experience with the professionals so far, they’ve always been very caring.

recent_reviews.title: A++++
recent_reviews.author: MaalWells
recent_reviews.content: Nothing is better than being able to speak to a doc while in bed. Doctors are prompt and professional. I recommend to everyone!

recent_reviews.title: Service is getting better!
recent_reviews.author: Carol DC
recent_reviews.content: Been using Teladoc for almost a year now.  Initially had horrible experiences but this app has helped me a few times recently, so I am now trying it more often.  I wish that the responses from dermatologists were quicker but they’ve been helpful once they’ve answered.  Hope the app and company continues to improve their service.

recent_reviews.title: It NOT worth your time!
recent_reviews.author: Mystikah
recent_reviews.content: Quick to charge Our credit card but wouldn’t offer any solution! I am so depressed the Dr. told ME to go somewhere else! Nah, that so rude to tell a patient to “Go somewhere else “. I am asking for help and I got turn away smh. Wow! I can’t stop crying I’m out of meds and I can’t get in to see My primary Dr til August!!! So in the meantime I am gonna have bad thoughts racing! If your looking for a Dr. run the other way as fast as you can! They only want to charge your credit card!!! Never again! I think half the people who gave good scores are probably the employees and Drs! Giving themselves praise! BS!

recent_reviews.title: Not impressed
recent_reviews.author: Nicole's Ipod video
recent_reviews.content: I had a painful knot on my head show up and I was worried it was the result of a spider bite. I requested a visit ASAP. 3 hours later.... I’ve now had two doctors reviewing my file and my request has all of a sudden disappeared from my file. Looks like I’ll be using my primary physician from now on.

recent_reviews.title: It’s good I guess
recent_reviews.author: BrookebPaige
recent_reviews.content: The photos don’t load in the app. The wait times are always a long time, even with a scheduled one, you’re looking at like a hour wait after. The support team is helpful but the customer support thing takes hours too.

recent_reviews.title: Great first experience
recent_reviews.author: LAwoman91766
recent_reviews.content: I needed a refill on my meds and no time to make it into the drs office. This was sooo easy and all done within 5 minutes.  Love this service.

recent_reviews.title: Very disappointing
recent_reviews.author: blazeshell
recent_reviews.content: I thought this was going to be great tool to have for medical care. It took a long time to set it up with someone on the phone, so I decided to upload my profile through the app. That didn’t take as long. Once I finished setting up my profile I needed to have a video chat for my daughter. I waited 2 hours to only receive a call asking if I could switch my apt to a phone call. At this point I just wanted to talk to a doctor. So I agreed. The lady ran a “test” call to make sure the phone call would come through and it did. Great I’m thinking, I will finally be able to talk to someone. I waited for another hour and as I’m waiting I’m getting notices that doctors are reviewing my profile.   I’m getting no phone calls no notifications that someone is trying to contact me. I check the app and then I check my email. Sure enough I get an email saying my apt has been cancelled. That a doctor had tried to contact me 3 times. Now that I’ve  been waiting for almost 3 hours I am really annoyed and upset for waisting so much time. I call again and talked to someone to figure out what happened. Why I didn’t receive a phone call. He said it showed that there was an attempt by a doctor to contact me. I let him know we did a test call and that came through. I checked my phone to make sure i didn’t miss any call and the last call that showed was from the “test” call.  So ultimately this is not a great option for getting medical attention. I had high hopes that this would be easy, but save your time and energy and call your physician office instead!

recent_reviews.title: Don’t bother me with your review bs
recent_reviews.author: Rich(8/85296/96/&)/
recent_reviews.content: I give every requested review a negative one. Tired of this BS.

recent_reviews.title: Wait time
recent_reviews.author: CMM987
recent_reviews.content: Called on a Saturday night. Had to wait over an hour just for them to call and tell me that the wait would be so long they couldn’t give me time that a doctor would be able to call. Of course, this was after they took my money.

recent_reviews.title: Impossible to get help
recent_reviews.author: racing_Girl 14
recent_reviews.content: The only time I got a doctor, they said my issue is cause I’m fat. Next time I tried, scheduled a visit and got no call even an hour after the scheduled time (and ten minute text warning) and their 1-800 support couldn’t figure out why or get ahold of anyone to tell me why. Never talked to anyone that day. Desperate now for a doctor and have to work 10 hour days the next three days, did the ASAP visit... guess within a few minutes means within an hour. Does anyone ever actually call or do they just get your hopes for help up?

recent_reviews.title: Total Ripoff
recent_reviews.author: Tedster 1234554321
recent_reviews.content: Used Teladoc for a dermatologist recommendation for Acutane. Read the terms and conditions, nothing said anything about Acutane specifically, so I went through with the meeting, $75. The Doctor couldn’t prescribe me anything and just basically agreed with me that it would be a good idea to get on Acutane. I ALREADY KNEW THAT! I DID NOT NEED TO PAY TELADOC $75 FOR THEM TO TELL ME THAT! Submitted a request for a refund and was denied. Do yourself a favor and just see a real Doctor!

recent_reviews.title: Pic sharing
recent_reviews.author: FIREn19
recent_reviews.content: I tried to set an appointment with pics of poison ivy rash. App froze up. Grrrrrrr. So had to shut phone off and restart. Skipped the pics and is now a general medical consult

recent_reviews.title: Life saver!
recent_reviews.author: Billduenow
recent_reviews.content: I love Teladoc! They have been there ALWAYS at anytime. They have meet my family medical needs and SAVE me a ton of money! Thank you!

recent_reviews.title: It deserves zero stars
recent_reviews.author: Consumer19
recent_reviews.content: More than an hour trying to log in. Finally worked then spent another 20 minutes completing questionnaire only to be kicked off.   Finally logged in on the website and requested an appt for times offered. Provider declined and suggested a time that I specifically noted I was not available. No way to cancel online or in the app, you have to call and listen to their inane voice prompts and wait on hold. First attempt will be the last. Bye.

recent_reviews.title: Easy
recent_reviews.author: Deano0077
recent_reviews.content: This is a great way to make a doctor visit.

recent_reviews.title: Logging in is a pain!!!
recent_reviews.author: SpaGirl321
recent_reviews.content: All you’re doing when you log in is requesting a call. You answer security questions & if you can’t remember your password, you’re screwed. I thought this was supposed to be for convenience, but every time I use it, it is very INconvenient !

recent_reviews.title: I am so grateful for Teldoc
recent_reviews.author: Grateful and feeling better
recent_reviews.content: I had a roaring UTI. I was in so much discomfort. It was part of a holiday weekend and the Doctor’s office was closed. I requested a call from Teldoc and they called within minutes. She called my local pharmacy right after we hung up the phones. I had my medicine within 20 minutes. Teldoc was so worth it.

recent_reviews.title: Ear infection
recent_reviews.author: Msfyrkat
recent_reviews.content: Had an ear infection for a week. Was told to go to the emergency room. No script nothing! What’s the point of using this? I can get better advise going on the internet and it’s free. I would give it zero stars for its webmd advice.

recent_reviews.title: Great Service
recent_reviews.author: D_gonzales
recent_reviews.content: I’ve used Teladoc for about 1-2 years and received relatively good care. The reasons I’m giving it 5 stars is because 8 out of 10 times I’ve received good care from the doctors. They are very helpful and knowledgeable about whatever I’m going through and they listen to what I tell them. I generally know what’s going on with me and they do a great job of listening to me and my concerns, and putting me at ease.

recent_reviews.title: Convenient!!!
recent_reviews.author: Starlaparrott
recent_reviews.content: I love this app - I can take it anywhere and it has come in handy for my family and myself several times!! I love that I don't have to leave where I am to talk to a doctor.

recent_reviews.title: Bell
recent_reviews.author: Nickey Bell
recent_reviews.content: No need is using this. Just make an appointment with your regular doctor or go to urgent care if your a fan!!!!! This would be a total waste of your money and time!

recent_reviews.title: READ THE REVIEWS.. It’s waste of money
recent_reviews.author: Maannj
recent_reviews.content: I was fooled by the 4.8 stars rating, don’t do the same mistake and read the reviews yourself before you waste your money. You will see hundreds similar stories, none of them are happy. If you need real care GO SEE A DOCTOR who can actually prescribe a treatment. This is NOT the same. Now my story is below  The doctor recommended me a medication then literally asked me to go see a doctor to get the prescription because Teladoc doesn’t allow them to prescribe it. They actually charged me the full specialist fees like exactly what you would pay to see specialist doctor. And now I have to visit another real doctor physically and pay the same amount I just paid to get the prescription. The irony? Teladoc FAQ web page clearly states the doctor is allowed to prescribe it. So I was tricked into believing I’m going to see real doctor. It’s either the doctor lied or Teladoc lied in their FAQ and they do indeed disallow prescription? I don’t know but I know for sure if I visited real doctor from the beginning I would’ve gotten the better treatment at cheaper cost

recent_reviews.title: Horrible! Totally unprofessional
recent_reviews.author: AR0780
recent_reviews.content: The first provider I attempted to use rescheduled me TWICE for our initial appointment with no explanation, the first time 15 mins after our appt was supposed to start, and the second time about 15 mins prior.  then when I proposed times for yet a third initial appointment and asked her to please be professional and honor the next appointment we make, I never heard back from her again. Um, is this medical practice or Tinder..?  I know it’s a half-price doc, but seriously?  We live in a small town with few medical options, so I’m trying again with a different Teledoc provider and hoping for the best.

recent_reviews.title: Love Teladoc
recent_reviews.author: Kimberly_quilts
recent_reviews.content: I’m so happy our insurance offers Teladoc to us as part of our plan.   Being able to do a simple visit from where ever we are is perfect. The convenience of the service is my favorite part, but I also love the quick care they provide.   I have used the service many times for all family members for a variety of reasons and was satisfied with each consult.   The physicians are very caring and take time to really understand what you are calling for.  The option to add photos is great.   I recommend Teladoc to everyone.

recent_reviews.title: Great idea poorly implemented
recent_reviews.author: twinkletwinkletoes
recent_reviews.content: The UI is terrible and I hope you never need to call customer service as no one is available and if they are they probably can’t help you.

recent_reviews.title: Love this Option
recent_reviews.author: The Marsh Family
recent_reviews.content: I am so glad that my insurance gives us Teledoc as part of our plan!!

recent_reviews.title: It could be better
recent_reviews.author: Teonsellsjax
recent_reviews.content: App crashes A LOT. In turn you restart too many times for one appointment.

recent_reviews.title: Incredible Convenience
recent_reviews.author: Sachelle777
recent_reviews.content: As a busy mother other of two appreciate this being part of our plan to seek medical attention as quickly as possible when primary care may be all booked and being able to be proactive about their health needs and combat issues quickly!

recent_reviews.title: Amazing and so helpful! Thank you!
recent_reviews.author: linds rar
recent_reviews.content: Kartik K. Patel, MD conducted my phone consultation just now for an unexpected sinus infection I’ve acquired while traveling for my job. His assessment was thorough and convenient. This is one of the best advances in apps and technology related to medicine in my opinion. He was extremely nice and helpful. He called in an antibiotic for me immediately. I am so grateful for this service. Thank you Dr. Patel and Teledoc. I wish I could give this 50 stars!

recent_reviews.title: First time user
recent_reviews.author: Thomas6606
recent_reviews.content: Filling out your admittance was almost as bad as going to the local docs.  Hopefully now that it is done the rest will be more useful.  If it is I’ll upgrade this review.

recent_reviews.title: Wasted time...
recent_reviews.author: Mandy's 5S
recent_reviews.content: In the beginning, Teladoc was good but as of late, it’s a big waste of time. Barely understand what’s being said because of the thick accents...lots of repeating on both ends. When you are lucky enough to get your issue somewhat understood, they just recommend you go to dr/urgent care/ER. Just cut out the middle man. :(

recent_reviews.title: Absolutely Awesome!!!
recent_reviews.author: #1 dudes
recent_reviews.content: Could not have asked for a better service. Phone rang with in under a minute. Dr. was very kind and courteous. Called in a prescription for a simple problem within 10 minutes. Two days later the problem was seeming resistant so I went on Teladoc to ask a nurse how long I should wait to notice a difference on the antibiotics. They called me very quickly and had already spoken to the doctor. Was going to call in a new script for me but it was one that I recognized as making me sick in the past so they got hold of the doctor again and then called me back with another new prescription. called in another script to my pharmacy right away. It cost me $45 total. That was my fee for the initial transaction. Could not ask for more. I would highly recommend this to anyone. Cost me at least half of what it would have at my doctors office and I have insurance.

recent_reviews.title: Eye infection
recent_reviews.author: Gene 18
recent_reviews.content: This was a awful and useless visit. MD charged and referred me to primary care for a stye on my eyelid that became infected. I sent a picture and described my symptoms. What a waste and useless benefit my employer has provided for me! A antibiotic eye drop could have been ordered. I don’t think I’ll ever use Teledoc again!

recent_reviews.title: Best Service
recent_reviews.author: ProVerizon
recent_reviews.content: This app is awesome especially when your sick and don’t want to leave your house and spread your germs about

recent_reviews.title: Can’t upload photos
recent_reviews.author: Creative Flute
recent_reviews.content: Great idea, fine app. But the app crashes when you want to upload photos to add to your appointment. Tried it 3 times. :(

recent_reviews.title: Worst experience ever
recent_reviews.author: allied5631
recent_reviews.content: I put in for a dermatology appointment for a severe allergic reaction. The app said someone would be in touch within 48 hours. Seemed long but I was willing to wait to have a real dermatologist give me a consult. I kept checking the app for when my appointment would occur. Today — it was all gone as if I’d never requested it. I called customer service and was told they did not have a dermatologist available so they cancelled it. What I don’t understand is why it took them over 24 hours to figure out they did not have someone and also why NOONE MESSAGED OR TOLD ME my appointment was cancelled so I lost even more time before I realized. I went to CVS minute clinic and on 15 mins had a prescription from the nurse practitioner. The whole thing left a very negative impression.

recent_reviews.title: Medicine
recent_reviews.author: smishalanie
recent_reviews.content: I called needing stronger medicine for athletes foot. Dr. called in over the counter medicine I was already using.

recent_reviews.title: Very Disappointing Service
recent_reviews.author: Fe Lie On

recent_reviews.author: Mo33333
recent_reviews.content: My first experience with Teledoc started with a request being made around 11 pm for the 24 hour line. There is no option to delay this meeting after it has been requested. Unable to sleep because I had a painful UTI, I sat up waiting in this call. That's fine and understandable to me. When I received a call at 2:00am, it wasn't a health professional. A scheduler asked if we could set meeting at 7:00am - leaving me no time to go to the pharmacy before my commute to work. Still, I understood; but the scheduler insisted a doctor had tried to call me and was unable to get through. I explained I had been waiting and hadn't received any calls. She proceeded to explain that I most likely didn't answer since they call from private numbers. I protested that I would have answered and she wrote me off. For someone waiting up until 2:00am for a call, with no option to reschedule, while experiencing some level of discomfort - this experience and blatant disregard for the truth - was very upsetting. Don't lie to your customers about calling.

After explaining that Iâ€™ve had a hacking cough for a week (non-smoker), the doctor said that the cause must be viral.  If it was longer than a week, then it was bacterial.  So, couldnâ€™t it be either/or at that point?  She didnâ€™t think so.  2.  If it was bacterial, she said I should get a script for Augmentin.  Problem is, I have a penicillin allergy.  Not exactly observant.  3.  After saying I was producing mucus, she didnâ€™t bother to ask what color it was, which could give an indicator of the cause.  4.  She recommended Mucinex-DM, which is a terrible product to recommend because while the guaifenesin component breaks up the mucus, the dextromethorphan prevents you from coughing it out, so it just sits there in someoneâ€™s lungs.    Bad recommendations.  Bad experience.  Disappointed.

One incident was when I knew my daughter had a UTI and we had a horrible blizzard coming in. The doctor refused to do anything, even though itâ€™s on the list of things they can treat, and we were still charged for the visit. I then had to rush to urgent care where it was confirmed but by this time the blizzard had come in and we couldnâ€™t make it to the pharmacy due to there being accidents everywhere. We were lucky we made it home. I also know when my kids have an ear infection. Itâ€™s usually a secondary infection that follows a cold for them and then they get a fever and ear pain. I had 2 kids with these symptoms and it was a Saturday. I requested visits for both on teladoc. One doctor for one child said â€œYes, thatâ€™s typical of an ear infection so I will send over the prescription to the pharmacy.â€� And the other doctors gave me a really hard time and acted like I didnâ€™t know what I was talking about. I was afraid he also wasnâ€™t going to prescribe the antibiotic my son needed but he eventually did. It makes me hesitant to use this but I feel like itâ€™s my only option sometimes.
