If you have absolutely no idea of you have the flu and need someone to tell you to go see your doctor or an urgent care, then Teledoc is for you. I know what is going on with my body and I need an appropriate prescription and here in lies the problem.  For example, I get bronchitis-like symptoms and have for years.  Years ago a primary care doc I had before he moved started me on an albuterol inhaler, mucinex and Z-pack when the symptoms reared up.  This has helped me get better every time and avoid bronchitis.  I get this a couple times a year and I have tried waiting it out on several occasions, but without the meds it has lasted 2 months, progressively getting worse until it turns into pneumonia.  So the way to fix it is with these three meds and it gets headed off before it gets real bad.   Getting the Z-pack is impossible because the docs tell me it wonâ€™t work.  Well I am 53 years old and heave been dealing with this for over 20 years and it DOES work.  What is the point of Teledoc if they refuse the simple prescription that will solve problem  in a couple days? Iâ€™m not looking for narcotics/pain meds, just an antibiotic....that works!  Now I get to go spend $160 at Urgent care.  Thanks for nothing Teledoc!

helpful_reviews.title: Good In Theory
helpful_reviews.author: KK Nickname
helpful_reviews.content: Teladoc has the best of intentions, but it canâ€™t stick the landing. Getting a doctor on the phone and diagnosed with the flu was easy and quick...enough. Where it falls apart is with prescriptions. The first pharmacy I chose was using the list generated by the Teladoc App. It went through just fine. But when I called to see when my prescription would be done, that is when I fell into the deep dark abyss that is their method for re-routing a prescription, which seems to involve bumping to the end of a very long line of other people that also found themselves in a bind. Almost whopping four hours later, now at 3 am, I called the new pharmacy only to discover...they donâ€™t have Tamiflu. Porting it to get a new place would probably now take another 4 hours, so just paid yet another $5 to talk to yet another doctor just to get the prescription sent to the right place. Itâ€™s been ten minutes since the call and I donâ€™t see a new prescription. I can tell that Iâ€™m going to end up at my doctorâ€™s office in the morning, having been up all night trying to get this prescription and $10 poorer for my efforts. So far, Teladoc was a massive waste of my time. And money. And flagging energy under the weight of the worst flu season in years.

The fact is they should send me $40 back for overpayment but itâ€™s been 2 months and they are impossible to deal with.

helpful_reviews.title: Absolutely Awesome!!!
helpful_reviews.author: #1 dudes
helpful_reviews.content: Could not have asked for a better service. Phone rang with in under a minute. Dr. was very kind and courteous. helpful_reviews.title: Don't waste you time with Teledoc
helpful_reviews.author: lititzpenna
helpful_reviews.content: Just had my 1st interaction with Teledoc as it is part of our companies benefit package. If you like being read to from a script, this may be the service for you. The what I hope was a physician whom called me, went through a very brief medical history which was fine. Then he asked symptoms. I related my symptoms and he then I felt read from a script of what I had and told me 4 or 5 over the counter products I needed to take. I assured him I have had this before and it's not viral, as was his assumption. I told him I wouldn't have wasted his time, my time or the money to call if over the counter products had worked in the past. He got irate and said "no antibiotics for you, it's a cold" and then hung up the phone. Entire call lasted 2 minutes and 53 seconds.  Have left a message at Teledoc NY office. Will be interesting to see if I hear from them.  Guess I should have known better.......  Will try and get an appointment with my physician.

helpful_reviews.title: Not actually open 24/4 and other false information

helpful_reviews.content: My first experience with Teledoc started with a request being made around 11 pm for the 24 hour line. There is no option to delay this meeting after it has been requested. Still, I understood; but the scheduler insisted a doctor had tried to call me and was unable to get through. I explained I had been waiting and hadn't received any calls. For someone waiting up until 2:00am for a call, with no option to reschedule, while experiencing some level of discomfort - this experience and blatant disregard for the truth - was very upsetting. Don't lie to your customers about calling.

helpful_reviews.title: Very Satisfied aside from one â€œBad-Eggâ€� Doc
helpful_reviews.author: rkdr4
helpful_reviews.content: This service has been such a convenience for my family. With a young baby, it has been so nice to be able to use Teledoc as opposed to packing a baby with us to our own doctorâ€™s appointments. We have also used Teledoc on weekends when our doctorâ€™s office was not open and while on vacation in another state- each time free of charge, amazing!! Our only issue was getting a doctor once whose lack of listening and problem-identification skills meant we had to advocate strongly for ourselves in order to get appropriate care. This seems to have been a fluke, however, and without this encounter, we would have given Teledoc 5 stars.

helpful_reviews.title: No Help
helpful_reviews.author: SaraThomas87
helpful_reviews.content: Doctor was nice but called 40 minutes after scheduled appointment and $40 to talk to a doctor for less than 5 minutes is ridiculous. I have swimmers ear and symptom that have persisted for 5 Days. Iâ€™ve had it before and know I need an ear drop antibiotic. The doctor said that Teladocâ€™s policy on ear aches is not to prescribe antibiotics; to go somewhere locally to have it checked out. Gee, thanks. Now instead of being out the fee for an office visit, I am also out $40. What is this for if itâ€™s not for simple stuff like ear aches? And if thatâ€™s Teladocâ€™s policy on ear aches, thatâ€™s fine but then why donâ€™t they just say so when I clearly marked that my issue today was an ear infection? Unbelievable. I donâ€™t know why I trusted these people to help. Instead I just paid good money for someone to tell me he canâ€™t look in my ear over the phone. Just save your money and go see your doctor.

helpful_reviews.title: Speed call?
helpful_reviews.author: Seer
helpful_reviews.content: I will never call this app again. Someone that I thought was a doctor called and was super rushed. There was a lot of noise/people in the background when he called. I explained I got an RX two-three wks ago but since it has gotten worse. He told me to go to dr office. The whole conversation was extremely rushed, and he wasnâ€™t even listening to me. I had sent photos of my throat, and he mentioned nothing about seeing them. The whole call was just shady. I called back to talk to a rep because I wanted to know am I actually getting charged for that?! He did nothing for me? You have to be kidding. I asked if the rep could tell me if I would get charged again if I go to my dr office and he said â€œhe wasnâ€™t sureâ€�. I asked if they refer it on to my regular drâ€™s office and he said no. I do not recommend calling this app! Itâ€™s a waste of time and money.

helpful_reviews.title: Great experience
helpful_reviews.author: Detrencher
helpful_reviews.content: When I was on vacation with my family in Colorado my 5 year old daughter had clear symptoms of a Urinary Tract Infection.  My wife had the idea of using our Teladoc benefit.  While we were still in our ski boots I was able to request a visit through the mobile app, which was extremely intuitive and easy.  The doctor called us back in no time.  Best of all, he was very empathetic and gave us more quality attention than we would have gotten at some random ER.  We received the medication we needed and the prescription was ready for us to pick up on the way to dinner.  Vacation saved!!

helpful_reviews.title: Awesome!
helpful_reviews.author: gretasola
helpful_reviews.content: Great service! Itâ€™s offered free through my insurance so I gave it a shot.  Amazing service!  I requested a appointment ASAP and the doctor called within minutes!  He was friendly and kind!  I will be telling everyone I know to give it a shot.  It was such a time saver and so easy to use.  Got the prescription for antibiotics I needed with zero hassle.  Side note I see there are some negative reviews and I obviously donâ€™t know the circumstances but this service is obviously only appropriate in some situations I would not use it for a complicated or potentially serious issue.  But itâ€™s great for things like UTIâ€™s, colds, rashes, etc.

helpful_reviews.title: Waste of time
helpful_reviews.author: Swag_surfer
helpful_reviews.content: Iâ€™ve had an account for a few months since my employer provided it. I thought I had had everything set up online through their website. Except my fault I forgot the password, their fault the password reset email was blank along with every other email they sent me. I called at 11 at night the lady said someone would reach out to me in within the next hour no one did teladoc called me and told me that the provider could not get ahold of me, so I gave her a new number. An hour later same lady calls back and wants to know if I would still like to wait for someone to call or if I just wanted to wait until morning. If I wanted to wait until morning why wouldnâ€™t I just go to the hospital obviously if Iâ€™m calling at 11 oâ€™clock at night I wanted to talk to someone now. Waste of time and money

helpful_reviews.title: Not enough care and time for patient
helpful_reviews.author: OHNC
helpful_reviews.content: Doctor rushed through explanations as if read through a script. Corrected me unprofessionally when I stated I was aware of antibiotic resistance. (Which he should know about as this is a major issue that I agree not everyone needs an antibiotic). Did not listen to my history of present illness and interrupted me when the first two words I said were â€œmy husbandâ€� and stated he only was concerned about my current symptoms not how they were spread. What if we had recently traveled out of the country as a family? It is always important to listen to your patientâ€™s history of present illness before treating the patient as another 8-minute consult product to get reimbursed on instead of an ill human being seeking help innocently. He sounded very conceited and is obviously in this gig for the extra pay.

helpful_reviews.title: Inapt dishonest company
helpful_reviews.author: ThisAppNoWk
helpful_reviews.content: This company requires history and to state what I want to be seen for by the doctor. I stayed in the Y. They approved an appointment. The doctor came on 21 minutes late. I stated the problem, the doctor stated that she does not address problems such as those, I told her that was stated as my request and this appointment should never have been approved, they still charge me anyway despite my ending the call within 20 seconds of the late physicians signing on to tell me that she could not address the problem. This company wasted. my time, disrespected my communication, and store $40 from me.  They refuse to take responsibility for not having read the request they require us to make, approving an appointment with the doctor that could not have addressed the issue, then charging me for the privilege of their incompetence.

helpful_reviews.title: Very hit or miss
helpful_reviews.author: Saralei23865
helpful_reviews.content: It’s very hit or miss. You either get a great doctor or a doctor who obviously can’t have their own practice because they would be ran out of town with the way they treat their patients. I sinus infections easily, I know whether or not I have one considering I get at least 4 a year. So when I say it’s a sinus infection and I need an antibiotic - I’m not saying that to waste my breathe. They don’t believe you and that’s why they are on Teladoc and not in their own practice or working at a well renowned hospital.   Unfortunately it’s either this or use the urgent care in town because I go to college in a different state from where my parents live and my dad insurance doesn’t cover doctor visits out of state but covers anytime of medical care up to 90% instate.

helpful_reviews.title: Completely useless- Don’t even bother
helpful_reviews.author: Jay9739
helpful_reviews.content: Everybody knows how much problems and restrictions we have when it comes to the health coverage system. They made an app which was even advertised by my health insurance coverage provider but all I could do was register myself with a GP for a phone visit while I was trying to get contact with a dermatologist. I did everything I could on line and also I called and talked to an agent over the phone but I am so sorry that I just found, I wasted my time on a product which is never meant to work. We have a long way to go to get close to where most of European countries are standing. My best advice is, don’t even bother using this app and instead try to see a real person even if you have insurance because this app is not structured well enough.

helpful_reviews.title: I love this service!!
helpful_reviews.author: Queen SheShe
helpful_reviews.content: I have always wished for an app of service like this. I highly recommend this app for basic illnesses that aren’t life threatening. I get a RX sent to my pharmacy and if need be a doctors note sent to me. It’s truly a time saver and is soo convenient to use. I mean really... I had the stomach flu.. requested an appointment and within minutes I had meds sent for nausea to my pharmacy. No one wants to sit in a doctors office when they are throwing up with a stomach bug just to get anti nausea meds. Meanwhile infecting everyone you come into contact with. This service is truly amazing.

helpful_reviews.title: Conflicted
helpful_reviews.author: bshafer
helpful_reviews.content: I love that you can do the doc thing from home, but we have used twice and the doctors are cocky n’ kinda rude! I’m not understanding why they sign up to participate in this service if their hearts really aren’t into it? The doctor I talked to was in room or somewhere where I could hear other people, I felt like they all could hear me as it sounded like I was on loud speaker. When I told doctor my colds just start at bronchitis...everyone near him started laughing, then fast it stopped. I’m feeling terrible to begin with, then I have to listen to medical staffers laugh while I’m talking...? Really guys? We as patients know our bodies and what’s going on...if it weren’t for the sick patients you docs would be out of work!!! Start showing respect! Yes Doctor, that means you! Thank you again for this service...I think?

helpful_reviews.title: Rushed and lied to!!
helpful_reviews.author: Marcb916
helpful_reviews.content: Called in because I thought it would be convenient since I knew I was having flu symptoms. Spoke to a “Dr” who was extremely short, abrasive and rude. In one question she said “I’m sending a prescription in for you for 5 day treatment. BUT because of Ga law I can only prescribe 3 days. You have to call back in after the 3 days to get the other 2 days prescribed.”  She kept on repeating GA Law GA Law when I asked for clarification. Or I could go somewhere else. Pharmacist confirmed for me that she was completely lying to me as I assumed. They just want you to make another appointment for a second fee. Interesting enough, my fiancé used a different service Dr on Demand the same day for same symptoms & was prescribed 10 days of the same med with no problem at all. AND great service by the “Dr”.  Won’t be using again at all.

helpful_reviews.title: Worked great
helpful_reviews.author: WCork
helpful_reviews.content: Did a video call and it worked great. Had a nasty cold and upper respiratory infection that induced a pretty bad asthma attack. Got the required meds and a renewal on my inhaler. The video service worked great and I opted in to share my health data on iPhone which helps too. This service saved me a $300 visit to a GP and the hassle of waiting, driving etc. I hope the technology advances to be able to use remote diagnostic equipment and others to be able to expand the range of services, such as wellness consults, chronic disease Mgmt etc. this is the future, folks, and teledoc seems to be a pioneer.

helpful_reviews.title: Not a replacement for a doctor consult
helpful_reviews.author: The ESJ
helpful_reviews.content: We had a rash on our infant and thought this service would work well since we couldn’t get in to see our pediatrician in time. We scheduled an appointment at 9pm but didn’t hear back from a doctor until 6am the next day.  We did receive 3 calls in the middle of the night waking us and the baby to tell us we were in the queue (11:30, 3, and 4am).  The doctor consult was reasonable and a medication was provided.  After a day of using the medicine we had concerns about her condition worsening and wether what we were seeing was a side effect of the medicine. We were told we would have to pay for another consult to answer those questions.  If we pay any more we will pay for a doctor who is accountable for the diagnosis and handles follow up.  Goodbye Teladoc.

helpful_reviews.title: Very helpful!!!
helpful_reviews.author: Bigwin15
helpful_reviews.content: I had an infection. I needed an antibiotic, but didn’t want to risk getting the flu by going in to Urgent Care. The state of Alabama is currently under a state of emergency because the flu is rampant. The doctor called me back within an hour. He looked at the pictures I sent. He asked lots of questions. He called me in an antibiotic. It helped me get through the weekend till I could get into the dermatologist today. It ended up I had to have a cyst removed, but the antibiotic helped with the infection that was causing so much of the pain. It was a life saver...and I avoided being exposed to the flu!

helpful_reviews.title: My experience
helpful_reviews.author: A. Kristen
helpful_reviews.content: My doctor was appalled to see me when i eventually came in today. She looked at my throat and immediately asked why I didn’t come in sooner. It’s because I had a teledoc tell me within 10 seconds of talking to me (I purposely didn’t say listening), telling me why it’s viral. It was not. I immediately was given steroid shots, antibiotics and told never to use the service again. nothing I would say would let him hear me. I’ve dealt with colds, bugs, etc. I’m a mother. I know what they feel like in MY body. This was something that needed more care. I was in pain and this experience was more harmful than good. I also think doctors don’t listen to women’s health concerns and always downplay it. I would love to see more training because the studies aren’t good for women’s health.

helpful_reviews.title: Can’t get an appointment. What’s the point?
helpful_reviews.author: chelleparti5
helpful_reviews.content: I’ve tried to make an appointment three times with three different providers. Each time, I wait three days and then get an email that the provider is not available and to try with someone new. Each time, I have to reenter all of my info and reasons for an appointment, choose a new person, and guess at their availability (it doesn’t seem to be connected to their calendars or desired times, because all times and days are always available).  I tried contacting Teladoc via the app and received an error and could not get in touch with them. I tried calling them during their available times and got their voicemail.   Useless service unless you like doing tedious tasks over and over again with no outcome.

helpful_reviews.title: An amazing failure of technology and planning
helpful_reviews.author: PFCHappy_Mondays
helpful_reviews.content: I tried to set up an appointment with a doctor. The first two times I answered the call immediately, only to be hung up on. The third time, I believe the doctor just called to satisfy the requirement of having to call three times, only to hang up. So, after two calls to customer service and three hang ups ( I can almost imagine these are related to delays on the calling end), I felt compelled to write an app review about my complete waste of time using this poor excuse for an app. Of course, scheduling is simple and online. Cancelling requires 10 minutes a piece and an act of the almighty to make it happen. Bad business, horrible app. Deleting and submitting feedback to our HR department on Monday to exclude from offering next year.

helpful_reviews.title: Worst experience ever
helpful_reviews.author: allied5631
helpful_reviews.content: I put in for a dermatology appointment for a severe allergic reaction. The app said someone would be in touch within 48 hours. Seemed long but I was willing to wait to have a real dermatologist give me a consult. I kept checking the app for when my appointment would occur. Today — it was all gone as if I’d never requested it. I called customer service and was told they did not have a dermatologist available so they cancelled it. What I don’t understand is why it took them over 24 hours to figure out they did not have someone and also why NOONE MESSAGED OR TOLD ME my appointment was cancelled so I lost even more time before I realized. I went to CVS minute clinic and on 15 mins had a prescription from the nurse practitioner. The whole thing left a very negative impression.

helpful_reviews.title: Genius Idea, Implemented well
helpful_reviews.author: AnimalSavior
helpful_reviews.content: I have two kids under two so going to a doctor for myself is impossible. I filled out the requested info which took maybe two minutes and literally five minutes later I was on the phone with a doctor who was competent thorough and quick. Within 5 minutes I had explained my condition he asked a few questions and sent prescriptions to my pharmacy. Way easier than going to a doctor ! Will def have this as my go to for standard colds/coughs/etc. thank you!!!!

helpful_reviews.title: Wow! This is great
helpful_reviews.author: DonaNobisPachem
helpful_reviews.content: I used to have sinus infections frequently. Although I haven’t had one in a while when the symptoms started and stuck around I knew what it was. It’s frustrating to have to lose time off work, sit in a waiting room full of other sick people, only to be told what you already know! With a phone call, I explained my symptoms, how long they have been happening and what I’ve done so far and a prescription was called in for me! Finally something in healthcare that makes sense and REALLY saves money!

helpful_reviews.title: Disappointed
helpful_reviews.author: Merissamike
helpful_reviews.content: I am disappointed with this app. My daughter had a cough that got pretty bad before bedtime. I called and set up a call back, doc called me back in less than 5 min. He said he was sending me a script to my local pharmacy but to give her a spoonful of honey in the meantime (pharmacies where closed). I didn’t go out and buy over the counter medicine. I figured I would wait for her script to be ready in the morning. Went to pick up the script first thing in the morning and the pharmacist said that the doc sent in a script for Dimetapp!! She said that it was an over the counter prescription and pointed me to isle 2 so that I could go grab it and pay for it. I could have picked up dimetapp anytime what was the purpose of me calling a doc to prescribe it to me??

helpful_reviews.title: Fast! Easy! Convenient!
helpful_reviews.author: Mana38382950302
helpful_reviews.content: So I used TeleDoc today for the first time. Amazing. I have a sinus infection/grossness....and as I’m about to make an appointment to go to a walk-in clinic, I remember I have TeleDoc. I was connected with a doctor immediately, he spent a few minutes going over my symptoms and sent me a RX to my pharmacy. It was soooo fast. No sitting in a waiting room with other sick people. No waiting for the doctor forever in a cold room while sitting on a piece of paper. It was easier than FaceTiming my bff. Now if only my pharmacy would be as fast.....

helpful_reviews.title: Great service for little cost
helpful_reviews.author: AbbaDalla
helpful_reviews.content: The Teladoc service is top notch! Their response times are quick & painless. Whenever I set up a call they respond within minutes normally. It is so convenient for basic healthcare situations like when you have the flu, cold or similar issues. This beats going to the doctors office and sitting in a waiting room for simple solutions. It’s also a plus to have your insurance offer the service at no additional cost. The Teladoc service is my go to 9 times out of 10.

helpful_reviews.title: Not worth the trouble
helpful_reviews.author: bbbmom5
helpful_reviews.content: I setup my account 2 days ago and was able to speak with a doctor very quickly. This part worked great!  I had side effects from the prescription the doctor prescribed so I went back into the Teledoc app to speak to another doctor and I was not able to continue because the app could not verify my medical records. They verified them 2 days ago!  I don’t understand why it worked 2 days ago but not today.  I called customer service and they said I needed to setup a temp account and start my medical history all over again!  This took 30 minutes to set up last time. I decided it would be faster to go to urgent care. I do not recommend this service.  It’s not as easy as it sounds.

helpful_reviews.title: Very Valuable Service !  :-)
helpful_reviews.author: Frank - Tennessee USA
helpful_reviews.content: Thank you TELADOC for being here, available to me and others. Your service is great, easy, quality. I don’t need medical care often st all, but always TELADOC makes it possible for me to get the care I need, when, and where I need it, rather than go without for days or weeks without. I travel often, so medical care is difficult to access since a “new patient” wherever I go when away from home, but with TELADOC, I am always going to a familiar medical provider of mine. Thanks TELADOC!

helpful_reviews.title: Google could have done same thing
helpful_reviews.author: "Big'un"
helpful_reviews.content: So We have used Teladoc a couple of time a over the last few years and can say it was pretty good.. No issues getting a antibiotic called in and was a lot better than driving 30+ miles to a “doc in tha box” that over charges by $75 .  But this last call was the worst I’ve seen or heard of. The lady asked all the right questions and then told me we was doing everything right and to keep it up.. REALLY?? Been sick for week and this is the care you are offering? Goggle said the same thing she did . Seriously wondering if that’s not what she was reading from. So guess we will load up and spend the $100 for a z-pack .. I will not recommend this bunch to anyone!! Beware!!

helpful_reviews.title: Quick, easy, and a lower copay than the regular doctor!
helpful_reviews.author: Hologram4
helpful_reviews.content: Clicked a couple buttons while my two year was napping, waited five minutes, and had a quick video call with the doctor.  Two minutes later I’m done. Within the hour the pharmacy let me know my script was ready.    For those of us who has kids, I can’t recommend this more, especially when your littles are the ones who gave it to you and they’re already feeling better ;)

helpful_reviews.title: Terrific experience
helpful_reviews.author: Yelpisbullshit
helpful_reviews.content: I had a terrible sore throat that I believed was strep. I took photos of my throat, uploaded them to the app and 20 minutes later a physician contacted me. After speaking with him for about 15 mins he was able to ascertain based on the symptoms I described along with the photos that I needed a course of antibiotics. He contacted my local CVS and the prescription was ready in less than a half hour. Five days later the sore throat was gone. The service was fantastic and I would highly recommend it.

helpful_reviews.title: Unprofessional
helpful_reviews.author: Realtalk04
helpful_reviews.content: My first experience with Teladoc was a massive waist of money :( The “doctor” I spoke with was one the phone with me for less then a minute! (Don’t you wish you could make $45 in one minute or less? Lol, I’m just saying.) He did not listen to my 2 concerns. One I could send pictures of and one being a cold. He then told me I did not have a cold and that it was just a wether change.  Then proceeded to call in the wrong prescription (mistakes are made when you are sloppy with your work and speak to someone for less than a minute about their concerns I suppose) I then had to call twice to try to get it fixed with a pharmacy, and then low and behold, I have a cold.  When I called to see if this could be rectified, they told me it was past the time limit and I would have to make another appointment with a new fee. Ya know, I guess it’s just the weather change talking, but I dint find my self ready to pay for their incompetent services twice for something that shouldn’t have been an issue in the first place.  Save yourself the headache, and don’t use them.

helpful_reviews.title: Very convenient
helpful_reviews.author: TotalBullCrap
helpful_reviews.content: It only took a minute or two to schedule a call, and the doctor called me about 20 minutes later. Had a good experience speaking with her, and I didn’t have to leave the office. I would’ve had to wait a couple of days until I wrapped up a big project to take the time to go see my regular doctor. I also gave Teladoc permission to share the information with my doctor so all of my records would be up to date. That’s a pretty cool feature.

helpful_reviews.title: A life saver!
helpful_reviews.author: Nick, C
helpful_reviews.content: I’ve used Teladoc a number of times for allergies, and this past flu season. I actually used them when my newborn son had a horrific rash and they correctly diagnosed that he had a yeast infection (this was after I took him to my local urgent care and they said it was just a normal rash and would clear up on it’s own). When I asked ask the Teladoc Doctor how she new it was a yeast infection, she said, “because I’ve been a doctor for over 30 years.”  Thank you Teladoc!!!

helpful_reviews.title: Cancelled Consultation
helpful_reviews.author: GeekyHDub
helpful_reviews.content: I set-up my account and requested a consultation. I received an email confirmation. Almost 2 hours later, I received an email stating that someone tried to contact me 3 times and was unable. Therefore, my consultation was cancelled. My landline phone never rang nor is set-up to block private/blocked numbers. I called the number on the email. The customer service representative was extremely nice and placed another consultation request for me. I also gave her 2 phone numbers to contact me. Almost an hour later, I received another email stating that my consultation request had been cancelled due to not being able to get in touch with me 3 times. Neither my landline nor cell phone rang. I give up...

helpful_reviews.title: Paid 40 dollars for a doctor to tell me to go see a doctor
helpful_reviews.author: beenedbhehebdbdbdn
helpful_reviews.content: Told the doctor I have had a sore throat for a couple days now. Basically all they said was to go see a doctor which is what I thought i was kind of doing. She said the only thing she was going to do was send in something to sooth my throat.(which I can get cough drops) it’s been over 4 hours and they haven’t even sent anything to sooth my throat which is the least they could do. I’ve also called them 3 times to get any information and have heard back from anyone. I wanted antibiotics or something similar to help treat my problem. They did nothing to help. Got charged 40 dollars for a doctor to literally tell me to go see a doctor.

helpful_reviews.title: Love the docs
helpful_reviews.author: Vickiet66
helpful_reviews.content: Dr. Harris and Dr. Pollack are amazing!!! My family and I get medical care and advise in a timely fashion due to the ease of using this service.  The docs are available 24 hours a day/7 days a week.  The docs review our medical history prior to them calling. They are knowledgeable about our history and medications.  After requesting a consult the docs call within 2-3 minutes.  This service is amazing!!!! Saves so much time, and we address our Heath concerns in a timely fashion.

helpful_reviews.title: A doctor within seconds
helpful_reviews.author: Dezormo
helpful_reviews.content: My primary doctor couldn’t get me in with in the next couple days so I decided to try Teladoc. I cannot believe how fast and efficient it was. It was about a 15 minute phone call to give them my personal information and then the doctor called me back within seconds. After a five-minute phone conversation with the doctor, I had a prescription waiting for me 15 minutes down the road.

helpful_reviews.title: Useless
helpful_reviews.author: Melugas
helpful_reviews.content: I was excited to use this app but it was honestly useless. Only allows you to call/video a random physician for general health questions with a payment upfront and no information on the doctor. I also thought I could use for counseling/therapy and that feature only lets you select a state for location. For the entire state of california only 30 female therapists and the nearest one to me was 2 hours away. Literally not worth the time to sync to my insurance and manually input my medical history. Useless. Maybe in a year or so when they build out the app more and have more doctors on the roster it could be better.

helpful_reviews.title: This is the real deal! Concierge Doc at my fingertips!
helpful_reviews.author: Greg11196
helpful_reviews.content: Teladoc is the most intuitive thing I have ever used. Simple and to the point. I’m in Ohio and 20 minutes for my group practice. I registered and waited 5 minutes for a doctor that spent about 5 minutes speaking to me about my flu... and then received a text from CVS that my prescription was ready - all in 30 minutes!! Teladoc should have been around when all my kids were babies - It’s about time !!

helpful_reviews.title: If I could give no stars I would
helpful_reviews.author: Loshie94
helpful_reviews.content: I used the teladoc for my ear infection the lady I got was not personal asked me every question for a ruptured eardrum and told me to take sudafed and Advil. Later that night my ear drum did rupture and I had to go to the real doctor the next day and pay more money to be seen, I had a seriously bad ear infection and ruptured eardrum they couldn’t see how bad it was and I had to go back, but my “doctor” on the phone said that sudafed and Advil would be good enough. I called customer service and they said they would give me my money back this was 3 weeks ago and I just got an email that the fee is non refundable, I would never recommend this to anyone, fake doctors, lying customer service.

helpful_reviews.title: Brushes off
helpful_reviews.author: Mom nit pleased
helpful_reviews.content: This is the second time that I have called in to talk to a doctor and have been brushed off by my symptoms or my sons symptoms today he’s 12 years old and I am very aware of when he needs an anabiotic he has had a horrible cough and congestion for over three days and the doctor told me it’s a viral. She also went on to tell me that even if someone has bronchitis they are not given antibiotics I feel like the site is having us pay to see a doctor just to say sorry you have to go in and see someone because I won’t help you the whole idea of the system is to not take your children out when they are sick or yourself I won’t be using Teladoc again

helpful_reviews.title: Best medical service I’ve ever had
helpful_reviews.author: The_crack_fox
helpful_reviews.content: Why didn’t someone think of this sooner? Last thing I want to do when I’m chilled and dripping with snot is to drive in sub arctic temperatures, park, and walk a mile to a doctors office, just to wait 45 minutes for him or her to tell me I’m sick “NO $@&) Sherlock!” This will revolutionize the industry. Nice doctor called me within 5 minutes, diagnosed me, and sent meds straight to my pharmacy! I’ll never have to tough out a flu again. Can’t sing enough praises! Hallelujah!!

helpful_reviews.title: Teladoc is AMAZING.
helpful_reviews.author: ttchouston
helpful_reviews.content: If you don’t want to leave your house, but still receive amazing service and attentive care, Teladoc should be your go-to.  Just had an incredible experience with both the customer service staff and physician. I got an update when my chart was being reviewed, when I should expect a call (and it was very fast - next to no wait time), and a follow up to say my prescription had been submitted.  To say I’m impressed is a massive understatement!

helpful_reviews.title: An extreme disappointment
helpful_reviews.author: Saki Masato
helpful_reviews.content: I called in with what I know to be symptoms of a bacterial bronchitis which can only be treated with antibiotics... I don’t ask for anything like this often because I am allergic to many antibiotics as it is, so it is an extreme circumstance that I would ever request one...I told the doctor what my symptoms were who said, before I could even finish, “Sorry you will have to go to the er or a clinic “... my doctors office was booked and are closed the next two days after... I was shocked I paid $40 dollars for a “ just go to the er” when Teladoc is supposed to prevent that... I plan to set a doctors appt for my upcoming Wednesday off day...and I will NEVER use or recommend Teladoc after this experience

helpful_reviews.title: So much better than sitting in a waiting room
helpful_reviews.author: JDimon
helpful_reviews.content: Great first experience using this service which I had forgotten about. I was trying to just make it through so I didn’t have to waste time when my boss insisted I go to a doctor. Shared with him I would go for that 3 hour tour on my next day off when he reminded me of this service. Teladoc may not be able to help with everything over the phone, but it will certainly be a first stop.

helpful_reviews.title: I Never Give 5 Stars
helpful_reviews.author: prierpourelle
helpful_reviews.content: 100% covered through my Cigna PPO; ZERO co-pay. I hate going to the doctor when I’m sick or hurt because I feel most of the time rest and staying at home is better medicine. This way I can get a doctor’s note for work, talk to my doctor right from my bed, and they will send any prescriptions needed to the pharmacy across the street. You can even upload pictures before your visit of anything you want them to see.

helpful_reviews.title: Helpful app!
helpful_reviews.author: np-michigan
helpful_reviews.content: I have this service provided for free with my heath insurance. The doctors are quick and easy to talk to. This is a great service for things you would normally go to urgent care for. I’ve used it for an ear infection and a cough I couldn’t get rid of. It’s nice that you don’t have to leave your house or wait days to talk to a doctor. I just completed a call (at 5:30 am on a Saturday) and the doctor sent me a prescription to the pharmacy and gave me good recommendations.

helpful_reviews.title: Love this service!
helpful_reviews.author: zing20
helpful_reviews.content: I used this service twice over the busy Thanksgiving holidays and loved it! The app told me when a doctor had seen my records and I received a call from the doctor very soon after. Both doctors took their time to understand my issue and helped me understand what the right treatment was. The doctors sent a prescriptions directly to my pharmacy, and I felt better the next day. Would highly recommend this service!

helpful_reviews.title: Great while traveling!!
helpful_reviews.author: Smileyslv
helpful_reviews.content: I was on vacation and started having flu symptoms. I used Teladoc, was able to talk to a doc within minutes and he confirmed i was getting the flu. He did an amazing  job explaining the flu virus that was going around this year and made me feel very comfortable. This service is very beneficial and after seeing the ease of use, several family members of mine that were with me planned to talk to their employers about getting Teladoc too!

helpful_reviews.title: This is Amazing
helpful_reviews.author: Mellonie02
helpful_reviews.content: This is my second time using Teladoc and I am so happy with this service. I live in a remote town in Northern California and my local GP is so booked up he can not get me in for a same day appointment. I have been sick for 10 days now and needed antibiotics. My GP office said to go to the emergency room to see someone today.  Teladoc took care of me in less than hour and I was able to stay home and not risk infecting anyone else. Thank you!

helpful_reviews.title: False charges
helpful_reviews.author: WarmWaterGirl
helpful_reviews.content: Very disappointed with this program. I was away from home and developed symptoms. First time using: set up account, entered history and personal info. Started consult request but stopped when it said it would be $45 and asked for credit card. I have membership brochure in front of me that says Teledoc visits $0. Called and they assured me that I should have to pay $45. Only thing they could offer was to consult my membership provider.  Yeah like they’re open on weekend so .  .  . Thought this was going to be a good program but if I have to wait until Monday, what’s the point??

helpful_reviews.title: VERY Disappointed
helpful_reviews.author: Rupmh
helpful_reviews.content: I was pretty skeptical but wanted to avoid a visit to urgent care so gave this a try. Made an appointment and was called by a doctor pretty quickly. That’s where the positive experience ended. The doctor explained that he couldn’t prescribe me eye drops for pink eye and I needed to go to urgent care for an eye exam. Walked into urgent care the next morning, paid my copay, was seen quickly by a doctor and I was handed my prescription eye drops (with no exam by the way) in barely more time than the Teledoc experience. Wanted this to be a good experience since it’s completely covered by my insurance, but it was a waste of time and extremely frustrating. Would give this zero stars if I could.

helpful_reviews.title: Couldn’t be easier
helpful_reviews.author: Misty N.E
helpful_reviews.content: With 5 boys at home you can imagine the amount of time spent at doctors offices as they spread the flu and strep to each other. I can set them all up an appointment and never have to leave home except to get their medicine. This service is a life saver. I couldn’t be more happy. Thank you for getting with the times and keeping me out of the ER during cold season and not having a giant copay for the office visit is great.

helpful_reviews.title: Need the app to communicate with mobile
helpful_reviews.author: Unkle Monky
helpful_reviews.content: I tried using the browser first and the video was not supported on my iPad. Once I set up my acct and got signed into the app I was already in the que from trying in the browser.   I saw a Family Medicine Doctor Cole. I shared a photo of a rash. He sent an RX to my pharmacy to treat symptoms. He advised me if it returns then I’ll need to see my pcp to discuss managing it as a chronic condition.   So very easy, inexpensive and as good as face to face visit.

helpful_reviews.title: Not the 21st century company they claim to be
helpful_reviews.author: NLights99511
helpful_reviews.content: Though I was not under the impression that this service would replace a regular doctor, they market it as though this is the new age of 21st century telemedicine. This is not the case.  My very first appointment with this service ended in the doctor lecturing me about not overusing their service “while sitting on the toilet” simply because I don’t want to go in to the doctor. I explained they market this service differently than he is presenting it. Super lackadaisical about it all.  Scheduling the appointment was a hassle as well as he initial doctor did not call me at the scheduled time so I had to contact Teledoc who changed my appointment time to “ASAP.” Really I would’ve just liked them to keep a scheduled appointment.  The service is practically only for when you’re traveling out of town and for only one instance (as explained so eloquently by the doctor). Even then, I would recommend going into an urgent care over this as the demeanor is less than enthusiastic.

helpful_reviews.title: Great Service
helpful_reviews.author: LtApd
helpful_reviews.content: This was my first time using the service. I filled out my symptoms and requested a call back as soon as possible. The doctor called me within 5 minutes at 10:00 pm. I spoke to the doctor and he called in a prescription to my local pharmacy which will be ready for me in the morning. This couldn’t have been easier, no waiting and no copay. I will use this service again if necessary.

helpful_reviews.title: Great Service
helpful_reviews.author: D_gonzales
helpful_reviews.content: I’ve used Teladoc for about 1-2 years and received relatively good care. The reasons I’m giving it 5 stars is because 8 out of 10 times I’ve received good care from the doctors. They are very helpful and knowledgeable about whatever I’m going through and they listen to what I tell them. I generally know what’s going on with me and they do a great job of listening to me and my concerns, and putting me at ease.

helpful_reviews.title: Teledoc is So Convenient
helpful_reviews.author: Annofcpp
helpful_reviews.content: The last thing I want to do when I’m sick enough to see a doctor is to get dressed up and go to sit in a room with other sick people and wait for possibly hours to see a doctor. I have had such quick, reliable, accurate, help from Teledoc that I have recommended them to many friends and family. Several of them have been helped as they have reached out to Teledoc. I love it!

helpful_reviews.title: Always There
helpful_reviews.author: KimPey Midd
helpful_reviews.content: Every time I use the app and service, Iâ€™m so impressed by how easy the process is to request a visit. Each doctor has been quick and efficient. I love having my information stored so weâ€™re not wasting time discussing the same general information. This service is a must have, it has really helped our family through some painful issues. Great app, easy to use.

helpful_reviews.title: If you need antibiotics, go see an actual doctor
helpful_reviews.author: TAMMYLEE1031
helpful_reviews.content: Donâ€™t waste your money! Misdiagnosed twice in a 2 day time frame and had to go to an in-person doctor anyway. They will not prescribe you an antibiotic. Told me it was viral and take Tylenol and a prescription for some medicine for the pain, which I turned down. I needed antibiotics which was confirmed by the real dr. Upon complaining and asking for a refund, you will get a scripted response that they donâ€™t guarantee you will be treated or prescribed anything. Basically, you pay to â€œtalkâ€� to a dr for 2 minutes and they say â€œtake Tylenol and go see a dr tomorrow.â€� Save your money and stress and just go see a real dr to begin with.

helpful_reviews.title: Horrible service. I want my money back.
helpful_reviews.author: cindy-momo
helpful_reviews.content: Iâ€™ve never had such horrible experience with a doctor. The total call was about 12 minutes, and the whole time the doctor was throwing medical terms at me and telling me different types of viruses instead of actually letting me talk about my symptom or diagnosing me. Everytime I tried to speak up, I get interrupted. What kind of doctor does that? Instead of treating me and giving me advices like a real doctor does, he just tell me to continue taking ibuprofen to mask the problem. So disappointed and would never use Teladoc again. I would rather go wait in an urgent care than paying $20 for this BS.

helpful_reviews.title: Love it!
helpful_reviews.author: Changel21
helpful_reviews.content: I have used Teladoc several times over the past two years. I, too, was hesitant, but figured it was worth a shot. Iâ€™ve called at 3am and thanks to 24/7 service from them and my pharmacy, i was able to get my Rx filled by 4:30am and be on my way to wellness. I donâ€™t always expect an antibiotic and donâ€™t want one if thatâ€™s not what i need. They have done great listening to me and addressing my concerns completely.

helpful_reviews.title: Great Service!
helpful_reviews.author: Memes77
helpful_reviews.content: Iâ€™ve used Teledoc 3 Times now and couldnâ€™t be happier. Ailments I called for were UTI, post-op question (to see if I needed to go to the ER) and pink eye. All 3 providers were extremely professional and very helpful.   These physicians cannot replace your PCP for more serious issues but they are an amazing resource for issues that come up later in the day or on weekends.   I could not recommend any higher if used appropriately.

helpful_reviews.title: First Visit Was a Pleasant Experience
helpful_reviews.author: OCTraveller
helpful_reviews.content: The Doctor assigned to me was professional and helpful. I knew I had an UTI because I had many times before. Told the Dr my symptoms and results of an in home test and prescription was on its way. Pharmacy called 10 min later to say it was ready.  My alternative was the urgent care at twice the cost and 10 times the wait. It was a Sunday.  I would not hesitate to use again.

helpful_reviews.title: Teladoc...yikes.
helpful_reviews.author: Kayprince
helpful_reviews.content: Well what a feeling to watch $40 shoot down the drain for a 4 minute derogatory phone call. Turns out Teladoc is the reason people self diagnose. Iâ€™ve had flu symptoms off and on for about a month, and figured letâ€™s try this out before seeing a doctor. My diagnosis? Ironically, to take some tums and see a doctor. I could give anyone on the street $40 for that kind of 4 minute advice. Kind of ironic for a doctor to tell me to see a doctor. Within 4 minutes of saying hello. Then when I complained, I got a canned email that blamed ME for scheduling it online. So save yourself the money and just stay sick. Teladoc wonâ€™t be serving â€œall of my healthcare needsâ€�.

helpful_reviews.title: Simple and quick!
helpful_reviews.author: KatieW1234
helpful_reviews.content: I have had Teladoc for almost 3 years now and Iâ€™ve requested a consult through the call center, through the website and through the app. Iâ€™ve had great experiences with Teladoc so far, but by far the best experience has been on the app. Itâ€™s such a simple and quick process and definitely beats going to the doctor in person when you feel miserable!

helpful_reviews.title: Poor Customer Service
helpful_reviews.author: New to GF 87
helpful_reviews.content: Iâ€™ve had two good experiences with Teladoc Doctors however, the communication/listening â€œskillsâ€� of the customer service reps are sorely deficient. I can understand wait times and technical difficulties. I cannot excuse poor listening and rude manners from call reps. I could have taken my son into the pediatrician in less time and been treated with more respect from their admin staff. Now, I canâ€™t even go pick up my prescription because I get to wait more time, already on hour 4, for my son to be â€œseenâ€� since customer service has no idea what theyâ€™re doing. Yay.

helpful_reviews.title: Worst app
helpful_reviews.author: Rogeris
helpful_reviews.content: I donâ€™t care abou your swirling balls at the beginning. I spent over an hour deciphering this app. Clouded head as I might be. I should have just fing called. What a piece of crap. Iâ€™m sick and I thought I was at the end, but this friggin app said I scheduled a call for 8:45 and waited ti 9:11 to realize that there was more dialog at the very bottom of the page. What an inept design. Why do you bury the steps with drop downs waaaay down at the bottom. Unseen. No color. Just stark white monsterous dropdowns that donâ€™t even appear as part of what the person is concentrating on. So no call, and now I wait til tomorrow. Blue Cross, get someone else. Totally less than one star.

helpful_reviews.title: Horrible customer service rep -Candace
helpful_reviews.author: CYLMS
helpful_reviews.content: Was unfortunate enough to reach Candace with customer service when I called to find out why all 3 doctors who tried calling me could not connect. This was after Teladoc sent me a test call to make sure I could receive calls with No Caller ID. She was like a robot that just kept repeating the same thing, not understanding the frustration of trying to reach a doctor for over 2 hours. I was told the only resolution was to put me back in a rotation. I would not recommend this service to anyone. The $10 reduction in my copay is not with the time or effort I have had to put into this process.

helpful_reviews.title: Overly Dramatic Doctor
helpful_reviews.author: WillAMurray
helpful_reviews.content: Called in for stomach issues.  Doctor jumped straight to appendicitis in panicked tone without asking what side pain was on.  I calmly replied, â€œNo, wrong side.â€�  Her next guess was cholera, because of course weâ€™ve all heard about the nasty strain of cholera going around in the United States.  I then told her thank you but Iâ€™ll go talk to my primary care provider.  She recommended I skip that visit and go straight to the emergency room and provide a stool sample, get blood work, and get admitted as something very serious was happening and she could not put her finger on it.  I went to my doctor, not the emergency room, got an antibiotic, and feel much better.

helpful_reviews.title: Itâ€™s ok
helpful_reviews.author: S3n10r2
helpful_reviews.content: Itâ€™s good for minor issues, anything more than a cold I suggest urgent care or your own doctor. They rush through calls, ask what you have. Immediately prescribe a med then tell you to pick it up in a hour.. no care for customers or compassion.. could be due to high demand for doctors.. but they def donâ€™t take much time with their patients. Either way, itâ€™s good for minor things, and saves me a trip to the doctor.. so Iâ€™ll continue to use it.

helpful_reviews.title: I would go lower then a 1!
helpful_reviews.author: Dior Smiley
helpful_reviews.content: This App and service is a joke! It doesnâ€™t give you clear instructions on to how to actually start your consult and they make it impossible to figure it out. I have missed multiple consults because of this the most recent one being right now. I got the email and went to the video link provided... sat there for over 30 minutes while it said I was in the queue to be seen next. Then all the sudden it kicked me out and sad it was canceled because they couldnâ€™t get ahold of me. Such BS when trying to get medical advice for your child! Extremely disappointed

helpful_reviews.title: Waste of time and money
helpful_reviews.author: vhill1224
helpful_reviews.content: Not helpful at. I will never use them again. Called because I had a bad ear infection. I was in extreme pain in my right ear and could not hear out of it. Was told to take allergy medicine. I then made an appointment to go to a real doctor and my ear drum had ruptured from fluid building up behind my ear drum. I had to get a shot, steroids and antibiotics. No allergy medicine was going to clear that up. So basically I was out 2 copays. They arenâ€™t going to give you a prescription for antibiotics and are going to tell you to take over the counter meds. Itâ€™s free to go talk to the pharmacist and get the same list from them.

helpful_reviews.title: Quick and Easy!
helpful_reviews.author: sbfoote
helpful_reviews.content: This app is incredible! Iâ€™m so busy and have always put off my skin care issues. This made it incredibly easy to seek medical help, so convenient and private! The fact that itâ€™s free with my insurance makes it even better. I have only just submitted my issues to a doctor and Iâ€™m already so impressed. Canâ€™t wait to see how everything else goes!

helpful_reviews.title: Extremely pleased!
helpful_reviews.author: Sourpatch113
helpful_reviews.content: I have used this twice recently for myself and my daughter. Very prompt and professional but the Dr also listened to what I had to say and medicines were sent right away with no hassle. Didnâ€™t even have to have my daughter miss school or go sit in a waiting room for hours with other sick people. I may never use urgent care clinics again!

helpful_reviews.title: Three times not the charm
helpful_reviews.author: Lizz2289
helpful_reviews.content: DONâ€™T WASTE YOUR TIME. Go to a REAL physician.   Iâ€™ve  called Teledoc a total of 3 times. I have chronic bronchitis and severe asthma. When I called today with a horrible cough, wheezing, and thick green mucus in my lungs the doctor told me to take Vitamin C and mucinex. I told him I just had bronchitis two weeks ago that didnâ€™t clear up and the doctor had me on Levaquin (as usual). He stated â€œWell, that is overkill. This is viral.â€�   I shouldâ€™ve known better than to bother calling. The second time I called was 2017. The doctor would not prescribe antibiotics yet again- two days later I had pneumonia and was out of work for 2 weeks.

helpful_reviews.title: Ear ache
helpful_reviews.author: litte 1
helpful_reviews.content: I just signed up for Teladoc this morning. I had woken up with an earache and congestion. Within minutes I entered my medical history, requested a visit, and received a call from a doctor. A prescription was sent to my pharmacy. This service was quick and easy! The doctor was friendly and knowledgeable. This is my first experience with Teladoc, but so far I think itâ€™s fantastic!

helpful_reviews.title: Amazed!
helpful_reviews.author: Hollisua
helpful_reviews.content: I just used Teladoc for the first time and I am truly amazed! The sign up process was seamless and the app is super easy to navigate. A doctor called me less than a minute after I filled out my appointment request and he was very nice and understanding. I would highly recommend this service to a friend or colleague but I am sorry to hear other people had bad experiences.

helpful_reviews.title: Horrible! Totally unprofessional
helpful_reviews.author: AR0780
helpful_reviews.content: The first provider I attempted to use rescheduled me TWICE for our initial appointment with no explanation, the first time 15 mins after our appt was supposed to start, and the second time about 15 mins prior.  then when I proposed times for yet a third initial appointment and asked her to please be professional and honor the next appointment we make, I never heard back from her again. Um, is this medical practice or Tinder..?  I know itâ€™s a half-price doc, but seriously?  We live in a small town with few medical options, so Iâ€™m trying again with a different Teledoc provider and hoping for the best.

helpful_reviews.title: Love teledoc
helpful_reviews.author: Cheergirl.14
helpful_reviews.content: After setting up the appt for a call back  in less than 15 minutes. Basically didn't think I could bear to sit in an urgent care waiting room while suffering from a UTI. Took a home test for it told the dr my symptoms and the result of the test and he sent in a rx. Warned me if I didn't improve to go to the er incase the infection would speed to my kidneys. So satisfied with my care

helpful_reviews.title: Hit or Miss
helpful_reviews.author: Phil 1218
helpful_reviews.content: Some doctors are fantastic. Theyâ€™ll take time to listen to you. Theyâ€™ll provide valuable feedback and care. Other doctors have agendas and their minds are made up prior to speaking with you.   As for the apps customer service, this is another poorly designed situation. No one can communicate with you effectively if and when you are looking to dispute a poor visit. Itâ€™s simply a streamlined profit designed to make money and provide minimal care. I would waste time spending the money. Still go and physically see a doctor, even it is at a Quick Care or Minute Clinic / Walgreens Clinic.

helpful_reviews.title: Takes too little by to set up
helpful_reviews.author: aa7246
helpful_reviews.content: I tried to be prepared to use this app by entering all information as soon as I registered but I wasnâ€™t prompted to enter medical history until my child was actually sick and I needed to use the service. It was beyond stressful to track down all of his medications and dosages and doctor visits while we were dealing with a sick child. This should have been part of the initial setup or we should have the option to skip. I nearly gave up and went to a clinic rather than try to get past the medical history pages. Very frustrating

helpful_reviews.title: It NOT worth your time!
helpful_reviews.author: Mystikah
helpful_reviews.content: Quick to charge Our credit card but wouldnâ€™t offer any solution! I am so depressed the Dr. told ME to go somewhere else! Nah, that so rude to tell a patient to â€œGo somewhere else â€œ. I am asking for help and I got turn away smh. Wow! I canâ€™t stop crying Iâ€™m out of meds and I canâ€™t get in to see My primary Dr til August!!! So in the meantime I am gonna have bad thoughts racing! If your looking for a Dr. run the other way as fast as you can! They only want to charge your credit card!!! Never again! I think half the people who gave good scores are probably the employees and Drs! Giving themselves praise! BS!

helpful_reviews.title: Great consult
helpful_reviews.author: tatatmy
helpful_reviews.content: I have used Teledoc twice now and love it!  Both times I have sent photos and explained my symptoms in detail before chat with excellent care from physician.  The physician was also very helpful in treatment options, which include OTC medicine and/or a script.  Would recommend this to anyone who has difficulty getting in to see their regular physician or weekend ailments. ğŸ‘�ğŸ�¼

helpful_reviews.title: Should be a lot better

helpful_reviews.title: Buyers Barricades Employee Saviors
helpful_reviews.author: chris schreiner
helpful_reviews.content: Thank God for my job with Buyers Barricades!  Iâ€™ve been cursed for over 20 years with a genetic tooth decay disorder but never had quick access to antibiotics when the pain was too much for me to handle until my job got us this plan!!   Thank you so much!! Itâ€™s kept me working and performing till the necessary medical procedure could be accomplished!!  God sent!!!

helpful_reviews.title: THANK YOU!!!
helpful_reviews.author: Bbpierced
helpful_reviews.content: I have a lot of medical issues which compromises my immune system. I try so hard to steer clear of dr offices & the general public during cold/flu season. Once I requested a visit for my little one, it was two minutes & we were video chatting with a doctor. Thank you for creating an easy to navigate app. I am very pleased with Teladoc & the service it provides.

helpful_reviews.title: Not listening
helpful_reviews.author: Lizzy Nugen
helpful_reviews.content: I worked in medical field. Thought I used Teladoc because what was going around was bacteria from my husband to his co workers.  Which happened to get sick at different times needed antibiotics to recover. The doctors argument that itâ€™s viral was really annoying. Statically, if multiple people recover at different time only when they get antibiotics then more likely than not, itâ€™s bacteria. So the argument was it was a coincidence that that it happens that when they took antibiotics the viral infection went away. If I thought it was viral I wonâ€™t need to call a doctor I can take care of it myself.

helpful_reviews.title: App vs Service
helpful_reviews.author: Swfrost
helpful_reviews.content: The app itself is great! Works well.  The care thus far has been as expected. Inconsistent. One doctor was a tad condescending when I questioned him, the next one was fabulous, and now, Iâ€™m sitting here waiting on a call that was scheduled for 20 minutes ago. No big deal and this isnâ€™t any different than the medical professionals I see in person.   The thing is: I live in a rural area and itâ€™s a lifesaver for me to not have to get in my car and drive 30+ minutes to a doctor.   Medical care is in crisis in this country and whatever anyone can do to fill in the gaps, I applaud. This works. Not perfectly but itâ€™s fine. Better than the alternatives.

helpful_reviews.title: Waste of time and money
helpful_reviews.author: nsnsjxjdkl
helpful_reviews.content: I scheduled an appointment only for the doctor to tell me they canâ€™t treat minors for ear pain as of 6 months ago. Scam artists. When I was signing up I had to input my childâ€™s age and what the problem was (ear pain) so at that point they should have had some kind of pop up that said they would not be able to help and to consult a live doctor.

helpful_reviews.title: Quick and convenient
helpful_reviews.author: Aggiesfamily
helpful_reviews.content: Made my profile which took about 5 minutes and then I asked for an appointment right away. I got a call in about 10 minutes from a very nice doctor and they called my prescription into my pharmacy all in under 20 minutes from start to finish!

helpful_reviews.title: Impossible to get help
helpful_reviews.author: racing_Girl 14
helpful_reviews.content: The only time I got a doctor, they said my issue is cause Iâ€™m fat. Next time I tried, scheduled a visit and got no call even an hour after the scheduled time (and ten minute text warning) and their 1-800 support couldnâ€™t figure out why or get ahold of anyone to tell me why. Never talked to anyone that day. Desperate now for a doctor and have to work 10 hour days the next three days, did the ASAP visit... guess within a few minutes means within an hour. Does anyone ever actually call or do they just get your hopes for help up?

helpful_reviews.title: Love Teladoc
helpful_reviews.author: Csqueezebox
helpful_reviews.content: I have used Teladoc several times as a family of six. I have not disappointed with a phone call yet. All of the providers have been courteous and friendly. helpful_reviews.title: Service is getting better!
helpful_reviews.author: Carol DC
helpful_reviews.content: Been using Teladoc for almost a year now.  Initially had horrible experiences but this app has helped me a few times recently, so I am now trying it more often.  I wish that the responses from dermatologists were quicker but theyâ€™ve been helpful once theyâ€™ve answered.  Hope the app and company continues to improve their service.

helpful_reviews.title: Incredible Convenience

She recommended Mucinex-DM, which is a terrible product to recommend because while the guaifenesin component breaks up the mucus, the dextromethorphan prevents you from coughing it out, so it just sits there in someoneâ€™s lungs.    Bad recommendations.  Bad experience.  Disappointed.

My pcp doc prescribed augmentin and steroids. Started feeling better after 2 days. The Teledoc is a freaking joke. They will not prescribe meds when you know what meds are what you need. Ripoff

I gave her my symptoms and AGREED with me it’s a small cold, yet the only symptom I have is a SLIGHT runny nose, I live in Kentucky were a pollen bowl that’s usual. There’s no way these are real doctors actually calling us, just individuals who are very excellent at using WebMd which I can easily do myself.   Oh well, knew it was too good to be true. I’ll just continue to do over the counter and contact my PCP.  *** App deleted! (Glad I didn’t have to buy it) ***

helpful_reviews.title: Great past experience
helpful_reviews.author: mankasboo
helpful_reviews.content: I used Teladoc back in 2012 or 2013 several times and they was great! I was signing up for some service I can’t remember what it was exactly (it wasn’t Teladoc but they was doing some kind of promotional work for Teladoc) but they offered Teladoc services as a additional opportunity to try out. (I believe this may have been when they was possibly still introducing Teladoc) I can’t recall the specific reasoning for all the calls I placed to Teladoc but I do know one of them was for bronchitis that I typically get like clockwork twice a year. It took only minutes to get a call back once requested and the doctor was awesome, he listened to my symptoms and without me stating that I pretty much knew it was bronchitis he determined that it was most likely bronchitis and then proceeded to place me on antibiotics that I picked up within the hour at my pharmacy. It was such a relief for me considering I didn’t have insurance and just waiting out my illness was total misery and my only other option at the time. I recall my other experiences being similar with no complications. I haven’t used Teladoc for a few years now but because of lack of insurance again I decided that it would be my best route considering it would soon be the time of year that I do have one of my battles with bronchitis. I haven’t like I said, used them in several years so I can’t give a to date review and will have to give a follow up review when I do but I see a lot of reviews of unhappy customers complaining of paying fees just to be told to go to their primary physician to receive treatment for issues that the customers are sure what they are and that the Teladoc program claims they treat. I seriously hope that this isn’t a issue because it would definitely be a deal breaker for me. The greatness of this service is being able to get prescription antibiotics the couple of times a year I may possibly need them without paying the high ER bill for a doctor to unnecessarily examine me for a illness I am already positive I have.  Only time will tell but I will definitely be doing a updated review once I have experienced how their service is now.

helpful_reviews.title: Best option but not for everyone or every issue!
helpful_reviews.author: firefishcook
helpful_reviews.content: Service is quick, easy and efficient.  I am a firefighter and In my line of work I frequently get poison oak, this is a fast and simple way to get meds on board before the rash spreads!  I’ve been 300+ miles away from home fighting fires and been able to speak with a doctor then pick up a prescription in my fire truck with no interruption to my job.  Breathing in all the smoke we do, I frequently get sinus infections and this is the easiest way to get antibiotics before the infection turns into bronchitis, cough, and a fever etc...    If you are sick and know what you need this is the service for you.  If you don’t know what your issue is and need tests and prefer 1 on 1 with a Doctor in person, this probably isn’t for you.  If you live a long distance from an Urgent Care Clinic or you have little ones at home and don’t have someone to watch them while you go to the doctor, this might be a better option.  No one wants to lug healthy kids into a waiting room full of sick patients to sit and wait for hours to be seen...   I have only had 1 time using Teladoc where it took 15 minutes to get a call back.  The consultation went fine but the clinical team was backlogged so it took over 20+ hours for my pharmacy to receive the prescription.  Had I picked a 24hr pharmacy, it might not have taken as long. Typically from the time I submit a request for a consultation to the time I receive a text from my pharmacy letting me know my medication is ready for pick up is about 20 minutes.

name: The Diary Health App
description: The Diary® app for individuals provides personal health data tracking, survey completion and daily care reminders for improved health outcomes. Connected with our professional platform, The Diary CarePro™, that provides an integrated system that supports care coordination with real-time communication between care teams and patients or may limit you to just completing surveys and assessments depending on how the organization sets up your account.   Use of The Diary app requires you have an account with an organization that uses The Diary CarePro. If you think The Diary would be useful to people in your organization, please have a company representative contact our sales representative.  Are you interested in improving health outcomes for patients? Contact us to learn more about The Diary CarePro™.  Key Features:  ***Track Daily Care Items*** Reach your health goals by personalizing care plans, setting and receiving reminders, and completing daily activities in the CareKit-enabled Today tab. Studies show that monitoring your progress increases your likelihood of meeting your goals.  ***Complete Surveys*** Complete surveys and assessments sent to you from the organization that set up your account. Your account type may limit you to just this feature.  ***Simple and Intuitive Tracking*** Easy one-touch entry for over 20 health modules: Blood Pressure, Blood Glucose, BMI, Weight, Body Fat, Height, Body Temperature, Feelings, Heart Rate, Medications Taken, Respiration Rate, Sleep, Steps, Oxygen Saturation, Symptoms, Water Intake, and Waist Circumference health data types.   ***Scan and Share Health Records and Files*** Import files from any app using our Share Extension, or use our scanning technology to create multi-page PDFs from your paper health records, lab results, and prescriptions. Print or share documents from right  inside the app, and use Spotlight Search to find your files right from your home screen!  ***Seamless Data Integration*** Apple Health data is automatically synced to The Diary from your favorite apps and devices.  ***Intelligent Voice Entry*** Use your Apple Watch or iOS device to record health data hands-free. Natural language processing identifies your speech and accurately organizes your information. Talk to your Diary about your daily health and let technology take care of the details!  ***Security*** Use TouchID to secure your Diary while you are away. Bank-grade secure file storage safely keeps copies of your health records, images, research, documentation, and other important health information.  ***Private and Personal*** The Diary’s Terms of Use and Privacy Policy are among the strongest in the health industry. We don’t access, sell, or distribute your data—ever. Not every health app on the market guarantees this.  ***Integration with Care Manager app*** By sharing your Diary with trusted care managers, you can achieve better communication and health improvements. Sharing is entirely up to you.  We’ve designed The Diary in collaboration with leading medical and technology experts to ensure utmost accuracy, efficiency, and security.  About the Diary Corporation:  A mobile-based care management platform, The Diary promotes effective, value-focused outcomes and improved communication among patients, their families, and their care teams. Our vision is to make it possible for every person in the world to achieve and maintain their best health.

recent_reviews.title: Promising, But Buggy!
recent_reviews.author: karen.eliz.mcgee
recent_reviews.content: I was really excited about this app! I'm looking for something new to help me manage my medications, primarily, and was encouraged by the App Store Editor's feature of this app. However, the app has been incredibly buggy; I've tried it out for a few days but it spends about 80% of its time trying to refresh and only about 20% actually being accurate and responsive. I'm excited that it includes such extensive features beyond simple medication reminders - opportunities to track refills, sleep, BMs, nutrition, water, etc - but it's too buggy to use reliably right now. Its main buggy issue is that it gets stuck in an infinite loop of refreshing; I can't actually check things off my list when I do them because it's refreshing ad nauseam without fully loading! I'd also suggest some standardization on the Feelings feature - either some standard inventory of feelings, or the option to easily view what individual feelings you've listed in the past so you can check if those are worse, same, or better.   I'll check back on future updates but for now, it's not my app of choice for meds and symptom tracking!

recent_reviews.title: Simple, Useful, and Beautiful
recent_reviews.author: soccerchicita
recent_reviews.content: The Diary is easy to use and has a great variety of personal health stats that are beneficial to be aware of. I have introduced this app to my 71 year old grandmother, who is a type 2 diabetic, and she was easily able to record her blood pressure. The display is beautiful with a modern look, but easy enough to use for those who may not be so tech savvy, such as my grandmother. One feature she enjoys is the step counter. The percentage display is steps taken is motivating for anyone to reach their goal. Another one of the many useful features is being able to track the medications you're taking and what you have already taken throughout the day. This gets rid of the confusion if you've forgotten what medicine you've already had. The ability to chose widgets in the home screen makes it more accessible and personalized for the user so that they can see what they need to by just opening the app. I personally recommend this app to everyone because knowing your body is the first step in to living a healthier life. The Diary has made that desired healthier lifestyle within reach for every one of its users.

helpful_reviews.title: Promising, But Buggy!
helpful_reviews.author: karen.eliz.mcgee
helpful_reviews.content: I was really excited about this app! I'm looking for something new to help me manage my medications, primarily, and was encouraged by the App Store Editor's feature of this app. However, the app has been incredibly buggy; I've tried it out for a few days but it spends about 80% of its time trying to refresh and only about 20% actually being accurate and responsive. I'm excited that it includes such extensive features beyond simple medication reminders - opportunities to track refills, sleep, BMs, nutrition, water, etc - but it's too buggy to use reliably right now. Its main buggy issue is that it gets stuck in an infinite loop of refreshing; I can't actually check things off my list when I do them because it's refreshing ad nauseam without fully loading! I'd also suggest some standardization on the Feelings feature - either some standard inventory of feelings, or the option to easily view what individual feelings you've listed in the past so you can check if those are worse, same, or better.   I'll check back on future updates but for now, it's not my app of choice for meds and symptom tracking!

helpful_reviews.title: Unacceptable lockout
