Especially info tracking possible migraine triggers. Then suddenly I canâ€™t log in, no errors. I waited a few days, then a couple weeks, still canâ€™t get back in.  I just tried to reset my password, only to find out I canâ€™t access MY health tracking without having a medical provider that uses this service.  NO WARNINGS...just LOCKED OUT of my personal info that I trusted this company with!! Talk about poor business practices! I wouldnâ€™t want any of my medical providers to use this company. Who knows when they will pull another stunt simulator to this one. They could at least export the users information and email it to them or give them access to do it. I feel so invaded by this company. Who knows what they will do with my information. Who knows this wasnâ€™t a scam all along and they really donâ€™t provide any service to anyone and they are stealing medical information from everyone that used their app?? COMPLETE INVASION OF PRIVACY!!!!

helpful_reviews.title: Almost nothing works or...
helpful_reviews.author: DeadboltSecurity
helpful_reviews.content: This is the most non-intuitive program I think I've ever worked with. Four example, I just launch the app on my Apple Watch and all it gives is a big microphone. If you touch the microphone you can make a note recording. From there if you go to their website or you go to the app there is absolutely no place where I can see that that note shows up. You set up all of your prescription drugs in The app and then when you want to indicate that you have taken your medication where do you do that from? Absolutely non-intuitive.  Every bit of instructions that I found on this program cover perhaps 5% of what this program appears to do. This program has been one of the biggest waste of my time up any app I've ever tried.

name: Emrify - Personal Health Record
description: Emrify puts Health Information in the Right Hands at the Right Time. Your Passport to the Health System. All Doctors. One Record.  Emrify is your hub for electronic health records.  Emrify serves as a center for all of your health data to increase accessibility and communication between health systems.  - Maintain medical history - Track data like weight, blood pressure, and more - Sync wearable devices like Fitbit, Jawbone, and Google - Import CCDs (continuity of care document) - Private link to share Chart with doctors - Print pre-populated medical check-in forms  Emrify lets you sync, view, and share all of your health records on the mobile device in a secure, beautiful, and easy to understand interface. It's free. It's accurate. It improves health.  Features are continuously added.  Please send us any comments and feedback for the next update.  info@emrify.com

name: Personal Records
description: Personal Records is the fastest way to record and search your results in many types of workouts.   Personal Records does a great job of recording results for the workouts that are important to you. Designed for the typical gym-goer who does not care to track and log EVERY workout but still wants to see how they are progressing in important movements.  Calculate 80% of your best back squat either from the app or from the new Apple Watch app.   The Personal Records app allows you to: • Instantly see your personal records in all of your workouts on the main screen. • Categorize your workouts with Tags. • Calculate the percentages of your best lifts within the app. • Instantly see how you are progressing in a workout through time.  The PR app has support for tracking workouts that are scored by: • Fastest time • As many rounds as possible (AMRAP) • As many repetitions as possible • Heaviest weight • And, as of version 2.8, you can track workouts with any units you choose!  Spend less time logging, and more time exercising.   Suggestions? Comments? Drop us a line @PersonalRecordsApp on Facebook or leave a review.  CrossFit is a registered trademark of CrossFit Inc. This app is not affiliated with CrossFit Inc. in any way.

recent_reviews.title: Check your PR’s in the middle of a workout!
recent_reviews.author: Koppenhofer
recent_reviews.content: Love this app! I CrossFit at a box and my phone is in a locker so I needed something that would allow me to see my PR’s and calculate weight percentages on the fly (like when your coach says “I want you to deadlift at 80% of your max”). This app allows that since it’s on my watch! Yes, my box uses Wodify but who has time to try and sift through that while everyone else wants to check theirs too! This app on the watch makes it a split second decision on what weight to use. I also love that you can customize your categories and filters to make the list work with whatever type of workouts you do.

name: UPMC Health Plan
description: This mobile app is only for UPMC Health Plan members. Not a member? Learn more at www.upmchealthplan.com.    Convenient on-the-go access to your health insurance and wellness plans. Whether you need to chat with a health coach or forgot your member ID card for your doctor’s visit, this app gives you improved access to your insurance benefits.    GET INSURANCE BENEFITS ON THE GO    - Access member ID cards for you and your family, and email or fax them to your doctor directly from the app.  - Use live chat and secure messaging to connect with Member Services.  - View your prescriptions and pharmacies.  - Check the status of your claims, and see your FSA balance.  - Search for doctors, dentists, hospitals, and wait times at UPMC urgent care centers.   CONNECT WITH YOUR WELLNESS   - Chat with a health coach to help improve your lifestyle.  - Track your steps with Apple Health app integration and check your Take a Healthy Step progress.  - Take the MyHealth Questionnaire to learn more about your health.

recent_reviews.title: Very disappointed
recent_reviews.author: DVT Prone Mom
recent_reviews.content: Loved when they previously used MyChart app and I could email my doctor and check test results without having to log into a computer.  Was wonderful to be able to access it during my lunch hour because we are not allowed to use company computers for personal business.   Now I have to wait until I get home and most doctor’s offices do not take calls after 4:00 when you have questions.   What should be made easier is not.

recent_reviews.title: Down for maintenance???
recent_reviews.author: app scrutinator
recent_reviews.content: I was told to move to this app and it says down for maintenance..  been saying that for 2 months

recent_reviews.title: Down for maintenance
recent_reviews.author: MjacobPGH
recent_reviews.content: App has been down for maintenance for days since downloading.

recent_reviews.title: Useless
recent_reviews.author: Ajdtymco
recent_reviews.content: I give it a one only because there’s nothing lower. This app is a joke it contains none of my medical information 2 days after my dr visit and none of my pharmacy information either. Fix it or remove it from the App Store .

recent_reviews.title: Pathetic
recent_reviews.author: pscreed
recent_reviews.content: It’s incredible to me how much we pay for healthcare vs what we receive in quality. This app is a perfect example - it’s great unless you expect to receive a response other than “an unexpected error has occurred - please try again later”. Utterly and completely useless. UPMC should go back to fax lines and filing cabinets. Oh wait they never left.

recent_reviews.title: This app doesn’t work! I will rate it better when it is fixed!
recent_reviews.author: cntry82txn
recent_reviews.content: So my company is using this provider to conduct a health challenge with monetary rewards. The app promises to link your iOS health data to a step tracker on the providers side in order for that data to be automatically counted in my company’s health challenge. Every time I try to enable this setting in the app it just gives me an error and tells me to try again later.

recent_reviews.title: Not assessable
recent_reviews.author: Stuffer601
recent_reviews.content: Was told I it’s not available to me because of my insurance plan.

recent_reviews.title: Not working
recent_reviews.author: Nikkibaby8691
recent_reviews.content: They were doing maintenance on this app and days after it's not letting me sign in at all before hand I was able to. How long is it going to take to fix it cause this is ridiculous

recent_reviews.title: Does not currently work
recent_reviews.author: Pynchi
recent_reviews.content: I just downloaded this app and it doesn’t seem to work. As soon as I open it I get an error and I am unable to log in. I immediately uninstalled it.

recent_reviews.title: Insurance Discrimination at its best
recent_reviews.author: Chula333
recent_reviews.content: Obviously the app only works for a private members. If you are a UPMC for you member it’s not for you. We are only affiliate of UPMC Health Plan.

recent_reviews.title: Fresh Look
recent_reviews.author: Themostcoolguyever
recent_reviews.content: Looks awesome! New fresh look is pretty sleek. Looking forward to more updates. Keep working on features that are most useful for members.

recent_reviews.title: App not the same as internet version
recent_reviews.author: Superxbomber
recent_reviews.content: So I can you my same old username and password word on the internet version of their service but when I try to use the application it telling me that it doesn't recognize my username or password. They need to get both these things up to date with each other.

recent_reviews.title: Terrible
recent_reviews.author: Jami@
recent_reviews.content: The update stinks! It states an error occurred please try again later. What's up with that??? Why is it that every time you update, it doesn't work. Leave well enough alone!

recent_reviews.title: Junk
recent_reviews.author: nicholaswbarker
recent_reviews.content: Doesn't work.  Unable to locate username after entering group ID. The app simple does not respond

recent_reviews.title: Great.
recent_reviews.author: Gregcheersykes
recent_reviews.content: Most recent update is great!  I love the app. It's the main reason I opted for UPMC healthcare.   **Consider adding EOBs and graphs that show usage for out of pocket and deductibles. Thanks!!**  I like the in-app chat function.   Thanks for adding TouchID so I don't have to put in my password. Thanks.   Bug report: minor issue--small delay/latency when typing in ID card numbers etc. when signing up for app.   Wish list: 1) I wish I could import my ID card to Apple Wallet, 2) pay my premium with ApplePay. 3) Also, it'd be nice if I could also send a secure message to a customer service representative right from the app! 3) Instead of typing in member id#, make it scannable so the phone's camera can just grab the numbers off card. That'd be helpful.   4) Apple Keychain integration  3D Touch for quick ID card access?

recent_reviews.title: Trash-- don't download it
recent_reviews.author: accelerator bassman
recent_reviews.content: Would not take my member ID, would not allow me to enter my username or password, would not let me reset either of those two, no phone number to call for support, no email for support -- typical UPMC. Found out about this from a direct mailer, even that has not a single phone number or email on it to contact for help. Why create an app that doesn't work?

recent_reviews.title: Can't register
recent_reviews.author: Gyrosauce
recent_reviews.content: Trying to register, put all of my info in, click done, goes to a white screen and noting else. Please fix.

recent_reviews.title: Tired and Broken
recent_reviews.author: Sebac
recent_reviews.content: This app has not been updated to support the screen sizes of the iPhone 6 family.  Many of the features show no information.  To the app author: fix it or get rid of it!

recent_reviews.title: Nothing in it
recent_reviews.author: docwhat
recent_reviews.content: It's a very bare app.   Pros: - has card invade you lose physical one.  - has some prescriptions. But not over the counter.  - has dr. info.   Cons: - no fingerprint sensor support.  - no passport integration.  - no HealthKit integration.  - no way to message dr.  - no way to view lab results.  - no way to read dr. Messages - no over the counter prescriptions.  - it doesn't even have vitals from dr. appts.   Overall it is the minimal you could do and still say it successfully was an app.

recent_reviews.title: Would love a Bill Pay feature
recent_reviews.author: Voobu
recent_reviews.content: Nice looking app.  I like the features but it feels partially done because there's no way to pay a bill or, in my case, my monthly premium.  Love the login pin...so easy.

recent_reviews.title: Used to work
recent_reviews.author: stack of cash
recent_reviews.content: Liked this app. Unfortunately. It's not working anymore.  I reinstalled and the same error "unexpected error occurred please try again later".  Every day when I try to login

recent_reviews.title: Caution I had problems with this
recent_reviews.author: Rapowell64
recent_reviews.content: After installing this app you are required to enter personal information to create an account. Including your upmc Id number. Last four of as number. Zip code. Enough info for identity theft. Then I got a message that said this app is not available for me and had to give email to be notified when it was. I hope it is a legit app and apologize if I'm wrong but I'm nervous that I bought into a scam.

recent_reviews.title: Bumpy start but nice features
recent_reviews.author: Sunlizard76
recent_reviews.content: Recently improved account creation process.  Once the account was up and running the app provides some convenient account freatures.  First, switch login to 4 digit pin, quicker access. Don't need to carry insurance card any more with app version ( one less thing in the George wallet, see Seinfeld). Easy access  to FSA totals amount other things. Good base anticipate addition function in the future.

recent_reviews.title: Meh
recent_reviews.author: PaxSlavica
recent_reviews.content: Can't create an account in app. Created online cannot sign in into the app. Unit testing? Nope haven't heard of that.

recent_reviews.title: Great, useful app
recent_reviews.author: Buccos37
recent_reviews.content: The Rolls-Royce of health insurance apps

recent_reviews.title: Very nice app
recent_reviews.author: cleansheets
recent_reviews.content: Easy to use, clean, and good performance. Well done.

recent_reviews.title: Finally a health insurer got it right!
recent_reviews.author: bnokjd
recent_reviews.content: Great app! Very convenient! Easy access to your info, ID card, etc!!

recent_reviews.title: A useful app
recent_reviews.author: Cdawg412
recent_reviews.content: Glad to have easy access to my member ID card!

recent_reviews.title: 1st
recent_reviews.author: Dragonfly030
recent_reviews.content: cool app

recent_reviews.title: Great app
recent_reviews.author: Stacytpittsburgh
recent_reviews.content: This app is beautiful and well thought out.  I love the MyHealth Circle which lists all the physicians I've seen - nice way to keep all this information organized.  Because I don't go to the doctor much I need a reminder of their exact location - love the location feature of my previously viewed physicians.  Also, my claims are there - perfect.  The Identification card is also nice...sometimes I don't carry anything but my iPhone and now I have my card right there! Thank you.

name: OpenTreatment Personal Health Record (PHR)
description: OpenTreatment is a universal doctor/hospital intake form that verifies and authorizes insurance & gives you live up to the minute ER wait times. Find a doctor quickly and easily with the convenience of knowing when you will be seen. With one click you can send your intake form, insurance information and medical records including x-rays to any hospital or doctor’s office.  Get started win three easy steps: 1.     Download OpenTreatment and set up your account 2.     Add your medical information—allergies, history, etc. Take a picture of your insurance card 3.     Search for your Doctor and Send. It’s that easy.   Other features: OpenTreatment offers a search function by radius so you can see where your Doctor is with map. Download all your medical files, X-Ray's, & Labs (Send to any provider from your phone). See live ER wait times.

recent_reviews.title: Helpful and EASY
recent_reviews.author: John.Madden
recent_reviews.content: Great UI- very easy to use. Thx for a helpful app!

recent_reviews.title: Fantastic App
recent_reviews.author: Shauna707
recent_reviews.content: As a NP I am so happy to have the ability to have patients send in their intake form with ease and review their medications and history before they arrive.

recent_reviews.title: Brilliant
recent_reviews.author: TamsenE
recent_reviews.content: Love the features of my intake forms all on one app. About time!

recent_reviews.title: Outstanding App
recent_reviews.author: MarshaD46
recent_reviews.content: Finally an App that is easy to use and makes my medical journey effortless. Thank You!!!

recent_reviews.title: An amazing app
recent_reviews.author: dannnnnnnnnnnnniel
recent_reviews.content: This is an amazing app that is great for checking out the fastest ER wait times.

name: Capzule
description: Using too many Health Apps?  Consolidate with Capzule - Single App to Track Health and Wellness of Your Family.  Stored locally on your device. Capzule PHR is the most comprehensive personal health records App. A must have for parents, family caregivers and chronic patients.  - TouchID Enabled - Today View Widget (My Profile, Reminders & Appointments) - AirDrop File/Backup Share - Drive and Dropbox Interfaced - Keep Family Health Data Organized - Create Summary in PDF, Email, Export & Print - Import CSV from Mail Attachments/Other Apps - Scan Documents Using Camera into PDF - Create Custom Health Monitoring Templates to Track Any Chronic Condition - Set Unlimited Medication Reminders  - Set Doctor Appointment Reminders - Visualize Health Data in Graphical Timeline - Upload Files Directly From Computers - Edit Directly From A Computer Browser - Add Files From Other Apps - Transfer Data Between iOS Devices - Password Protected - Create QR Code Summary for Emergency Personnel  - Data Backup/Restore Using Email or Computer  ** Features In Depth **  - Export CSV data from desktop/laptop - Record conditions and allergies - Store doctor appointments - Enter medications - Email summary and graphs - Print or download summary from desktop/laptop - Maintain immunization records - Enter vitals in Metric or Standard units - Analyze line graphs of vitals and lab results - Keep family, social and medical history together - Track health statistics with flowsheets and self health screening - Enter notes, upload results and files - Manage physician and insurance information - Password protected - Reset password when password is lost - Email flowsheet data in CSV (comma separated values) format along with graphs - Email Summary with images (graphs) - Email Documents/attachments - Categorize Notes, Results & Files   ** Auto-renewable In-App Subscriptions  - 1. Monthly Ad-Free ($1.49)  - 2. Yearly Ad-Free ($11.99) A purchase for the amount specified in the selected plan will be applied to your iTunes account on confirmation. Subscriptions will automatically renew unless canceled within 24-hours before the end of the current term. You can turn off automatic renewal in your iTunes account settings. (Terms of Use: http://www.capzule.com/inapp-tou.html).

recent_reviews.title: Best app ever
recent_reviews.author: 007omar alqam
recent_reviews.content: Perfect app

recent_reviews.title: Get rid of mandatory ads
recent_reviews.author: chartru
recent_reviews.content: Get rid of mandatory ads

recent_reviews.title: Baski Phamacist!
recent_reviews.author: Kuttyma1
recent_reviews.content: This is an awesome app. I recommend this app to my Patients, family and friends. You can keep all your appointments, allergies, health conditions in one place. Easier to email the information to healthcare professionals from app. You can manage your family’s healthcare at one place. User friendly!

recent_reviews.title: Lost data
recent_reviews.author: TNT5506
recent_reviews.content: Initially, I bought this at version 1.  I liked it but only needed to access it once or twice a year. So, when the iOS 11 update came out I was unaware that the app would not work. Fast forward to post iOS 11 update and version 1 no longer works. No backup of my data and can’t find a way to access or import the data to version 2. Poor planning on my part and the developers. They should have made it so we wouldn’t lose the data.  Also, I paid for the first version. Since iOS 11 and up do not support that version, it irritates me that I now must pay again (if I want to lose the adds) for a subscription. Wrong, just wrong.

recent_reviews.title: Best Medical app ever!
recent_reviews.author: California Teaqueen
recent_reviews.content: I have used Capzule for several years to keep track of medical information for family and friends. I tried several apps before settling on this one. I like how all the information is gathered in one place and it is easy to access. I use it all the time for every appointment, Information on meds and contact information. I love how you can attach pictures and documents. As said, everything is all in one place and that makes it super easy. I have been at Stanford and UCSF using this app and medical staff were very impressed!

recent_reviews.title: Super App
recent_reviews.author: Minutemanjim
recent_reviews.content: I have used this app for a few years now and I have all of our family’s medical history in one spot. Doctors are amazed how much information I readily have on hand. This is the best personal health record I found to date. Not thrilled with the ads popping up now and don’t plan on paying a recurring fee to get rid of them. I guess it is just business. I can live with them. Again, best app to record and track your family’s medical history. Would highly recommend it.

recent_reviews.title: CAUTION you will Lose your medical records!!!
recent_reviews.author: urbanjalapeno
recent_reviews.content: The idea behind this app is great and there is certainly a need given modern medicine BUT their execution is HORRIBLE. After using the app for a year or so there was an update and “Poof” all our records were gone and could no longer be recovered.  What happens next?? Nothing. You start over. There is no customer service, there is no phone number. Your records are simply gone. Think about it. You spend the time and energy to consolidate all your records in one place and then one day after an iOS update or app update they’re gone!

recent_reviews.title: No paid version with no adds
recent_reviews.author: Chessplaya544
recent_reviews.content: Based on other reviews and some testing it is not worth the time to put all your data into an app only to be consumed by adds.   Please give us an option for a paid version.

recent_reviews.title: Stunningly Awful!!!!  It was such a great App.
recent_reviews.author: CathieLB
recent_reviews.content: Hard to believe, but this app’s performance just goes from poor to very, very, bad.  And it was such a wonderful piece of software back in the day.  So sad.  I can no longer backup data - not in Google Drive or Dropbox, Clicking on Airdrop just causes the app to crash, and now not even emailing works!  The email is never sent.  So no more sharing between devices.  It has to be manually entered on each one!  Either fix the app so it works properly or just put it out of our misery!!!!

recent_reviews.title: Former favorite
recent_reviews.author: Geaglin
recent_reviews.content: Capzule was my former favorite, even with the ads. However it now stays open only for a couple of seconds after tapping icon, both on IPhone 6 and 8Plus. Would have been 5 stars except for this unfortunate glitch.

recent_reviews.title: Great Program
recent_reviews.author: eriddle
recent_reviews.content: This is the best medical record I have found on IOS. The only draw back is that sometimes there is an issue with merging data between two devices in fact the other day I did that and it crashed the program on both devices and to reinstall then restore from back. So make sure you back up anytime there are changes.

recent_reviews.title: Must have App
recent_reviews.author: Maddie TAJ
recent_reviews.content: I have been using this app for years and love it. I have two autoimmune disorders which require me to go to numerous doctors during the year. I totally depend on Capzule to keep me organized. When I’m referred to a new doctor, I have all my medications listed and history of my past medical procedures etc to review with doctor. I recently had problems with my iPhone 6 which made me get a new phone an iPhone 8. I had not been able to update my old phone for some time so I had not had any problems with Capzule. However with the iPhone 8 my Capzule would not work and I was lost!!  After much searching I found an updated app in the App Store and luckily I had backup in my cloud so I was able to restore everything to my new phone Praise the Lord! This app is awesome. Everyone needs it.

recent_reviews.title: Horrible
recent_reviews.author: Starrbuxfrk
recent_reviews.content: Had no chance to back up data before the app stopped working with last iOS update. Have my medical history but my other family’s was lost. Stupidly enough I bought the updated app (would’ve been nice if the developer let us download the new app for free as we’d already paid for it but NO). Paid for and downloaded the new app and now IT doesn’t work and is out if date. Complete waste of money, do not buy!

recent_reviews.title: Annoying ads
recent_reviews.author: Dhuynh7888
recent_reviews.content: Went from useful to terrible. Ads pop up constantly. Very heavy handed. App will load full page ads before even using. Agree with other reviewers. There’s no option to buy out. Been using this app for years. Develop switch app and old app no longer works with new iOS

recent_reviews.title: Can’t get help
recent_reviews.author: ihandy1
recent_reviews.content: I used the previous version for years.  That version is not supported by current iOS.   I can’t import data from old to new version.  There is no way to contact capzule for help.  I’ve essentially lost over 5 years of data for my chronically ill child.

recent_reviews.title: Best in class though still a few hiccups
recent_reviews.author: PnUy8vtn6wh3
recent_reviews.content: No other medical record application comes even close to the capabilities in Capzule. I use it for all medical consultations and demonstrate it for interested health provider personnel. Most of them are amazed and some express interest in possibly getting it. We are all appreciative of the local only data storage and no Internet connection required.  Two gotchas at this point (01/08/2018) with version 2.0.1 (iPad): a) no direct contact with any application support personnel, b) Dropbox and local network HTTP functionality doesn’t appear to work. Use of Dropbox pops up authorization window but no backup is ever performed (screen blinks after allowing access and then drops back to Capzule). Initiating local network transfer fails as Capzule never opens up the designated port.  b) HTTP connectivity: issue resolved - desktop multi-network control sequence Dropbox connectivity: issue not resolved; even after rebooting Capzule client devices the Dropbox Authorization process appears to work but no backup file is uploaded; screen immediately returns to Capzule

recent_reviews.title: Is app continuing?
recent_reviews.author: Mommobile
recent_reviews.content: This has got to be THE best app for health issues. I actually recorded each of my kids’  health records from their newborn records and their records for school. I wrote in a family history as well so that the kids can print it out and rake it to their own doctor appointments. I was able to upload medical reports and photos (ugh!) of my EGD scope! Incredible. Since my phone calendar doesn’t go back a whole year, I can look at the app to see whenI should get in for my annual exam.  Seriously, this app is all you need to carry around all your medical data for any appointments.  Start keeping your kids’ records with you for all pediatrician visits and jot down when they have all those childhood illnessss.

recent_reviews.title: Get a paid version
recent_reviews.author: Free wildly
recent_reviews.content: I’ve been using this app for awhile and loved it till the latest release with adds.

recent_reviews.title: Used to love this app until upgrade
recent_reviews.author: Nopalita21
recent_reviews.content: I used the old version of Capzule for several years and backed it up frequently. I loved the old version! However, ever since the upgrade to the new version, I can’t access my old back-up to transfer to the new version. So I guess I have to re-enter everything from memory which defeats the  purpose of having the old app that I can’t access!! If there is an IT person that can help resolve this issue then I’ll be happy to give this app 5 stars with raving reviews.

recent_reviews.title: Great health record
recent_reviews.author: AndyA1947
recent_reviews.content: I am so glad the Capzule app is updated. It allows for mobile health records which can be easily kept up to date.

recent_reviews.title: Very good app. Zero support
recent_reviews.author: Jayip4
recent_reviews.content: Very useful app. Rather than update app. A new app was created. Information from old app will not transfer and you obviously can’t open old app on new iOS to manually copy data. No way of contacting Capzule either.

recent_reviews.title: Love this app, but some issues and enhancements
recent_reviews.author: mikeindm
recent_reviews.content: Love the app, glad to see it back. I can deal with the ads, but would like to see a new pay version.  DropBox isn’t working for me. When I go into the tools or the backup, it asks me to allow the program to access Dropbox but it never lets me do a backup. I can backup to Google Drive with no problem.   I would like to see a way to remove data. I track my blood sugar and insulin usage daily. That’s 365 entries in a year and all I really need access to is the most recent 90-120 entries. Maybe a way to delete by date range? Or even a way to quickly mark a screen full of entries to delete.   Finally, I would like to store templates separately from my data. Lacking a way to mass delete data, I was thinking I could copy a template into self monitoring and call it Diabetes 2017, then copy it in as Diabetes 2018 and simply delete 2017 at some point. Thanks!

recent_reviews.title: Unable to move backup from Capzule  1.0 to 2.0
recent_reviews.author: bogra2000
recent_reviews.content: My backups are in iCloud. There a way to restore the 1.0 backup  from iCloud to Capzule 2.0. After upgrading to iOS 11 I can’t even start Capzule 1.0.  Please advise.... thanks

recent_reviews.title: Still no Dropbox Backup
recent_reviews.author: Screen Walker
recent_reviews.content: I’ve had this program for a long time and it’s great. Very useful & largely functional. But one concern is always, how to make sure your info is secure beyond just living on your phone?   I like to backup to a separate iPad when possible using Dropbox. That quit working a few weeks ago. The developer released an upgrade that was supposed to fix that. But now when I try the backup, I get sent to my Dropbox app to approve Capzule’s access. When I click to Allow, I get sent right back to the Capzule app with no backup happening. Try the backup again, get sent back to Dropbox again to allow access. OVER AND OVER. Something is not communicating right between those two. Please help!  Edit to add: developer contacted me, I can’t respond by e-mail or on their website though - only though the App Store on my phone, which I hate. Anyway: tried closing and launching both apps in various orders, same result. Deleted Dropbox & re-installed it, same result. Tap settings -> cloud symbol under Backup -> Dropbox; Dropbox launches and says “Capzule PHR Free would like access to files & folders in your Dropbox” -> tapping Allow causes the “Authorizing” box to momentarily appear, then Capzule reopens to the account page and the News folder flashes blue two times... but the only message in the folder is the Version 2.0.1 announcement. If I try to backup again the whole process repeats again. This is on an iPhone SE running 11.1.1 although I believe I was having difficulty backing up back on iOS 10. The newer version of Capzule seems to have introduced this endless loop though.

recent_reviews.title: Conversion from old app
recent_reviews.author: sesposi
recent_reviews.content: The app is great, but no notice was given that it was being updated and that the old data doesn’t transfer over in order to view as before- very disappointing!

recent_reviews.title: Thought this was a great app until
recent_reviews.author: SJLeite
recent_reviews.content: I open the app and I now get a pop up message that says “a new version is released with fix for iCloud and dropbox connectivity problem. Thank you” at the bottom of the box it says OK and takes you to the App Store which does not give you the option to update just to open the app and when you open the app the same message appears therefore I cannot access any of the information in the app. UPDATE: The next day there was an update option in the App Store which I did and now the app is running perfectly.

recent_reviews.title: Used to be 5 stars
recent_reviews.author: JDfoto
recent_reviews.content: My biggest complaint is the irritating ads which now randomly pop up while I'm trying to take notes in the doctors office. They are full page and require you to click them off before you continue. I'm irritated by this, But it's still a really great app. Please bring back the paid app without ads, and I will pay more for it and give you 5 stars again!

recent_reviews.title: Lost all data with iOS 11
recent_reviews.author: FlCeph
recent_reviews.content: I found this app very useful. But after my iPhone update to iOS11 I’m unable to access the app or transfer the data to the new version. Very inconvenient. I will look for a new app.

recent_reviews.title: Ok for a free app
recent_reviews.author: MonkeyRules
recent_reviews.content: Been using it since 2014.  New upgrade is VERY similar to old v1.0 with 2 big FLAWS!  Unable to import data from old app unless you had them backed up separately!  Now there are pop-up ads (annoying). So instead of re-entering data all over again, purchase an ad free app and start from scratch!

recent_reviews.title: Give us a paid option pronto!
recent_reviews.author: Bahia97
recent_reviews.content: I’ve been using the app for a few years, it really keeps me organized, love the calendar integration and prescriptions list. I refer to it every doctor’s visit. I’m older now and not having to memorize my meds and dosages is very handy. I’m also very happy the app is now iOS 11 compatible but now its ad sponsored and I really don’t like that at all. Today I was prompted to watch a video and the sound was on. Having this go off while I was in a meeting was aggravating. I’d gladly pay for the app to get rid of this. Without it I may have to look elsewhere to record my medical data.

recent_reviews.title: I Agree with KB0804!!
recent_reviews.author: Lucy Brown2
recent_reviews.content: I agree with everything in that review! I love this app! Please, please keep it going!

recent_reviews.title: Upset customer
recent_reviews.author: IdeneP
recent_reviews.content: I had the old paid version of capzule. I updated my phone to the new iOS 11 software for my phone and went to open the app and it states that it isn’t supported by the new software update. I try to update & can’t. I downloaded the newest version to see if I can have the information migrated over and I can’t. 7+ years of medical records of me and my family- GONE!! There is no way to contact the developer to get an answer. I tried following the steps on the page with no success. I can’t find an email- nothing. I’m so upset, frustrated and disappointed that they would do this.

recent_reviews.title: Bring Back Paid Version!
recent_reviews.author: Sini42
recent_reviews.content: This is a fantastic app. My wife uses it religiously, and nothing out there compares. We were very disappointed when there was no iOS 11 support, but thrilled beyond belief when you released the tweaked ad-supported version here. But please, give us the option to pay for ad removal. There are those like us who are so appreciative of your software, we’d be willing to pay (again) for this “new” version!

recent_reviews.title: Thank you, thank you, thank you
recent_reviews.author: Phila chick
recent_reviews.content: I had all but given up my precious app when 2.0 appeared. I’ve been using this app since 2012 and depended heavily on it especially as I age and have more doctors appointments. I almost missed out transferring my info as IOS 11 overran my iPad but you saved the day. A bit tricky at first to figure out transferring old info. It would be helpful to give a way to restore from an old backup if Capzule 1 was rendered non functional. Syncing (or fixing sync) with Dropbox would give it 5 stars for me. Don’t leave again please.

recent_reviews.title: Updated....where’s all my data?
recent_reviews.author: COOKIE101T
recent_reviews.content: Thanks for updating the app for iOS 11, however, years of data is gone.

recent_reviews.title: I LOOOVVVEEE this App!!
recent_reviews.author: mpaul389
recent_reviews.content: I guarantee you that I am beyond abnormal when it comes to keeping detailed PHR (personal health records), and I take much pride in staying organized and on top of my medical history. Having many medical issues and having to see many different doctors, it’s so nice to have everything in one place that is very clean, visually appealing, and user friendly. I was freaking out when I thought they did away with the app, but now it contains ads (I originally paid the $20, but I’m just glad I still have my Capzule HR!) TRUST ME...I have tried them all and nothing comes close to this app.  Please continue to remain in the App Store forever!

recent_reviews.title: Can old data from the original be moved to 2.0
recent_reviews.author: BeckyLuvsBooks
recent_reviews.content: I love this app. Used the old version for years. I didn’t know where else to ask this question.   If I have already updated to iOS 11, Is it possible to transfer information from the previous app to the new 2.0 version? I am worried it will not be able to access my original data.   Thank you for your help!!  UPDATE: Thank you for the quick response. I did back it up, but to iCloud. Will I be able to access it from iCloud?

recent_reviews.title: Update removed my paid features
recent_reviews.author: AnimeImp
recent_reviews.content: I paid for Capzule 1.0. I was overjoyed to see that they put out 2.0 so I would not lose it during the 11.0 upgrade. But they put out a add supported only version, ignoring those of us who paid $4.99 for the previous add free app. And when you go to app support, you are directed to their website with *no* way to contact them via email or form. So the took our money and then put out a mandatory upgrade that removed the paid features, and I am left with no choice but to leave a 1 star review.

recent_reviews.title: Can't transfer Capsule 1 data to Capsule 2
recent_reviews.author: Just want I wanted
recent_reviews.content: My husband and I have used and relied on Capsule to maintain our medical records for over 5 years. To use this new version we must re-enter our profiles and all our medical data. That's not acceptable. Please provide a link to resolve this issue.  Thank you for your response. I was able to transfer our data and all is well. Like some of the changes such as being able to add physician from appt screen.

recent_reviews.title: Love this app!
recent_reviews.author: artsygeek
recent_reviews.content: I've used this app for quite awhile and it has become indispensable for me. I am able to schedule my appointments in the app and they automatically show up in my calendars. I take a photo of my lab results to put in Capzule's files. I can put lab results like blood pressure and cholesterol into Capzule and see at a glance results on a chart. Backup has been smooth and sharing within my devices works fine. At the doctor's office I am able to access any medical info in seconds. I know Capzule needs to place ads to keep developing it so that doesn't bother me. It would be nice to have the option to pay to eliminate the ads like so many other apps do. Thanks for a wonderful app!

recent_reviews.title: Use to love it
recent_reviews.author: Rummomma
recent_reviews.content: I always loved this app until the new updated version.  I hate the pop up adds.  Isn't there a way to get rid of them. If so I would give it 5 stars

recent_reviews.title: Cannot restore backup from 1.3.1
recent_reviews.author: Yourdysfunctionhere
recent_reviews.content: The instructions to use airdrop to restore a backup of 1.3.1 data to migrate to 2.0 does not work.  It crashes the app.  It actually crashes both versions, repeatedly and reliably.  Since there is no other way to restore data from the previous version, I'm stuck.  Time to migrate to something else I guess.  UPDATE: I was able to restore from backup using dropbox.  The airdrop issue was limited to the iPad, but I could not get an iPhone and iPad to recognize capzule on each device.  The instructions and capabilities provided are in some cases incomplete and in others wrong, as they refer to capabilities that do not function.

recent_reviews.title: Absolutely rely on this app
recent_reviews.author: newbie 12
recent_reviews.content: I love this app, really rely on it to keep track of my medical history, including prescribed medications. It's comprehensive and easy to use, and has proven its worth many times over, including during medical appointments.  The ads aren't greatly intrusive, but I would gladly pay for an ad-free version.

recent_reviews.title: Love it! But...
recent_reviews.author: ClarielWicked
recent_reviews.content: I had the last version and I loved it too.  The only thing I've noticed is that there's advertising on the new one and no way so far to remove.  I also haven't found a way to contact them to ask questions like how to remove the advertising.

recent_reviews.title: Please don't ever stop making this app!
recent_reviews.author: KB0804
recent_reviews.content: I have literally never written an app review before. However, I felt compelled to do so because I can't imagine keeping track of my families medical records without this app. When I learned that it would not be supported in iOS11, I downloaded over 10 other PHR apps but none even came close to what this one can accomplish.  Andaman7 was the best alternative I found , but the lab tracking leaves much to be desired.  Capzule is by far the easiest to use, most comprehensive in terms of what info you can store, and has the best UI of any PHR app out there. My only wish is that I could pay them a lump sum to remove the adds. But the company has to be able make money to keep developing the app.  Thank you soooooo much for keeping this app going.

recent_reviews.title: Wondering
recent_reviews.author: Tmatteson
recent_reviews.content: This app is "one of a kind."  It allows you to accurately record records.  I used it much with my wife's cancer up to the point of her death...it provided continuity of care instructions and documented well test results.  It is disappointing to find this version full if adds...I use it because it is good for my own medical challenges but the adds are a nuisance.  Don't know why developers can not create purchase option...

recent_reviews.title: Русский перевод нереален
recent_reviews.author: 1_1bzzzzz1_1
recent_reviews.content: Пользоваться невозможно

recent_reviews.title: Thank you!
recent_reviews.author: lattelicious
recent_reviews.content: This app is exactly what I've been wanting!  This replaced 3 other apps.

helpful_reviews.title: Must have App
helpful_reviews.author: Maddie TAJ
helpful_reviews.content: I have been using this app for years and love it. I have two autoimmune disorders which require me to go to numerous doctors during the year. I totally depend on Capzule to keep me organized. When I’m referred to a new doctor, I have all my medications listed and history of my past medical procedures etc to review with doctor. I recently had problems with my iPhone 6 which made me get a new phone an iPhone 8. I had not been able to update my old phone for some time so I had not had any problems with Capzule. However with the iPhone 8 my Capzule would not work and I was lost!!  After much searching I found an updated app in the App Store and luckily I had backup in my cloud so I was able to restore everything to my new phone Praise the Lord! This app is awesome. Everyone needs it.

helpful_reviews.title: Best Medical app ever!
helpful_reviews.author: California Teaqueen
helpful_reviews.content: I have used Capzule for several years to keep track of medical information for family and friends. I tried several apps before settling on this one. I like how all the information is gathered in one place and it is easy to access. I use it all the time for every appointment, Information on meds and contact information. I love how you can attach pictures and documents. As said, everything is all in one place and that makes it super easy. I have been at Stanford and UCSF using this app and medical staff were very impressed!

helpful_reviews.title: Super App
helpful_reviews.author: Minutemanjim
helpful_reviews.content: I have used this app for a few years now and I have all of our family’s medical history in one spot. Doctors are amazed how much information I readily have on hand. This is the best personal health record I found to date. Not thrilled with the ads popping up now and don’t plan on paying a recurring fee to get rid of them. I guess it is just business. I can live with them. Again, best app to record and track your family’s medical history. Would highly recommend it.

helpful_reviews.title: Thank you, thank you, thank you

helpful_reviews.title: Lost data
helpful_reviews.author: TNT5506
helpful_reviews.content: Initially, I bought this at version 1.  I liked it but only needed to access it once or twice a year. So, when the iOS 11 update came out I was unaware that the app would not work. Fast forward to post iOS 11 update and version 1 no longer works. No backup of my data and can’t find a way to access or import the data to version 2. Poor planning on my part and the developers. They should have made it so we wouldn’t lose the data.  Also, I paid for the first version. Since iOS 11 and up do not support that version, it irritates me that I now must pay again (if I want to lose the adds) for a subscription. Wrong, just wrong.

helpful_reviews.content: My husband and I have used and relied on Capsule to maintain our medical records for over 5 years. helpful_reviews.title: Stunningly Awful!!!!  It was such a great App.
helpful_reviews.author: CathieLB
helpful_reviews.content: Hard to believe, but this app’s performance just goes from poor to very, very, bad.  And it was such a wonderful piece of software back in the day.  So sad.  I can no longer backup data - not in Google Drive or Dropbox, Clicking on Airdrop just causes the app to crash, and now not even emailing works!  The email is never sent.  So no more sharing between devices.  It has to be manually entered on each one!  Either fix the app so it works properly or just put it out of our misery!!!!

helpful_reviews.title: Great Program
helpful_reviews.author: eriddle
helpful_reviews.content: This is the best medical record I have found on IOS. The only draw back is that sometimes there is an issue with merging data between two devices in fact the other day I did that and it crashed the program on both devices and to reinstall then restore from back. helpful_reviews.title: CAUTION you will Lose your medical records!!!
helpful_reviews.author: urbanjalapeno
helpful_reviews.content: The idea behind this app is great and there is certainly a need given modern medicine BUT their execution is HORRIBLE. After using the app for a year or so there was an update and “Poof” all our records were gone and could no longer be recovered.  What happens next?? Nothing. You start over. There is no customer service, there is no phone number. Your records are simply gone. Think about it. You spend the time and energy to consolidate all your records in one place and then one day after an iOS update or app update they’re gone!

helpful_reviews.title: Baski Phamacist!

Easier to email the information to healthcare professionals from app. You can manage your family’s healthcare at one place. User friendly!

helpful_reviews.title: Update removed my paid features
helpful_reviews.author: AnimeImp
helpful_reviews.content: I paid for Capzule 1.0. I was overjoyed to see that they put out 2.0 so I would not lose it during the 11.0 upgrade. But they put out a add supported only version, ignoring those of us who paid $4.99 for the previous add free app. And when you go to app support, you are directed to their website with *no* way to contact them via email or form. So the took our money and then put out a mandatory upgrade that removed the paid features, and I am left with no choice but to leave a 1 star review.

If I have already updated to iOS 11, Is it possible to transfer information from the previous app to the new 2.0 version? I am worried it will not be able to access my original data.   Thank you for your help!!  UPDATE: Thank you for the quick response. I did back it up, but to iCloud. Will I be able to access it from iCloud?

helpful_reviews.title: Best in class though still a few hiccups
helpful_reviews.author: PnUy8vtn6wh3
helpful_reviews.content: No other medical record application comes even close to the capabilities in Capzule. I use it for all medical consultations and demonstrate it for interested health provider personnel. Most of them are amazed and some express interest in possibly getting it. We are all appreciative of the local only data storage and no Internet connection required.  Two gotchas at this point (01/08/2018) with version 2.0.1 (iPad): a) no direct contact with any application support personnel, b) Dropbox and local network HTTP functionality doesn’t appear to work. Use of Dropbox pops up authorization window but no backup is ever performed (screen blinks after allowing access and then drops back to Capzule). Initiating local network transfer fails as Capzule never opens up the designated port.  b) HTTP connectivity: issue resolved - desktop multi-network control sequence Dropbox connectivity: issue not resolved; even after rebooting Capzule client devices the Dropbox Authorization process appears to work but no backup file is uploaded; screen immediately returns to Capzule

helpful_reviews.title: Love this app, but some issues and enhancements
helpful_reviews.author: mikeindm
helpful_reviews.content: Love the app, glad to see it back. I can deal with the ads, but would like to see a new pay version.  DropBox isn’t working for me. When I go into the tools or the backup, it asks me to allow the program to access Dropbox but it never lets me do a backup. I can backup to Google Drive with no problem.   I would like to see a way to remove data. I track my blood sugar and insulin usage daily. That’s 365 entries in a year and all I really need access to is the most recent 90-120 entries. Maybe a way to delete by date range? Or even a way to quickly mark a screen full of entries to delete.   Finally, I would like to store templates separately from my data. Lacking a way to mass delete data, I was thinking I could copy a template into self monitoring and call it Diabetes 2017, then copy it in as Diabetes 2018 and simply delete 2017 at some point. Thanks!

helpful_reviews.title: Still no Dropbox Backup
helpful_reviews.author: Screen Walker
helpful_reviews.content: I’ve had this program for a long time and it’s great. Very useful & largely functional. But one concern is always, how to make sure your info is secure beyond just living on your phone?   I like to backup to a separate iPad when possible using Dropbox. That quit working a few weeks ago. The developer released an upgrade that was supposed to fix that. But now when I try the backup, I get sent to my Dropbox app to approve Capzule’s access. When I click to Allow, I get sent right back to the Capzule app with no backup happening. Try the backup again, get sent back to Dropbox again to allow access. OVER AND OVER. Something is not communicating right between those two. Please help!  Edit to add: developer contacted me, I can’t respond by e-mail or on their website though - only though the App Store on my phone, which I hate. Anyway: tried closing and launching both apps in various orders, same result. Deleted Dropbox & re-installed it, same result. Tap settings -> cloud symbol under Backup -> Dropbox; Dropbox launches and says “Capzule PHR Free would like access to files & folders in your Dropbox” -> tapping Allow causes the “Authorizing” box to momentarily appear, then Capzule reopens to the account page and the News folder flashes blue two times... but the only message in the folder is the Version 2.0.1 announcement. If I try to backup again the whole process repeats again. This is on an iPhone SE running 11.1.1 although I believe I was having difficulty backing up back on iOS 10. The newer version of Capzule seems to have introduced this endless loop though.

name: Health Tracker & Manager for iPhone - Personal Healthbook App for Tracking Blood Pressure BP, Glucose & Weight BMI
description: Health Tracker PRO is the most comprehensive and complete health tracking application available on the App Store which includes all the three common health problems which can be tracked at home:  * Blood Sugar * Blood Pressure - Systolic, Diastolic, Resting Heart Rate (Pulse) and Mean Arterial Pressure * Body Mass Index - Weight, Height and BMI   Why buy three different apps to track BP, Sugar and BMI individually when you can have all of them packed in one and better than that - for a price which is less than half of all of them put together.  The application interface is designed with ease of use in mind and is completely self explanatory. You would be up and running as soon as you start using it for the first time.  Check out the screenshots of the application below and you will know what we mean.  The Dashboard provides a quick snapshot of your last readings under various categories and a clearly indicates the values that are under acceptable ranges and the ones which are not.  Health Tracker PRO has individual screens for each of these categories and the inferences are color coded to give a fair understanding of potentially risky values and safe limits. The application automatically computes inferred values like Mean Arterial Pressure and Body Mass Index based on the values entered thus making it easy for you and your doc to quickly understand your health condition.   A separate charting page shows health trends in a visual graph which can be toggled to see individual values, switch between ranges and a snapshot of the screen taken and stored on your device for future reference.  The carefully designed "Email Reports" feature allows you to email selected or all recorded values to your doctor or to your own email address. You can as well select the period for which you want to send the records for.  Want more? You can also put in individual Notes for each of these readings to keep a note for yourselves or for your doctor about the type of reading (fasting sugar etc.,) or virtually anything else which you want to keep a note for yourselves or for your doctor.  Each readings have individual indicators to show the time and date of the readings.  Key features include:  - A simple and intuitive user interface. - Color coded values and indicators to get an immediate sense of values. - An elegant dashboard which shows your last readings and if they were under control. - Ability to track Blood Sugar/Diabetes - Ability to track Blood Pressure - Systolic, Diastolic, Pulse Rate - Automatic computation of Mean Arterial Value which is a key indicator of one's heart's health. - Ability to track Weight & Height. - Automatic computation of Body Mass Index (BMI) which is a key indicator of obesity.  - Elegant graphs to show individual health trends  - Snapshot feature to store the graphs as pictures for reference - Customizable date export feature which allows sending the recorded readings to yourselves or your doctor.  The application was developed keeping a common man in mind and hence sports a very simple but elegant design which is easy to use and yet functional.   Start using HealthTracker PRO today and see for yourselves how easy it is to keep track and get insights into your health condition and finally take corrective steps to improve your health.   *** WE NEED YOUR VALUABLE FEEDBACKS ***  Our aim is to constantly keep improving this application to include more features and to improve existing ones based on your feedbacks. Keep sending us feedbacks, criticisms or any pain points you have with the application and we will make sure we get them right in the next updates.

recent_reviews.content: There should be one screen for input all the data and then store data and display the graphs later. When entering input such dates, or weight then the app uses its own brain for instance if you wish to enter the time when you checked your sugar levels even though you remember the time best of luck in entering (or I should say save) it. Most of all this app does is to help to keep the logs in place when seeing the doctor instead of searching wallet/purse or pockets for stickies or post-it notes.

recent_reviews.title: Great app
recent_reviews.author: Ms V61
recent_reviews.content: Keeps me from scrabbling to find scraps of paper that I've written my numbers on.  Now I go to the doctor zinc pull up my app and it's all there.

recent_reviews.title: Great potential, sorely lacking support
recent_reviews.author: FLladydoc
recent_reviews.content: I need an update and none is available. Input weight will not change, nor height from day to day. It just won't take the data.  I don't mind the wheel and BP graph is nice.  I would like to recommend to my patients but can't. Fix it gentlemen/ladies!

recent_reviews.title: Potentially great, but right now, a waste of money
recent_reviews.author: Tom McElvy
recent_reviews.content: This app has a LOT of potential, but the developer seems to care less.  I say that, because they have not responded to ANY emails I have sent.  1.  The dashboard - it only displays the latest entry for a metric.  It should be showing a total average.  Additionally, to select a metric for entry, you have to find it on a little menu on the bottom.   We should be able to just touch that section on the dashboard.  2.  No provision for mass data import, in order to bring old info from another program in.  Export seems to be limited to sending an email to yourself.  It seriously needs a inport/export component.  3.  The use of wheels for data entry is insane.  Some entries can vary widely, and it would be more efficient to use a keypad for the numeric entries.  Fast, simple, and easy to work with.  If the author makes these mods, I believe I could give it 5 stars.  But not until then.

recent_reviews.title: Dont by this app until it is straightened out (VER 1.3)
recent_reviews.author: emsi candidate
recent_reviews.content: You need a weight resolution of tenths of a pound. Full pounds is not good enough. I thought that I had the perfect app until I paid the money and discovered this. Pretty expensive not to have that resolution on the pounds. Please fix this and you will get five stars from me. (UPDATE) Upon further examination I find that the data that I enter is changed, somewhat arbitrarily. I enter 221 and 67 inches and it shows up as 220 and 66 inches. What is up with that. This app needs some work. I would guess internally it is storing things in kg and meters and the conversions to pounds and inches are causing some issues. Likely because of the internal resolution it is being stored in. Just my belief.

recent_reviews.title: Buyer beware
recent_reviews.author: mrstevee
recent_reviews.content: Only goes to 300lbs, will not let you edit an entry.  All not good

recent_reviews.title: Overall, okay but...
recent_reviews.author: PRbuick
recent_reviews.content: Still needs some tweaks. First, you need the ability to edit previous entries. I realized, after I clicked "save," that I must have inadvertently moved my height dial when entering my weight--now the graph for my BMI on that date takes an odd turn, as well as my height line.   Speaking of the height curve--it's totally unnecessary. This data point should be set on the same screen where we set our unit preferences. It certainly doesn't need its own number wheel next to the weight wheel, nor its own line on the BMI chart-- I think it's safe to assume that this is fairly constant in most people and if, for some reason, it must be corrected, it should be done in the settings menu.   On the plus side, I think the navigation and data entry is very easy and simple, and the adjustable graph function is very nice and easy to read.

recent_reviews.title: Needs Work
recent_reviews.author: dwpda
recent_reviews.content: Standard for blood sugar doesn't take into account when it was taken - can't edit values

recent_reviews.title: Con
recent_reviews.author: Pkgro
recent_reviews.content: This app does not have any editing features.  And you can not go back and add earlier test or weight results.

recent_reviews.title: Great App
recent_reviews.author: Travis Donaho
recent_reviews.content: I've found only minor problem in the graphing of systolic and diastolic , their colors are not properly set with right word.  As for the rest of the App, I can't help but love it.

recent_reviews.title: Pro?
recent_reviews.author: whitedove22
recent_reviews.content: Only goes to 300 lbs. Can not edit date or time. Correct these and get 5 stars.  Hmm goes to excel but 2 diff files. One for bp and one for sugar. Would rather both be on one file to print out. Why waste paper. And it will be a hassel printing out 2 diff files. Hope I don't regret buying this. But probly will. Unless updated very soon will stay at 3  think green

helpful_reviews.title: Clean simple easy and tracks the 3 things I care about
helpful_reviews.author: pixelnpaper
helpful_reviews.content: I love how clean and simple this app is! I have been using it for over a year now and have gotten rid of 85 lbs by changing my food. It is fast and easy each day to record the only 3 things I am tracking- glucose, weight/BMI and blood pressure. The dashboard shows green indicators for when the daily measurement is in the healthy range. Love this app. The only things I would ask them to improve is 1- let it talk to the Apple Health app, and 2- don't try to fit BMI and weight on the same graph because the range is too huge.

helpful_reviews.author: KR LLC

Overall pretty happy but hope it grows.

name: Sanford
description: The Sanford Health App is a convenient way to manage your health information in one place. The app includes integrated access to My Sanford Chart, and a variety of solutions which are free to use and available 24/7.   •  Easy-to-use features include: •  Find a doctor and view patient satisfaction ratings •  Find a location near you, and get directions •  View wait times •  View your medical records •  Access test results •  Schedule appointments and receive reminders •  Schedule a virtual visit •  Securely message your doctor •  Request prescription renewals or refills •  Pay your bill •  Upload health and fitness data, including data from the “Apple Health app”, when enrolled in self- tracking programs  *Access to your medical records requires you to have a My Sanford Chart account.   You can create a My Sanford Chart account by selecting Sign-Up Online at: www.mysanfordchart.org

name: PortalConnect
description: Welcome to PortalConnect, a free app that allows you to use your iPhone to access and update your personal health record as well as :   • Keep your account information up to date with your physician’s office • Engage in secure messaging with your physician  • Review notes from your past appointments • Review Library files and lab results shared by your physician  Having unparalleled, 24-7 access to your physician and to your personal health record through PortalConnect requires a subscription service. Check with your doctor’s office for details on how to enroll.   Making Health Care Easier  --  With access to your personal health record (PHR) through PortalConnect, you can quickly recall past procedures, physician recommendations, lists of your current and former medications and much more. Having this consolidated record on hand makes it easy to communicate with specialists and other medical professionals you see in addition to your primary care physician. Now, you’re all on the same page.    Need help?  -- Visit the Support site at http://portalconnect.net/support, send an email to info@portalconnect.net or contact the team at 1-866-779-1526.

recent_reviews.title: So bad it's hard to put into words
recent_reviews.author: The Sidewinder Three-Thousand
recent_reviews.content: UPDATE: Now even worse! Does not work for iOS 8. Crashes every time. Do these clowns have ZERO pride? They charge my doctor a lot of money to provide this service and they are operating in BAD FAITH! This is how people communicate with their doctors. Shameless.  -------- This app is a new low in bad design, bugs, and crashing/freezing. If your Doctor uses this company for medical records, do not pay for the service if you want ANY mobile functionality.   Their website uses Flash, so this app is supposed to "fill in the gap" for mobile users. It doesn't. Even sending your doctor a simple email is a frustrating chore that yields unreliable results. The cursor often disappears, making it almost impossible to edit or type, and if you have a conversation going with the provider you can only see the last email in that conversation. A complete and utter joke.   - Don't waste time with this app. It may actually make you sicker. - Don't pay for a Hello Health medical records subscription. Any tech company that embraces Flash and doesn't build their web services for mobile first is wildly incompetent, and unworthy of safeguarding your medical information. - Tell your doctor to find a new medical records provider.

recent_reviews.title: Buggy and Crashes
recent_reviews.author: JulesFrog
recent_reviews.content: My doctor, who I like very much, decided to go with PortalConnect. So far, I must say the service is a disappointment.  The app crashes quite often on my iPhone 4S when trying to open labs. If it doesn’t crash, it just sits there and does nothing. So, I have to go to my desktop to retrieve the document (not everybody has a desktop nowadays). By the way, not that it’s related to the app, the desktop experience is far from being intuitive and is built entirely in Flash.  Anyway, this lack of performance worries me when it comes to have my medical information hosted with this company. If the code is buggy, is my information safe? I doubt. I hope my doctor find a new platform soon.

name: CareSync | Care Coordination
description: CareSync makes it simple to access, organize, and securely share you and your loved ones' important health information.   • Access your family’s complete medical record when you need it the most. • Med reminders & measurements: Track the meds you take, your blood pressure, glucose, weight, & more, then combine it with your medical information. • Prepare for appointments:  Organize questions and send information to your doctor in advance. • Get more out of appointments:  Manage tasks, documents, photos, and even voice recordings at the visit. • Get better care:  Your doctors need all your information to give the best treatment.  Send Care Reports to make sure your doctor understands your current medical information and is equipped with relevant summaries of your visit history. • Caregiver?  Care for a loved one from anywhere by entering information before visits, sharing relevant summaries with your loved one's doctors, and finding out what happened at the visit.   Want us to enter your information for you?  Simply select Upgrade from the main menu or Request Records from any single completed appointment, and CareSync Plus will get the records and enter a summary of the provider’s notes (in-app purchase).   CareSync never diagnoses or treats patients.  Data is stored on a secure, HIPAA-compliant platform, and users determine how their information is shared.

recent_reviews.title: Amazing!
recent_reviews.author: Handsnotfull
recent_reviews.content: CareSync was able to the retrieve medical records for our adopted child that our agency was unable to get. The app helps me coordinate my childâ€™s care among a team of 8 specialists. Thank you for helping us keep our child healthy!

recent_reviews.title: I like where their going, but...
recent_reviews.author: DJ Hunt
recent_reviews.content: In the past I would have given this app ra;ve reviews, alas yesterday, June 30, 2018, I found out that the CareSync Developers have been disbanded and the doors are closed.  Unless other developers pick up this app, I tend to believe that they will shut down their Data Server some time in the near future.  Is there a similar medical record keeping application that will Import the CareSync Data?

recent_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for!
recent_reviews.author: Bebkie
recent_reviews.content: I highly recommend this app to everyone. It helps me keep track of all my familyâ€™s medical information. I added my doctors and medications and everything fell into place. I use it daily to log my symptoms, take medications, check for appointments and add my blood pressure. It helps me to keep organized. I love that I can add appointments and have them sync to my calendar. Itâ€™s not a perfect app, but itâ€™s the best I could find and believe me I have tried a lot of them.

recent_reviews.title: Data disappears
recent_reviews.author: MountainPark
recent_reviews.content: App for both iPad and iPhone is unstable. The family members I have added, including the patient for whom I am caregiver, disappear. I have to turn off and then back on my device in order for family members to reappear. This has happened repeatedly in the first 12 hours of downloading this app.

recent_reviews.title: Love the updates!
recent_reviews.author: FLGirlTampa
recent_reviews.content: I love the ability to track pain and overall well being. We try to do this to help the doctor see the patterns and because it is hard to remember. This along with the Timeline of my history that I can share with my doctor and the visit recording are my favorites things.

recent_reviews.title: Very Frustrating!
recent_reviews.author: Colorado Gramdmother
recent_reviews.content: This app is exactly what I want to use, but the information I enter just disappears. For awhile it's there, but then it disappears. If I delete the app and reinstall, the info will be there for a day and then disappear again. No help when I called support.

recent_reviews.title: Love - but update please.
recent_reviews.author: leelpatt
recent_reviews.content: I have been using this app for over a year now. I love all this app can do. It really helps me keep track of everything in one place. However, it could use some updates. I hope the developer hasn't dropped the ball on this one.

recent_reviews.title: Poor excuse for a time saving health tracker
recent_reviews.author: owndao
recent_reviews.content: Spent 3 hours last night trying to get this obsolete app to exchange data with my diabetes health tracking app that supports Health Kit as do all the measurement apps I use. This one supports about 5 apps via some other, apparently little used protocol. I've examined two of those apps and find them as bad or worse than this. The communication is Internet connection dependent even between apps on the same device! As for communicating with my physician, I'm at the mercy of text-only communication. Strictly "stone knifes and bear skins", state of the art 1970. To the distributor, please update the app to support Apple's Health frameworks ASAP. This apps functionality would be more efficiently served by a paper labbook, a xerox machine and the US mail.

recent_reviews.title: An inexpensive way to tackle rising healthcare costs
recent_reviews.author: co18co
recent_reviews.content: Each year, our healthcare expenses increase and we are forced to pay an increasing amount of attention to the healthcare we consume.  CareSync has helped me gather all of my family member's health records, and has made them useful to me- they are on my iPhone. I have recently shared up-to-date immunizations with my son's pediatrician, avoided duplicate (expensive) tests at the ER, and was able to share concise clinical updates with my primary care doctor.  Everybody is in the loop, my doctors treat me with respect, and I know the CareSync team is working on my behalf.  Highly recommend for anybody coordinating care for loved ones or managing chronic illness.

recent_reviews.title: My doctor believed me!
recent_reviews.author: BondGirlLisa
recent_reviews.content: I have been going to the doctor for a long time for a chronic condition.  Every time I see a new specialist, I have to start over with my story.    I started using CareSync and took the information with me to the next visit. No more questions, no more eye-rolling, no more starting over with the same labs and treatments. She saw it in black & white (I faxed my records from the app) and said, "Oh, you really have had all this."  My visits are productive, I go less often, and I'm taking less medicine now that I'm communicating effectively.

recent_reviews.title: So confusing, you'd think they did it on purpose
recent_reviews.author: davidbressler
recent_reviews.content: I can never quite find my prescriptions. Then, when I find them they show as not taken even though I know I hit "took" on the notification.  Turns out, even though they display Apple Watch notifications they don't support them (whatever that means). So basically the app doesn't work for prescription tracking.  Looks like they've taken a web app and dummies up an iPhone app. Find a company willing to write a real app instead of these guys.

recent_reviews.title: Pure awesomeness
recent_reviews.author: SoCalMJM
recent_reviews.content: I am so happy that I have this app because it helps me care for my mom who has a few big health problems we are managing. If/when she goes to the doctor or even the hospital, I feel good knowing they can see records from her multiple doctors. We stopped repeating tests and our last hospital visit seemed shorter because of that. Also her records don't get archived after 3 or 7 years, they are here forever so her doctors will be able to see a full history for her.  I like that Either of us can log her meals, and wellness daily. It's quick and easy on an iPad or phone. It also will help her doctors see patterns and know what is and isn't working for her. This app gives me peace of mind knowing mom is getting the best complete healthcare. Finally. It is important for me to share my review because I think it has the potential to help a lot of other caregivers out there like me.

recent_reviews.title: An amazing app
recent_reviews.author: Shining_Iris
recent_reviews.content: I absolutely love this app and the services offered by CareSync. As a patient and a mother I love that I have access to my health records and my family's all in one place.

recent_reviews.title: Our solution to manage care coordination.
recent_reviews.author: co18co
recent_reviews.content: The CareSync app and services help me every single day. The CareSync team is available 24/7 to take my calls, and answer my messages.  They schedule doctorâ€™s appointments, and help me make sure the right information is delivered to the right people.  The app is easy to use, and I have amazing information with me at all times. And itâ€™s SO collaborative - everybody who needs to see my health information has access - but it still is secure. If youâ€™re managing a chronic illness, or taking care of a loved one, the money spent on their premium services pays for itself in less than a month!

recent_reviews.title: Still lovin' it

recent_reviews.content: Amazing app, and great customer service makes me love this app and its creators.
