name: Dyrii Journal
description: Dyrii is an unusual journaling tool for life loggers, travelers, quantified self-enthusiasts, and practically anyone looking to record key moments of their life. It supports both active and passive (auto) journaling and is perfect for recording things retroactively.   With Dyrii, you can take rich text entries containing inline photos, audio, video, location geo-tags, health/mood tags, and weather information. You can even capture handwritten entries using Apple Pencil on iPad.  Here are some usage examples: - Write privately instead of on social media. - On busy days, capture photos, audio, video on the go. - Automatically log all the places you visit in a day - Keep notes on your health and mood. - Effortlessly write using a library of templates specialized for dream notes, gratitude, annual resolutions, CBT, Health & wellness etc.   >> KEY FEATURES: • Timeline for all your private posts and activities.  • Record rich text, photos, audio, video, sketches, handwritten notes.  • Advanced Editor with inline formatting and multiple attachments.  • Automatic Journal to keep a log of all the places you visit each day.  • Perspectives - provides various views into your data such as Time Travel, Map View, Places Visited etc. • Sketch Library - gain full access to sketch backgrounds.  • Day/Week View to easily glimpse through your days. • Tags for organizing and indexing your own way • Health & Mood tracker - to keep notes about health incidents • Creative Slate to sketch, doodle, or create handwritten notes with the Apple Pencil • Sync your data across Mac, iPhone, and iPad • Private Storage to securely store your data in your iCloud Account • Offline Mode to store data locally on the device for additional privacy • Other features such as Passcode & Touch ID, Reminders, Print to PDF, and import data from other apps   Terms of Use: https://dyrii.com/terms Privacy Policy: http://dyrii.com/privacy   >> SUPPORT COMMUNITY We'd love to answer your questions or just hear what you think about Dyrii.   Find us online at: Support Center: http://community.dyrii.com Twitter: http://twitter.com/dyrii  Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/dyriiapp/

recent_reviews.title: Refund
recent_reviews.author: EliteSparkZz
recent_reviews.content: Hello. I just purchased this app by accident. I didn’t know it costed 10 dollars. Can I get a refund?

recent_reviews.title: Best journaling app for iCloud
recent_reviews.author: Zendevote
recent_reviews.content: Nice journaling app that keeps all my data on my iCloud. I also love using its Apple Pencil feature on iPad.

recent_reviews.title: Lots to learn
recent_reviews.author: witzed
recent_reviews.content: Documentation is very poor. How can something this simple be so badly explained...

recent_reviews.title: Decent...but be aware
recent_reviews.author: tacgroup2
recent_reviews.content: As far as journaling apps go, this is definitely a nice one! Primarily because its one of the few that has pen support and, for those of us who like to take advantage of the benefits of actually writing instead of typing, this is an awesome feature! It has several other nice features like logging location, photo and video adding, tags, etc. All pretty standard stuff we’d expect in 2018 from an electronic journaling app, right?  Here’s the rub... I’ve been using the app daily for 2 weeks now. I’ve been successful at journaling without any issues maybe 50% of those days. The app frequently does odd things like not saving your entry or, after saving and then trying to edit your post and add to it, not saving any of the additional writing, which may be several pages worth! I’ve accidentally hit the new page arrow at the bottom with my palm, even though I have the palm rejection icon off, and then when I hit delete to delete the new page it deletes my whole entry. Maybe a dumb decision on my part but it would’ve been good to know that deleting an unwanted page also deletes all of your work to that point. When I first started using the app I couldn’t add photos. Now I can add photos but the experience is a bit janky and there’s no easy way to move the photos around in your post without ultimately screwing up your post and be careful...this is when you’re most likely tp delete your whole post...again!!!  I’ve submitted help requests a couple times and have received some response, thank you for that, but have received no responses after several days on my deleted posts issue. I can see the whole post in the timeline on the left but when I click on it to open it and edit it, there is only a half page of writing...out of 3 pages!! Very disappointing.   Oh well, onward and upward I guess. I’ve moved my journaling back to OneNote again as I am a tad more confident in that piece of software.  Maybe one day, if they can make Dyrii a little more user friendly, reliable, and stable, I’ll be back. Until then...

recent_reviews.title: Beautiful writing solution
recent_reviews.author: Photo_op
recent_reviews.content: Finally! A full throated journaling app. However, calling it JUST a journaling app does it an injustice. It does so many things WELL, that I may be able to shelve as many as 50% of the apps I have on my iPad. AMAZING and thank you!

recent_reviews.title: Best Journal App out there
recent_reviews.author: SDfromSD
recent_reviews.content: I have been using this App for about 1 month and love it! I like the daily quotes, I like the photo sync, and really like the simplicity of navigation. I came over from Day One classic and did not upgrade to their recent version. I hope this App sticks around a very long time. Thank you to the developer(s)!

recent_reviews.title: Too much friction - not for me
recent_reviews.author: Bill.who
recent_reviews.content: Like so many others, I’ve been looking for a Day One Classic replacement.  There are a lot of things that I would like to see in such an app, but the first thing I want in a journal is the ability to easily write (or otherwise create) an entry. Dyrii doesn’t do that.  Compare creating an entry on Classic to creating an entry with  Dyrii.  Day One classic.  Open the app. Press + Write entry (your first line is your title, which can be changed)  Dyrii Open the app Press + Select from a screenful of icons representing, I think, a mixed bunch of entry methods and tags Start writing (note that there is a separate title field)  Of you want to add a photo to a written entry, Classic: tap on the camera symbol at the bottom of the entry. Dyrii: ?, tho’ you can insert from the menu on the desktop version.   The extra steps are not terrible, but they create enough friction that I’m less likely to use it regularly. For people who sit down once a day to write, the features that this app offers might be compelling, but for me those features are meaningless because I won’t have enough entries to make them worthwhile.   A less important, but equally personal criticism: I really dislike the icon. The color seems muddy and the design is busy.   Sadly, deleting.

recent_reviews.title: Why only show the best reviews?
recent_reviews.author: The Last Shott
recent_reviews.content: At the time of this writing, there are 17 reviews. However only 12 are readable. Any review 3 stars or below are not readable. That along makes me not trust you with my personal daily information. I always like to read a few 1-3 star reviews to see if that person has a reasonable compliant. Helps me decide if I should spend $39.99 for a lifetime purchase with your company.

recent_reviews.title: Hands down the best journal app
recent_reviews.author: Prettyby7
recent_reviews.content: I used Day One before it added encryption back in 2014; I had been devoted to MacJournal since and had to look for an alternative because MacJournal for iPad does not seem to work well syncing across platforms. I also tried Journey before Dyrii but ran into immediate road blocks because it only supports import from Day One. I was able to import into Dyrii flawlessly with years of journaling intact. In addition, I am able to use Dyrii on iPad, iPhone and Mac effortlessly! I am simply in love with Dyrii since it works syncing across platforms, easy portability from other journaling apps, geolocation, tagging, and Audio notes – all features that make this a powerful journaling app. I post way more with Dyrii! Thanks for creating such an awesome and superior product, I couldn’t wait to buy the Premium version!

recent_reviews.title: Most Underrated App Ever
recent_reviews.author: Skits164
recent_reviews.content: I really like this app. If I wasn’t looking for an app that I could use on my Mac and my phone, I would of missed it due to the plethora of apps on the iPhone and the fact that there aren’t that many reviews for this one.  This app is password protected, it has unlimited entries, sketching, add afterthoughts on entries, audio, pictures, mood tracker and it is all for free. No tricks or gimmicks. Automatic sync costs a subscription but if you chose to upload both on the iCloud it will sync for free also.   The UI Is simple, easy to navigate and start using. You just click on the + and you can enter a new entry and you can do multiple entries a day. If you want to click into a previous one, it shows the preview. It’s not cluttered, buggy, and it hasn’t crashed on me once. Every time I open the app after going out of it, it opens with a password. Which is perfect. I’m just really happy I came across it and gave it a chance. It is by far better than DayOne or anything else I’ve tried.   I wish it had an option to create different journals besides the one on the timeline. I would definitely pay the annual subscription if there was an option to create new journals and write entries in there.

recent_reviews.title: Feature rich app
recent_reviews.author: LiaVoid
recent_reviews.content: Dyrii has almost everything you could wish for in a journaling app. I was a former Day One user until the lack of sketching(feel a need to sketch out my dream when I wake up and struggle to find words) and iCloud sync started to bug me. And of course the 10 photos limit and the lack of video support. Importing my Day One entries is seamless and “Perspectives” is a nice feature. Multiple journals would be nice and I saw a few bugs here and there but I hope the developers will work out soon. Overall I am satisfied with the app and the subscription.

recent_reviews.title: Suits my needs perfectly
recent_reviews.author: 4mrMarineOfcr
recent_reviews.content: I’ve been using the free versions of both the mobile and desktop Dyrii for about two months. Using the journals is straight-forward and easy to navigate. Being retired, my journal needs are rather simple. Just document discussions with medical consultants, travel agents, remodeling contractors, etc. and then be able to refer back to those entries at a later date. My Dyrii journals serve that purpose perfectly.

recent_reviews.title: Amazing Application
recent_reviews.author: BigMcGuire55
recent_reviews.content: Finally some real Day One competition! The developer is one of a kind - actually listens to their customers and implements what they want in under a week. I imported 1200 Day One entries and 1300+ photos. 780MB of MY data in iCloud. I love it. I'm a proud premium member. Thanks!

recent_reviews.title: Great app, responsive developers, and iCloud Sync
recent_reviews.author: moklok
recent_reviews.content: After my previous journaling app stopped supporting iCloud Sync, I didn't have high hopes of finding a replacement. Happy to say that Dyrii has exceeded my expectations. Not only do they support syncing entries through iCloud rather than forcing you to store sensitive data on their servers, but the app itself is great! Modern design, responsive, and lots of thoughtful touches that I haven't seen in other journaling apps yet. When I had a suggestion for a new feature, the developers engaged right away and have been working to implement it in the next version. I cannot recommend Dyrii highly enough!

recent_reviews.title: Love the concept!
recent_reviews.author: Djedwards007
recent_reviews.content: Great start!  Looking forward to video entries longer than one minute please.  Excited to see how this app matures!

recent_reviews.title: Amazing app
recent_reviews.author: Lijo.geca
recent_reviews.content: Growing up, I read somewhere people who keep journal live twice. That got me into journaling but I lost the habit when I became a teenager as I started to worry that someone might read my personal thoughts. Dyrii app has changed my notion. I am back to my habit of writing my entries and moreover it is easier to manage as it is all digital. I can secure it with a passcode and all my posts stay in my iCloud account and not on some unknown server. I can post pictures that only I can see. I can also securely share my posts selectively as PDF exports. The app also lets me record audio, video entires, and do sketches and doodles which I couldn't do before in a journal. My favorite feature is the search and perspective view that lets me instantly find my old entries. I absolutely love this app - 5 stars!

recent_reviews.title: The Best Journal App on App Store!!!!
recent_reviews.author: J rico
recent_reviews.content: I have searched through many journal apps and this is better than all others.  It's better than Day One, better than MacJournal, everything!  From integrated timelines which include milestones, and health updates, to entries which can use video, audio, photos, and drawings...  To being able to tag themes and add emotions, and rate locations you check into, this app has it all!  As a self-quantifier this is the best app i've come across thus far!!!

helpful_reviews.title: Hands down the best journal app
helpful_reviews.author: Prettyby7
helpful_reviews.content: I used Day One before it added encryption back in 2014; I had been devoted to MacJournal since and had to look for an alternative because MacJournal for iPad does not seem to work well syncing across platforms. I also tried Journey before Dyrii but ran into immediate road blocks because it only supports import from Day One. I was able to import into Dyrii flawlessly with years of journaling intact. In addition, I am able to use Dyrii on iPad, iPhone and Mac effortlessly! I am simply in love with Dyrii since it works syncing across platforms, easy portability from other journaling apps, geolocation, tagging, and Audio notes – all features that make this a powerful journaling app. I post way more with Dyrii! Thanks for creating such an awesome and superior product, I couldn’t wait to buy the Premium version!

helpful_reviews.title: Too much friction - not for me
helpful_reviews.author: Bill.who
helpful_reviews.content: Like so many others, I’ve been looking for a Day One Classic replacement.  There are a lot of things that I would like to see in such an app, but the first thing I want in a journal is the ability to easily write (or otherwise create) an entry. Dyrii doesn’t do that.  Compare creating an entry on Classic to creating an entry with  Dyrii.  Day One classic.  Open the app. Press + Write entry (your first line is your title, which can be changed)  Dyrii Open the app Press + Select from a screenful of icons representing, I think, a mixed bunch of entry methods and tags Start writing (note that there is a separate title field)  Of you want to add a photo to a written entry, Classic: tap on the camera symbol at the bottom of the entry. Dyrii: ?, tho’ you can insert from the menu on the desktop version.   The extra steps are not terrible, but they create enough friction that I’m less likely to use it regularly. For people who sit down once a day to write, the features that this app offers might be compelling, but for me those features are meaningless because I won’t have enough entries to make them worthwhile.   A less important, but equally personal criticism: I really dislike the icon. The color seems muddy and the design is busy.   Sadly, deleting.

helpful_reviews.title: Best Journal App out there
helpful_reviews.author: SDfromSD
helpful_reviews.content: I have been using this App for about 1 month and love it! I like the daily quotes, I like the photo sync, and really like the simplicity of navigation. I came over from Day One classic and did not upgrade to their recent version. I hope this App sticks around a very long time. Thank you to the developer(s)!

helpful_reviews.title: Beautiful writing solution
helpful_reviews.author: Photo_op
helpful_reviews.content: Finally! A full throated journaling app. However, calling it JUST a journaling app does it an injustice. It does so many things WELL, that I may be able to shelve as many as 50% of the apps I have on my iPad. AMAZING and thank you!

helpful_reviews.title: Best journaling app for iCloud
helpful_reviews.author: Zendevote
helpful_reviews.content: Nice journaling app that keeps all my data on my iCloud. I also love using its Apple Pencil feature on iPad.

helpful_reviews.title: Refund
helpful_reviews.author: EliteSparkZz
helpful_reviews.content: Hello. I just purchased this app by accident. I didn’t know it costed 10 dollars. Can I get a refund?

helpful_reviews.title: Lots to learn
helpful_reviews.author: witzed
helpful_reviews.content: Documentation is very poor. How can something this simple be so badly explained...

helpful_reviews.title: Decent...but be aware
helpful_reviews.author: tacgroup2
helpful_reviews.content: As far as journaling apps go, this is definitely a nice one! Primarily because its one of the few that has pen support and, for those of us who like to take advantage of the benefits of actually writing instead of typing, this is an awesome feature! It has several other nice features like logging location, photo and video adding, tags, etc. All pretty standard stuff we’d expect in 2018 from an electronic journaling app, right?  Here’s the rub... I’ve been using the app daily for 2 weeks now. I’ve been successful at journaling without any issues maybe 50% of those days. The app frequently does odd things like not saving your entry or, after saving and then trying to edit your post and add to it, not saving any of the additional writing, which may be several pages worth! I’ve accidentally hit the new page arrow at the bottom with my palm, even though I have the palm rejection icon off, and then when I hit delete to delete the new page it deletes my whole entry. Maybe a dumb decision on my part but it would’ve been good to know that deleting an unwanted page also deletes all of your work to that point. When I first started using the app I couldn’t add photos. Now I can add photos but the experience is a bit janky and there’s no easy way to move the photos around in your post without ultimately screwing up your post and be careful...this is when you’re most likely tp delete your whole post...again!!!  I’ve submitted help requests a couple times and have received some response, thank you for that, but have received no responses after several days on my deleted posts issue. I can see the whole post in the timeline on the left but when I click on it to open it and edit it, there is only a half page of writing...out of 3 pages!! Very disappointing.   Oh well, onward and upward I guess. I’ve moved my journaling back to OneNote again as I am a tad more confident in that piece of software.  Maybe one day, if they can make Dyrii a little more user friendly, reliable, and stable, I’ll be back. Until then...

helpful_reviews.title: Why only show the best reviews?
helpful_reviews.author: The Last Shott
helpful_reviews.content: At the time of this writing, there are 17 reviews. However only 12 are readable. Any review 3 stars or below are not readable. That along makes me not trust you with my personal daily information. I always like to read a few 1-3 star reviews to see if that person has a reasonable compliant. Helps me decide if I should spend $39.99 for a lifetime purchase with your company.

name: BCM
description: The MphRx Mobile Connect Baylor College of Medicine (BCM) software program allows Radiologists and Physicians to access and view radiology images and reports on the iPhone. The software is powered by MphRx Mobile Connect and supports the following modalities: CR, CT, MG, MR, NM, OT, US and more.    MphRx Mobile Connect provides wireless and mobile access to radiology images and reports using MphRx Secure Private Cloud connected to BCM's RIS and PACS. MphRx Mobile Connect downloads data using encrypted transfer over the wireless and mobile networks.    Features:  - intuitive interface and controls  - secure, encrypted data transfer to the device  - access to radiology images and reports on the device  - supports zoom, scroll and cine loop on the images  - help feature to send messages/escalations to various customer helpdesks  - support for unified search  - auto-logout feature by default enabled  - graphical representation of reports  - print/share/fax support for reports  - push notifications for critical and panic alerts    This application should not be used for diagnostic purposes. It is not intended to replace radiology workstations and should be used only when there is no access to the radiology workstation.    MphRx Cloud is a secure, Internet or Intranet based medical imaging solution that provides viewing and sharing capabilities for medical images, videos and reports.

name: talkPHR
description: Personalized Healthcare. Anywhere. Anytime.  MTBC's talkPHR is a free personal health records app that provides patients a simple and intuitive interface to access important information about their health and physician encounters. Through a single interface, you can access their lab reports, make payments, view claims history, schedule appointments, update their demographics data, and much more.  The talkPHR smartphone app affords patients and related physicians a truly mobile and rich experience. Stay abreast of all latest developments regarding your health and doctor's visits through alerts and smart notifications. CareLogger provides you with the comfort and convenience of staying connected to your doctor's office no matter where you are.    Core Features:  - Appointments: Schedule appointments with your doctor and view appointment history.   - Health History: View records of your assessments, medications, allergies, procedures, immunizations and vital signs.  - Claims History: View information about claims sent on your behalf.  - Lab Reports: View imaging results and clinical test reports sent by your lab.  - Secure Messaging: Communicate securely with your doctor anytime through the inbuilt messaging module.  - Demographics: Conveniently add and modify any personal details anytime.  - Outstanding Balance and Payments: View your outstanding balances and pay securely through the app.  - Account Management: Manage health information of your family members from within your own account.
